loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes de este comité formaron el grupo llamado San Antonio, todas y cada una de ellas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante, y con ello poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
La señora Lorenza es una de las Integrantes  del  comité, ella se dedica a hacer comidas varias, que ella misma se dedica a vender, y que después sale a vender en forma ambulante. Comenta que le gustaría poder seguir con su trabajo, y es por ello que se esta esforzando, ya que quiere crecer en su emprendimiento.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para hacer comestible y para la compra de frutas para hacer ensalada de frutas para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
This committee has 15 members and is called San Antonio. Every one of them puts forth her best effort to be able to grow and get ahead so they can help their families and loved ones. 

Lorenza is one of the committee’s members and she makes different types of food and then sells it on foot.  She says that she would like to continue this work and is striving toward it.  She also wants to grow in her entrepreneurship.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies to make her food and also buy fruit to sell.  She is grateful for this opportunity to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy fruit and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy millet, peanuts and beans to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy land to start farming. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include utilities and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: El Mirador De Cconchaccalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL MIRADOR DE CCONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina ella es conviviente y tiene 31 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes, ovejas y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes, ovejas y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes,ovejas y gallinas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “El Mirador de Cconchaccalla.” This bank is located in the district of San Jeronima, which is in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

One member of the group, Mrs. Justina is in a common-law marriage, is 43 years old, and has 3 children. She works in her business selling and raising animals. She raises guinea pigs, sheep, and hens, which she raises, fattens, and then sells in different markets. Through this business, she wants her children to finish school, and she wants to take her son forward. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell guinea pigs and hens. 

She requests the loan to buy guinea pigs, sheep, and hens, as well as food for the animals.

The other members in the group have businesses in agriculture, selling cereals, grocery stores, and selling animals. 

The members are thankful to those that contribute to their dream through Kiva, and they promise to comply with the loan repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, sheep, and hens, as well as food for the animals.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children - all of them go to school. She has no additional members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, rice and cooking oil. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy better serving dishes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is thankful that she was previously granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expenses. 
She would now like to apply for an 8,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 
Jennie dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to send her child to school until college to allow her better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items such as cofee, noodles, soda, frozen foods needed in her business.

loans.name: Cerlie

texts.en: Cerlie makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Aloran, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Cerlie has been able to send all her children to school, two of whom are in college right now. Out of the money she has saved, Cerlie purchased a hectare plot. Now, she wishes to plant banana and more dwarf coconuts of a good variety so she can increase her farm's yield. However, Cerlie is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings. She has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings

loans.name: El Arcoiris Group

texts.es:
El Arcoiris es el nombre que eligieron las clientes para identificar al grupo que se conformó en una comunidad productora de caña; sus integrantes son:

Victoria- Abarrotes 
Candelaria- Pasta De Mole
Carmen- Ropa
Guillermina- Calzado Por Catalogo
Teresa- Antojitos 

Doña Victoria está casada con el señor Juan con quien procreó 5 hijos, ella es  una persona alegre y responsable es conocida  como Viky; hace 8 años decidió abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para hacer buen uso de su tiempo y generar ingresos sin salir de casa. Entonces acomodaba la mercancía en una gran mesa, los productos que no cabían los dejaba encima de cajas o de sus sillas. Con el paso del tiempo utilizando las ganancias obtenidas y el apoyo de su esposo esposo, logró construir un pequeño local en la parte frontal de su casa; también colocó algunos estantes clavando tablas a la pared para poder exhibir mejor la mercancía. Esta vez, Viky necesita comprar más abarrotes para mantener variedad en la tienda, comprará: arroz, azúcar, café, frijol, aceite, atún, jamón, queso, salchichas, leche, galletas, papel higiénico y detergente debido a que es la mercancía que más vende. 

Los integrantes se muestran agradecidos por la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo ya que les permitirá seguir creciendo.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de abarrotes de doña Viky quien viste blusa morada y falda blanca.
texts.en:
El Arcoiris is the name these members choose for their group. They live in a cane-producing community, and the members are:

Victoria, groceries

Candelaria, mole pasta

Carmen, clothes

Guillermina, shoes through a catalog

Teresa, snacks

Victoria, known as Viky, is married to Juan and they have five children. She is a happy and responsible person. Eight years ago, she decided to open a small grocery shop to make good use of her time and to earn income without leaving home. So she put the merchandise out on a big table, and products that didn’t fit were left in boxes or put on chairs. After some time, and with her husband’s help, she used her profits to build a small shop in the front of her house. She also made some stands by hanging shelves on the walls so she could display her best merchandise. This time, Viky needs to buy more groceries to keep variety in her shop. She will buy rice, sugar, coffee, beans, cooking oil, tuna, ham, cheese, sausage, milk, cookies, toilet paper, and detergent because these are her best-selling products.

The members are grateful for the opportunity to receive this loan because it will allow them to grow.

*The photo was taken in Viky’s grocery shop. She is wearing a purple shirt and white skirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, beans, cooking oil, tuna, ham, cheese, sausage, milk, cookies, toilet paper, and detergent.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is 36 years old and married. She is from Oroquieta, Philippines. Shirley has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month, and has been doing this type of activity for two years. This is how she helped her husband to sustain their needs. She wants to provide her family a simple yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house. Shirley has recently became an active member of PMPC. Now, she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 30 years old. She is married with one child who is two years old and does not yet go to school. She sells shoes and clothes. With the loan, she would like to buy reams, books, lotion and soaps to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and change her business.

loans.use: To buy reams, books, lotion and soaps to resell.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is 44 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 8 and 16 years, all of whom go to school. She sells clothes and has been in business for 25 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet used the previous loan to buy bulls for slaughtering. 

She is a forty one year old female married with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Juliet operates a butcher shop and has been in that business for the last eleven. She has continued with her dream of educating her children and becoming rich. 

However, she is faced with a difficulty of lack of a preservative machine to keep the meat fresh and seasonality factors. Juliet wants money to buy more bulls for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy bulls for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Suiumkan

texts.ru: Суйумкан 55 лет, вдова, мать 5 детей, младший сын - школьник, живет с Суйумкан , старшие самостоятельные. Суйумкан в качестве основного дохода уже более 10 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Суйумкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 18 овец. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь Суйумкан и ее семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Суйумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи Суйумкан.
texts.en: Suiumkan is 55 years old, a widow, and a mother to 5 children. Her youngest son attends elementary school and lives with her; her eldest son lives independently. As the main source of income for her family, Suiumkan has been practicing livestock breeding for the past 10 years. She started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Suiumkan's hard work, she currently has 18 sheep on her farm. Her average monthly income from this business is 9,000 som (KGS). However, this amount is catastrophically not enough for a decent life for Suiumkan and her family. For the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 35,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and livestock feed. Suiumkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock, which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and livestock feed.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is 21 years old and lives in Ajloun. He is an example of a nosy person because he likes to know and understand everything that can help him recognize the requirements of dealing with people or to know the community requirements. 

He is a cultured guy. Currently he is studying the assets of various religions, as he thinks that will help him to get more knowledge about everything.

Bahaa believes that religions have all the secrets that he wants to know. 

His family is faced with financial difficulties; therefore, he requested an education loan to cover his semester fees.

loans.use: to cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Abd Al Qader

texts.en:
Abd al qader could not complete his study because the financial situation for his family, his father is retired, he has 6 siblings, he wanted to help them to complete their education, so they will have much more good future than Abd al Qader`s future. 
He thought to start his small business, he opened kiosk to sell hot and cold drinks also some sweets and general products.
He asked for a loan to expand his business and develop it also to buy more products to make more kinds of hot drinks , and buy grind coffee maker machine,  that's will help him to get more income so he can help his family.

loans.use: to buy more products to make more kinds of hot drinks , and buy grind coffee maker machine.

loans.name: Maludahan

texts.ru: Малудахан, 56 лет, не замужем, есть 1 ребенок, ему 6 лет. У Малудахан- средне-специальное образование. Она уже 16 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания на одном из рынков города.  Благодаря упорному труду Малудахан, у нее есть товар в обороте на сумму 300,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Малудахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Малудахан планирует откладывать на покупку собственного контейнера.
texts.en: Maludahan is 56 years old and single.  She has one young child who is 6 years old.  Maludahan has a specialized secondary education.  For the past 16 years she has been selling food products at one of the markets, in town.  Thanks to her very hard work, she owns 300,000-som (KGS) worth of merchandise.  In order to further develop her business and increase her inventory, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to buy her own container.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale in order to increase her store's inventory and attract new customers.

loans.name: Zachaes's Group

texts.en:
Zachaes's Group is formed by 8 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Zachaes, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 31 years old, is married and has 2 children. Zachaes has been a farmer for 5 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Zachaes isn’t new to One Acre Fund: he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Zachaes will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Using this loan, Zachaes's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3 acres.

loans.use: buy hybrid seeds, fertilizer and a solar light

loans.name: Lazarus's Group

texts.en:
Lazarus is a 55-year-old proud father of 8 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 9 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Lazarus has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Lazarus described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Lazarus’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and a solar light

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Samuel, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to 2 children. He is known by his community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Samuel joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Samuel plans to buy a cow.

Between the 11 farmers in Samuel's Group, a total of 6.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. So, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul's Group has 15 farmers in the Matete District. Paul is the 38-year-old hardworking group leader. He is married, has 4 children, and has been a farmer for 15 years.

Paul isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Paul will get fertilizer and seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this because  he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Paul's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's Group is formed by 6 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Jane, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 36 years old, married, and has 4 children. Jane has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Jane isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Jane will buy fertilizer, maize seeds and purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Jane's Group will purchase a total of 4 solar lights and use the farming supplies to plant a total of 3 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mathelda's Group

texts.en:
Mathelda is a 42-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a hardworking group leader and represents 10 farmers in the Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mathelda has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mathelda described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to purchase a solar light fertilizer and maize seedlings. The light will enable her children to study after dark. She will use the profits from this season’s harvest to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mathelda’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. She is a 51-year-old married woman with 5 children.

Judith likes to think of herself as a very friendly person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Judith plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Judith’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está felizmente casada y su esposo se dedica al comercio ambulante de hamacas, sus hijos viven ya formaron sus propios hogares, a excepción de uno que aún vive junto con ella y trabaja la agricultura.

Marta, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, las cuales hace en un comal artesanal en su casa todos los días, desde muy temprano se levanta a moler el maíz y una vez tiene la masa, procede junto con una empleada a la elaboración de este alimento típico. 

Cuando era joven trabajó lavando y planchando ropa en diferentes casas, pero luego decidió iniciar su propio negocio y ahora tiene 16 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar una plancha más grande y un granero, para facilitar su trabajo y obtener más producción de tortillas en menos tiempo y el granero para almacenar el maíz destinado para moler.

El sueño más grande que Marta es poder comprar su propio terreno para construir su casa, puesto que donde actualmente vive, es de unos señores que se encuentra en Estados Unidos y ella solo la cuida.
texts.en:
Marta, 54, studied up to sixth grade.  She's happily married and her husband sells hammocks as a street vendor.  Her children already have their own homes, except for one who still lives with her and works in agriculture.

Marta earns a living selling tortillas that she makes every day on a handmade comal in her house.  She gets up very early to grind the corn.  Once she has the dough, she and an employee make this traditional dish.  When she was young she worked washing and ironing clothing in various homes.  Then she decided to start her own business, and now she has been selling tortillas for 16 years.

The loan she has requested is to buy a bigger comal to make her job easier and increase her tortilla production in less time, and a granary to store the corn for grinding.

Marta's biggest dream is to be able to buy her own plot of land to build her house.  Where she currently lives belongs to some people who live in the United States and she's just taking care of it.

loans.use: to buy a bigger comal and a granary

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita started her business in 2007 with her own working capital of $500. She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough money to buy more goods according to people likes. So she had the idea to request a loan of $ 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her inventory management. She said that with borrowed money she could count her income and expenditure in one day.

Juvita is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including salt, candles, cooking oils, toothpaste, detergents, sugar, spices, rice and other things to sell.

She has been busy with her business because she must bring her goods to sell in the market, but she still happy to do that. She also cultivates animals like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy salt, candles, cooking oils, toothpaste, detergents, sugar, spices, rice and other things to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, él tiene 55 años de edad, hombre casado que vive felizmente junto a su esposa y sus 8 hijos, vive en una comunidad de Solola. 

Juan es un hombre que lucha cada día por sostener el estudio de sus hijos, y darles de comer cada día, el trabajo de Juan es la elaboración de diferentes artículos típicos en telar de cintura, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo realiza desde su casa, y eso le da ventaja para estar al pendiente de sus hijos y tener un lugar fijo de trabajo también para atender a su clientela, Juan  con este trabajo genera ingresos para darles prosperidad a sus ocho hijos, Juan por la calidad de trabajo que realiza, es buscado por personas y le hacen muchos pedidos pero lastimosamente él no cuenta con suficiente capital para la compra de materia prima. 

 Juan está ahora en busca de  un préstamo para comprar suficientes  materiales y satisfacer a su clientela. Uno de los sueños de Juan es generar más ingresos cada día para que más al futuro pueda mejorar su vivienda, ya que él necesita tener un hogar para la comodidad de su familia que tanto los quiere.
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking man. He is 55 years old and happily married to his wife. They have eight children and live in the community of Solola.

Juan is a man who strives each day to feed his children and provide for their education. His work involves producing different traditional products with the use of a back strap loom. He enjoys this business since he gets to work at home. This is advantageous since he can look after his children and have an established workplace where he can also attend to his customers.

Through his work, Juan is able to generate income so that he can offer prosperity to his eight children. Due to the quality of his work, his products are sought after and people place many orders. Unfortunately, he does not have sufficient capital for buying materials.

Juan is now seeking a loan in order to buy enough materials so that he can satisfy his customers. One of his dreams is to generate more income each day so that he can improve his home in the future. He needs to have a home that is at a comfort level that his family wants.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her annual memberships with the two other insurance providers, and to cover her marketing workshop dues in New York.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats to raise and sell in the local markets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pesticides and mulch.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha is a 30 year old woman with 4 children, and she lives in Nyamwiharuri B village Kuria East sub-county, Kenya. Martha works as a commercial farmer for a living. Where Martha lives, the community does not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from a local water spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Nyamwiharuri B community had a way to treat their drinking water, this could reduce the cases of water-borne diseases, keeping Nyamwiharuri B community at school and work.

This is why Martha is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of her community. Martha was elected to represent her community as a volunteer promoter. She is not only representing her community on Kiva, but also volunteers her time to educate the people of her community on the importance of safe water and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Martha has volunteered to be a promoter because she envisions a community with clean, safe water.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas, está en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica al comercio posee un negocio propio en su casa también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos para la venta tales como: panificados, verduras, productos de la canasta familiar en general, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group is called Mujeres Unidas (United Women), it's in their fourteenth cycle of their women's communal bank program, where everyone works and helps each other to move forward. They are doing surveys of elimination, where one of the members, Sra. Maria, showed in her last survey that she's at poverty level three, which means that she has been improving her and her family's quality of life.

In the work she does, she says that she makes her living in shopkeeping and has her own store in her home. She also has to highlight the work of the Paraguayan Foundation, who do permanent tracking of capacities and verifications in order to be improving their conditions of life. 

Sra. Maria requests this loan to buy products to sell such as: baked goods, vegetables, and basic goods in general, which she will use to to settle on the plan for her store, which will help to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, vegetables, and basic goods in general.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old, has 2 children and lives in Nyametaburo A Sanchawa village Kuria East Sub-county, Kenya. Elizabeth works as a subsistence farmer for a living. Where Elizabeth lives, her family and the community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from Kemaroa spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Nyametaburo A Sanchawa had a way to treat their drinking water, they could improve the health of their community, keeping children at school and parents at work.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of her community. Elizabeth was elected to represent her community as a volunteer promoter, alongside with Smwel and Eunice. She is not only representing her community on Kiva, but also volunteers her time to educate the people in Nyametaburo A Sanchawa village on the importance of safe water and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Elizabeth wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser will help in fighting diseases, thus improving the health of the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Elizabeth’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Rael's Group

Biasumwa A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a local spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Rael and her community may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Rael works as a commercial farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Rael and 3 other promoters in her community, including, Agnes, Susan and Elizabeth, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Rael will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Rael wants to be a promoter because she believes that the use of chlorine makes drinking water safe.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rael’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.name: Azcurra Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Azcurra, se formo en la ciudad de Caacupé, todas ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias. Son mujeres jefas de familia que han ido mejorando por medio de su esfuerzo y lucha.
Sonia, una de las integrantes, tiene una pequeña despensa, y como anexo n comedor, en el que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día para poder dar sus clientes lo que piden. Ella se define a si misma como una persona que quiere salir adelante y crecer para ser alguien importante en esta vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser: verduras, lácteos, panificados, pollo, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group called Azcurra was formed in the city of Caacupé.  All of them are putting forth their best effort to be able to improve their living conditions for themselves and their families.  They are heads of their family who have been improving through their efforts and struggles.

Sonia, one of the members, has a small general store with a dinning room in it, in which she works everyday from very early in the day to be able to give her customers what they ask for.  She describes herself as a person who wants to get ahead and to grow to become someone important in this life.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying various products for her general store such as vegetables, dairy products, breads, chicken, and other things, in order to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: To buy various products for a general store such as vegetables, dairy products, breads, chicken, and other things to sell.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Alegría está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité, donde forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, en el cual 5 de ellas se encuentran en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir esta en un nivel de pobreza extrema. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo quiere ir mejorando esa situación, sumado a la venta de comidas que ella viene haciendo y con lo cual se gana la vida de una manera honesta y digna.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de producto para las venta de su comida ya sea carne, huevo, verduras aceite etc, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "La Alegría" (Happiness) communal bank is in its second funding cycle with the committee's program.  They are taking part in the Poverty Stoplight Program, and five of their members live in extreme poverty. 
One of the communal bank members is Sra. María.  In the poverty survey, she was determined to be a "level one," which is a level of extreme poverty.  Through effort and constant work, she wants to improve that situation.  She sells food that she, herself, makes, and that is how she earns an honest and respectable living. 
Sra. María is requesting this loan to purchase products for her food sales, whether it be meat, eggs, vegetables or cooking oil.  This will help her to solidify her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase meat, eggs, vegetables, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cereals millet, corn, beans for resale

loans.name: Benita's Group

texts.en:
Benita is 28 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Kegekerege A village in Kenya. Benita works as a subsistence farmer for a living. The community of Kegekerege A village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases like cholera and typhoid. Benita is a friendly member of the community who has been elected promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer promoter, Benita represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Benita and 2 other promoters in her community - James and Samburu - need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Benita wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser will help prevent water-borne diseases like typhoid.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Benita’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water to her community

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a resident of Migina, Rwemikoma in Kiruhura district. She is married and has one child.

Sarah is an agriculturalist who deals in cattle fattening as her main source of income to meet her family’s needs. It is from this that she earns income to provide for her family. She also does cultivation where she gets money to support her business.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to help her buy more cattle for fattening. Her major challenge is drought, which affects her cattle.

Her future plan is to construct a dam for water storage purposes during the dry season so that she can have a buffer for her cattle. She is hard working.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and later sell.

texts.en:

This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Gwitembe C community had a way to treat their drinking water, there would be reduced cases of water-borne diseases, keeping Gwitembe C community at school and work.

This is why Peter is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of his community. Peter was elected to represent his community as a volunteer promoter. He is not only representing his community on Kiva, but also volunteers his time to educate the people of his community on the importance of safe water and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. loans.name: Simion's Group

texts.en:
Simion lives in a home with mud walls, dirt floor and iron roof in Bikonge village in Kuria East Sub-county, Kenya with his family which includes 4 children. The community of Bikonge village collects their drinking water from a local well because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Bikonge’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser program offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. Bikonge community will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Simion has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water to keep themselves and their families healthy. There are two other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Martha and Lucia.

Bikonge community needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Simion believes that the chlorine dispenser will reduce water-borne diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Simion's community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow his community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Exitosas forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una de ellas está poniendo lo mejor de sí para ir superándose y dar a cada familiar todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ancelma, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir en una pobreza extrema. Ella entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, que capacita a cada una y las hace mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Ancelma pide este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Mujeres Exitosas (Successful Women) forms part of the poverty elimination program. Each one of them is putting forth the best of themselves to overcome and give to each family member all that they could not have.

Ancelma is one of the members who, in her last survey, demonstrated a poverty level within level one, that is to say an extreme poverty. In between doing the work that she does, she says that she works selling natural remedies. She also wants to highlight the work that the Paraguaya Foundation does, training all of them and making them improve everyday.

Ancelma requests this loan to buy natural remedies which will help her to cement her business plan and that will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Lambare Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas de Lambare está en su ciclo número 7mo. del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian, que se dedica al reciclaje de productos varios,  ella comenta que se esfuerza cada día para poder mejorar su estilo de vida. Lilian es una mujer muy trabajadora que todos los días busca los productos para poder reciclar, y también se dedica a la compra de materiales reciclables para poder revender y tener un mejor ingreso. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder revenderlos y tener un margen de ganancia. Ella quiere comprar plásticos, aluminio, cartones y otros.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas de Lambare" (United Women from Lambare) communal bank is in its seventh lending cycle with the Women's Committee Program.  All of the women work and help each other to get ahead.  
One of the members is Sra. Lilian.  She makes her living recycling various products.  She says that she works hard every day to improve her standard of living.  Lilian is a very hard-working woman who daily searches out products to recycle.  She also earns her living purchasing recyclable materials to resell, which gives her a better income.  
Lilian is requesting this loan so she can invest it in the purchase of supplies to resell and thereby have a margin of profit.  She wants to purchase plastics, aluminum, cardboard and other items.

loans.use: to purchase plastics, aluminum, cardboard and other items for resale.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Vicente está en su ciclo número  6, ellas se unieron con el propósito de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, y conforme a ese trabajo poder ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de cada una de ellas.
Lorena es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho en poder crecer, se dedica a hacer comidas varias, que se encarga ella misma de preparar y que después sale a vender por su barrio. Se ha hecho de mucha clientela y quiere poder seguir creciendo, hasta algún día poder tener un establecimiento de comida grande.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo. Agradece por a oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group named San Vicente is in its 6th cycle. They joined together with the purpose of being able to help each other and, according to this work, be able to go on improving each of their standards of living.

Lorena is very good at what she does, that is why she works so hard to be able to grow. She makes various foods that she is responsible for preparing and then going out to sell in her neighborhood. She has earned many customers and wants to continue growing until she is able to one day have a large food establishment. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies, such as meat, greens, seasonings and vegetables, etc., in order to make her food. In that way she will be able to continue with her work. She is thankful for the opportunity received to be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, greens, seasonings and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Gulsunai

texts.ru: Гулсунай, 27 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Гулсунай среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о трудолюбивой, оптимистичной и уверенной в себе женщине. Гулсунай в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 6 лошадей. Дополнительно у нее есть земельный надел мерою 1,11 ГА, где она выращивает люцерну и кукурузу. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсунай, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита Гулсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulsunai is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two. Gulsunai has received secondary education. Her neighbors speak warmly of her, describing her as a hard-working, optimistic and confident person. As a main source of income for her family, since 2010 Gulsunai has been raising livestock and growing farm produce. She has six cows and six horses on her farm. In addition, she has a 1.11 ha [2.7 acres] land plot, where she grows sainfoin [a plant used for animal feed] and corn. Thanks to Gulsunai's hard work, her farm now brings in about 10,000 KGS per month, which is used to cover the cost of food and everyday needs of her family. In order to develop her business further, Gulsunai has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy three cows. Gulsunai plans to use the revenue from her loan for an additional expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Kasee

texts.en:
Kasee is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 30 years old. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a developing area, and his primary customers are regulars. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

Kasee will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials and repair his sewing machine. His business goal is to own a clothing line within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials and repair his sewing machine.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Kiva lenders, the above picture presents Joel who started farming 10 years ago on a small inherited piece of land in Kipsembwo, a remote village in the Nandihills area of Kenya. Joel is married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 boys, aged 2 and 5. In 2009, Joel started farming on the 3-acre piece of land he owns. 

The land is fertile and close to the river from which he fetches water. On the farm he grows maize, and he also keeps 3 dairy cattle and 50 poultry. He has also grown trees on the farm because he believes such initiatives have a real impact on climate change.

Joel is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase farm supplies for the agro-vet business he is running. He will use the loan investment to restock the business. He is an astute businessman whose primary focus is on the nature of the product that he offers to the market. He plans to repay the loan for the first few months using income from other sources as the sales of the farm supplies in the agro-vet business picks up. Joel hopes the investment will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

Invest in this enterprising Kenyan farmer!

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema tiene 60 años, vive con su cónyuge en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, entre otros, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su negocio, de esta manera Zulema espera satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Zulema is 60 years old. She lives with her husband in her own house in the district of Cayaltí, located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. Life in this community is quiet, it's people work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Zulema works selling products like rice, sugar, oil, milk and noodles amongst others. She has experience in this field and has regular customers who can provide very good personal and work references for her. This loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of products like rice, sugar, oil amongst others to increase the stock in her store. Doing this Zulema hopes to satisfy the tastes and needs of her clients, which would allow her to increase the level of her income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products like rice, sugar, oil amongst others to increase the stock in her store.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has four school-going children. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Asha has operated a business of selling paraffin for use in cooking as retail to neighbours. She faces a challenge of delayed payments, hence low profits, in her business.

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to establish a rental house, and to purchase cement and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction.

loans.name: Karinda

texts.en:
Karinda is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Karinda operates a grocery vegetable selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase two crates of tomatoes,vegetables and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two crates vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia lives in the village of Bakurtsikhe in the Kakheti area together with his wife and two children. He is 36 years old and has worked as a wine-grower since he was 15 years old. Kakheti area is famous for its wine-growing tradition. It is even said to be the birthplace of wine. 

Selling wine does not generate enough income to support his family, so that casually he works as a taxi driver, too.

With the help of the loan, Ilia will be able to make necessary repairs in his vineyard. Many poles and wires must be renewed. He wants to expand his vineyard, too. That means to buy additional poles, wires and vine branches.

loans.use: to repair and expand his vineyard.

loans.name: Zhiyde

texts.ru: Жийде, 42 года, не замужем, детей нет. Образование у Жийде среднее, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 13 лет назад с 13,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жийде, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы и 6 овец. На ежедневной основе Жийде продает молоко. На участке мерою 9,60 ГА она выращивает пшеницу и ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жийде обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 100 тюков сена для скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhiyde is 42 years old, single, with no children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this field 13 years ago with an initial capital of 13,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns four cows and six sheep.  She sells milk every day.  She also grows wheat and barley on 9.6 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of 17,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy 100 bales of hay for her livestock.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase 100 bales of hay as feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is seventy years old and lives with his wife in the village of Bazaleti in the Dusheti region of Georgia. As his retirement pension is not enough to make a living, he started to cultivate a small farm. At his farm, he has grapes, fruit trees, a vegetable garden, one cow and a few pigs. He sells the crops, milk and meat to generate additional income.

With the help of the loan, Tamaz will buy two more cows and three pigs. When there is plenty of work, Tamaz hires some neighbours to help him. They are glad to have the extra money.

loans.use: to buy two cows and three pigs for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant plum trees and generate income from selling the plums.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a single mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Activas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas 2 está integrado por 19 mujeres que quieren ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de sus seres queridos, es por ello que están esforzándose y formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Lorena integra ese grupo y solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de helados y en la compra de los productos que utiliza allí ya que tiene muy buena clientela en su negocio y quiere poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
texts.en:
The group called Active Women 2 is formed by 19 women that want to improve their life conditions and their loved one's.  This is why they make an effort and are part of the poverty elimination program.
Lorena is part of the group and she requests a loan to invest it in her business of ice cream sales and to buy the products that she needs for sale.  She has a good clientele and wants to fill the requests of her customers.
She is a hardworking and determined person.

loans.use: to buy ice cream for sale and other products.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 25 years old. He is not married. He has a jewelry shop and has been in a business for three years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more necklaces and armlets to sell. The profits from will be used reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more necklaces and armlets to resell.

loans.name: Mchedzuwa

texts.en:
Mchedzuwa is a married woman who has been blessed with three kids who all attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mchedzuwa operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned the outbreak of disease, which causes losses, as a challenge in the business. Mary dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзада, 31 год, не замужем, детей нет. У Айзады среднее образование, с 2010 года она занимается животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Айзады есть 1 корова, 1 лошадь. Также занимается торговлей одеждой на рынке. У нее нет торговой точки и Айзада носит вещи между рядами.  Ежемесячный доход Айзады составляет в среднем 20,000 сомов (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит корову для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Айзаде увеличить ее хозяйство.
texts.en:
Aizada is 31 years old, single, with no children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry since 2010.  She currently owns one cow and one horse.  Aizada also sells clothes at the market.  She doesn't have a retail outlet: she simply sells her goods by showing them as she walks through the market's alleys.

Aizada makes an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy a cow and increase her herd.  The earnings from her loan will help her to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase one cow to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Edita Mariana

texts.es:
En El Sitio EL Limón del cantón EL Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mariano, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura las personas cultivan, piñas, café, cacao, plátano por ser un clima húmedo propio para estos cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene  63 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y de esta relación tienen 9 hijos mayores  de edad, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella.
Doña Edita es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para poder salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual se dedica a la cría de pollos, compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende por libras a vecinos de sus localidad  o entrega en el mercado a comerciantes en este lugar, con esto ella se gana lo suyo que les sirve para salir adelante por si sola sin depender de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 7 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
"Grupo De Crédito Mariano", meets twice a month in the area, El Limón, of the Carmen Province. This is known for being a very dynamic place, where most people work in agriculture. People grow pineapples, coffee, cacao, and bananas, because the humid climate is perfect for these crops.

Edita lives here. She is 63 years old. Her husband died several years ago. She had 9 children with him, all of whom are now adults. Two of them still live with her. 

Edita is a woman who likes to work in order to get ahead. She has a small farm where she makes a living raising chickens. She buys these animals when they are still small, and then raises them for three to four months, until they have a healthy weight. Then she sells them, by the pound, to her local neighbors, or delivers them to local merchants in the market. Thus, she earns her living and is able to fend for herself, without relying on her children.

This loan will be used to buy chickens, feed, and medicine so that the chickens have good development. Edita has been in the Grupo De Crédito for 7 years, and she appreciates the help received through loans. Her dream is to be healthy so she can keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medicine for chickens.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas 3 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comités, es un grupo nuevo que esta con muchas expectativas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Mariana es una persona que está esforzándose para poder mejorar su vida, es por ello que quiere emprender en la venta de comidas, que ella misma hará y que luego piensa salir a vender de manera ambulante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, y así poder cumplir con su sueño.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Activas 3” is in their first loan cycle of the Committee Program. It is a new group with high hopes of being able to improve their living conditions. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey so as to be able to improve their living conditions. 

Sra. Mariana is a person who is making an effort to improve her life. This is why she wants to start selling food, which she herself will make, and then plans to sell as a street vendor. 

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies to be able to make her food, such as greens, vegetables, meat, and condiments, and by doing so, fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy greens, vegetables, meat, condiments and other supplies.

loans.name: Angelica Teresa

texts.es:
Angelica Teresa tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de comida, su especialidad es la preparación de comida a la parrilla, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente crédito será para la compra de materiales como ollas, platos, mesas y sillas para implementar su negocio, con esto Angelica Teresa espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá gran influencia en el negocio y le generará mayores niveles de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Angelica Teresa, age 44, is a single mother.  She lives with her son in the district of Oyotún, located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru.  Life in this district is calm.  The population’s principal economic activities are agriculture, the commercial sector, and cattle raising.

She works in food preparation.  Her specialty is grilled food.  Her business is located in her own home.  Additionally, she works in the raising and selling of guinea pigs.  She has more than 10 years of business experience and an established clientele, who provide her with very good personal and work references.  The current loan will be for the purchase of materials such as pots, plates, tables, and chairs to help her business.  With this, Angelica Teresa hopes to be able to offer better service to her customers, which will have a great influence in her business and will generate greater levels of income, thereby improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as pots, plates, tables, and chairs to help her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand and labor costs to plaster the walls of his home.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: Jose de 62 años vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 20 años donde elabora y vende pan francés, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, levadura, moldes, latas, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 62 years old and lives with his wife and three children. For the last twenty years, he has owned a bakery located inside his home, where he bakes and sells French bread. He has many customers because of the quality of his bread baking. With his earnings he is able to get ahead on his household expenses. 

José is seeking a loan to buy flour, yeast, baking pans, pie tins, etc. to be able to continue with his work and thereby earn more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, baking pans, pie tins, etc.

loans.name: Felicite Anta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis Mai 2007,il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et sont solidairement liés par une responsabilité du remboursement de crédit.Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et 

Fatou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 33 ans,est mariée et mére de 04 enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de boutique et la plantation de bananes.Elle a une bonne expérience pour ces 2 types d'activités.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 01 sac de sucre pour 22500f,01 bidon d'huile à 15000f,01 paquet de poudre jumbo à 2500f ,des Bombons pour 4000f,du fumier et de la paille pour 100000f.

Son objectif est de bien travailler pour rembourser le prêt,augmenter son épargne et assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2007. It is composed of members living in the same village who are solidly linked by a responsibility to repay loans. The group members work in small-scale commerce.  

Fatou, who is at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is the group’s official. She is 33 years old and a married mother of four. Her business involves a store and growing bananas. She has good experience in these two types of work. 

With the loan, she intends to purchase a bag of sugar for 22,500 francs, a container of oil for 15,000 francs, a packet of Jumbo powder for 2,500 francs, some candy for 4,000 francs, and some manure and straw for 100,000 francs. 

Her goal is to do good work in order to repay the loan, augment her savings, and ensure the day-to-day expenses are covered.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop and some manure for her crops

loans.name: Isabel Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Isabel Flora continua dedicándose al  negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo parabirsas,faros entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de faros, retrovisores para su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel Flora belongs to the communal bank Maquimanta Purisun, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  The member continues making a living selling automotive parts for cars.  She feels grateful for the loan issued to her and she is committed to making her payments according to the established terms.

She continues selling windshields and headlights, among other things.  The member is a responsible person and being this way she is able to get her family ahead. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase headlights and rearview mirrors for her business.

loans.use: To purchase headlights and rear-view mirrors for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bed linen to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Gladys Celia, la socia continua con su negocio de botica, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua  vendiendo  diferentes tipos de medicamentos para todos sus clientes que le solicitan la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de diferentes jarabes y pastillas entre otros.
texts.en:
Gladys Celia is a member of the communal bank, MAQUIMANTA PURISUN. This bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco. 

Gladys Celia continues to work in her pharmacy business. She is grateful for the loan granted and is committed to meeting her payments on schedule.

She continues to sell all of the different types of medicine that her customers request from her. She is a responsible and earnest person, and thus is able to support her family. Gladys Celia requests a loan to purchase different syrups, lozenges, and the like.

loans.use: to purchase various syrups, lozenges, etc.

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
El puesto de venta de vigorón de Brenda cada vez va creciendo más. Antes tenía un pequeño espacio para vender su comida, ahora ha podido establecer una caseta más grande donde puede abarcar más clientes. A sus 50 años de edad, ella se muestra como una señora esforzada y muy agradecida con todos los que le ayudaron en su primer préstamo, con el cual compró yuca, chicharrón y repollo para la ensalada. Inversión que le permitió conseguir un espacio más amplio y construir una caseta más grande para vender delicioso vigorón.
Brenda cuenta con una familia muy unida, que la apoya en todo momento y sirven de motivación para ella. Afortunadamente siente que su negocio va por excelente camino, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar sillas, platos, cubiertos, yuca, repollo, chicharrón y tomate para hacer seguir haciendo una comida de calidad y ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Al cancelar piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, puesto quiere llegar a tener un local más cerrado y más amplio.
texts.en:
Brenda’s “vigorón” stand is growing more and more.  Before, she had a small space to sell her food.  Now, she has been able to establish a bigger booth where she can take on more customers.  At age 50, has shown herself to be a hardworking woman, and she is very grateful to all who helped her in her first loan, with which she purchased cassava, pork rinds, and cabbage for salad.  This investment allowed her to obtain a larger space and construct a larger booth to sell delicious “vigorón.”

Brenda has a very close-knit family that supports her all the time and that serves as her motivation.  Fortunately, she feels that her business is on an excellent path, which is why she is requesting a new loan to buy chairs, plates, cutlery, cassava, cabbage, pork rind, and tomatoes to keep making high quality food and offer greater comfort to her customers.  When she pays the loan off, she plans to continue investing in her business, since she wants to have a venue that is more private and more spacious.

loans.use: to buy chairs, plates, cutlery, cassava, cabbage, pork rinds, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Wendbenedo Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKO ANNE est responsable du groupe WENDBENEDO. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.03 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits, chaussures et pagnes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter  15 pièces de pagnes, 25paires de chaussures et 15douzaines d’habits.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  réinvestir  dans son activité. Elle ambitionne toujours s’acheter une parcelle et mieux entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en: Ms. POKO ANNE is the official of the group WENDBENEDO.  She is in good health. A married woman, she is the mother of three children. The oldest is 13 years old, and the youngest is 3. The three go to school. Ms. POKO ANNE has five persons to support. She has been selling clothing, shoes, and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for ten years. She gets her supplies at the market in her sector. She wants to purchase 15 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth, 25 pairs of shoes, and 15 dozen pieces of clothing. With her profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is still to buy a plot of land and to take better care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 15 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth, 25 pairs of shoes, and 15 dozen pieces of clothing

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Guillermo; el socio continua  dedicándose a trabajar en el sector educación, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de víveres como arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Guillermo belongs to the communal bank "Maquimanta Purisun". This communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member continues to make a living in the education sector. He is grateful for this loan, and he promises to make his payments according to the established terms. He is a responsible and diligent man. He wishes to continue working so that, in this way, he can continue supporting his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy food items such as rice and sugar, among others.

loans.use: to buy food items such as rice and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
