El socio es el Sr. Avelino; el socio continua trabajando  en turismo ,el socio es guía de turismo, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de boletos turísticos entre otros.
texts.en: Avelino is a member of the “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco. He continues to work in tourism. He is a tour guide. He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments. He is a very responsible and hardworking person. In this way he supports his family. He is requesting the loan to buy tourist passes among other things.

loans.use: to buy tourist passes among other things.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Los Claveles se reúne cada quince días en El Progreso de  Portoviejo ciudad bella y hospitalaria conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, con muchos atractivos turísticos y con una variedad exquisita en su gastronomía.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha,  tiene 28 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil. 
Doña Martha es una mujer  muy trabajadora que siempre le gusto ganar su propios ingresos y con estos salir adelante con su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende zapatillas y productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella visita a sus clientes en sus ratos mas desocupados,  deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 4 años realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana algo que les sirve de mucho ya que su marido en ocasiones no tiene trabajo y con sus ingresos se ayudan.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo de crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal banking group "Los claveles" or "The Carnations" meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of El Progreso in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful and hospitable place known as the City of Royal Tamarinds.  The town has many tourist attractions and a variety of exquisite gastronomical options. 

Martha lives in this town.  She is 28 years old and lives with her common law husband and two children ages 8 and 5.  Both children study in school.  Her husband is a brick layer. 

Martha is a very hard-working woman who always likes to earn her own income and help her family get ahead.  She works in business selling tennis shoes and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women).  Her method of sales is door to door.  She visits her customers when they have free time, she sells on credit, and she collects every week.  She has been working in this field for more than 4 years and it allows her to earn funds that help the family very much since her husband at times does not have work and thus her income helps sustain the family. 

This loan will be used to buy tennis shoes, perfume, cremes, and cosmetics.  This is Martha's third loan cycle with the group and she likes it because it helps her get ahead.  Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes, perfume, cremes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Neris Antonia

texts.es:
Al regresar a la tienda de Neris, una mujer emprendedora de 44 años de edad, comerciante de ropa usada, se logra ver el crecimiento que ha tenido durante el tiempo. Ella expresa que esto se debe a la inversión de ropa de segunda mano que hizo con el préstamo anterior de la mano de KIVA y MiCrédito. De igual forma se siente muy agradecida con todos los que estuvieron involucrados para que ese crédito fuese invertido con mucho éxito. 
Las camisas de colores siguen adornando su hermosa tienda, la cual sin duda sigue creciendo sin ningún inconveniente. Por esta razón ella quiere seguir invirtiendo y ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar ropa usada juvenil. Esto le permitirá ofrecer gran variedad en su negocio y abarcar clientes de todas las edades. Estos nuevos ingresos le permitirán ahorrar para mejorar su hogar y su calidad de vida para ella y para toda su familia. Neris planea que en un futuro pueda obtener un local más grande.
texts.en:
Neris is an enterprising woman of 44 years of age, and upon returning to her store, the growth it has had during this time can be seen.  She says that this is due to the investment of secondhand clothing that she made with the previous loan from Kiva and MiCrédito.  Likewise, she feels very grateful to all who were involved in successfully funding this loan.

The colorful shirts continue to adorn her beautiful store, which, without doubt, will continue to grow without any issue.  For this reason, she wants to continue investing, and now she is requesting a new loan to buy used youth’s clothing.  This will allow her to offer a great variety in her business and take on customers of all ages.  This new income will allow her to save to improve her home and quality of life for herself and all of her family.  In the future, Neris plans to obtain a larger venue.

loans.use: to buy used youth's clothing.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mme AWA est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des pagnes, mèches et des bijoux depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter 10pièces de pagnes et 1000 paquets de mèches.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour épargner et s’acheter une parcelle. Mme ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en: Ms. AWA is a married mother of three children. The oldest is 15 years old, and youngest is 5. Two go to school. Ms. AWA has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), hair extensions, and jewelry for ten years. She gets her supplies from the markets in town. She wants to purchase 10 lengths of 'pagnes' cloth and 1,000 packets of hair extensions. She wants to use her profits for her savings and to buy a plot of land. Her ambition is to become a major merchant.

loans.use: to purchase ten lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth and 1,000 packets of hair extensions

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: Celina is 23 years old and she is single. Celina lives with her parents and she makes cheese with the help of her parents. Celina needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Celina wants to increase her cheese production so she hopes you can help her. Celina wants to be an independent woman but she still wants to take care of her parents
texts.en: Celina is 23 years old and she is single. She lives with her parents and she makes cheese with their help. Celina needs a loan to buy a milking cow. She wants to increase her cheese production so she hopes you can help her. She wants to be an independent woman but she still wants to take care of her parents.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Benito Edgard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Benito ; el socio continua dedicándose al negocio de carpintería, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, él socio continua elaborando  diferentes tipos de muebles como camas, mesas entre otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de maderas.
texts.en:
Benito belongs to the communal bank "Maquimanta Purisun". This communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

He continues to make a living as a carpenter. He is grateful for this loan, and he promises to make his payments according to the established terms. He continues to make various kinds of furniture pieces such as beds and tables, among other things. This is the way that the member moves his family forward.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun, 43, lives in a small community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. He is the father of two single children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his agricultural products to the local dealers. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 3.50 a day.

Yeun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Hector Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Héctor continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le, pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar faros, retrovisores  entre otros.
texts.en: Hector is member of the “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN” communal bank. This bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco. Hector continues working in the business of sale of auto parts. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time. Hector has worked in this business for a long time, and he is doing well thanks to his hard work. He wants to continue working to support his family. He is requesting a loan to buy headlights, rear view mirrors, among other things.

loans.use: to buy headlights, rear view mirrors, among other things.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre decided to invest in a biodigester in order to close the natural cycle on his farm, save money and protect the environment. He used to pile his animals' waste outside his farm, while he was buying expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers for his daily activities. From now on, Silvestre will be able to input his cows', horses', sheep's and rabbits' manure in the biodigester, producing methane-rich biogas connected to the cookstove and boiler in the house. The bacteria inside the biodigester also produce organic fertilizer that he will be able to apply on his corn, kidney beans and other vegetables, increasing their yield at no cost and in a natural way. Silvestre will improve his productivity and sell more on the market, while significantly improving his and his family's health conditions. Indeed, his wife used to spend around two hours per day collecting wood in the surrounding area, and was inhaling the toxic smoke on a daily basis while she was cooking. By acquiring a biodigester, this will no longer be necessary. Toxic smoke, expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers will belong to the past.

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an eight cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol owns a few cows and sheep, which produce the milk she sells for a living. She used to spend one hour per week collecting wood in the surrounding area, which she used to heat water in the bathroom. In addition, she purchased expensive LP gas to cook and chemical fertilizers for her corn field. By investing in a biodigester, she will transform her animals' manure into a productive resource, by transforming it into biogas for the house and biofertilizer for her field, therefore displacing expensive and unsustainable external inputs. Not only will she save money, but she will also protect the environment, as the waste will no longer contaminate underground water sources, nor emit greenhouse gases. Marisol plans to invest her savings in her children's education and send them to university. She would also like to buy more animals to expand her production capacity.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se llama este grupo, es un comité nuevo formado con un grupo de mujeres que quieren mejorar sus vías para ir superando su pobreza. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien es manicurista, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que esta en un nivel de pobreza extrema. Ella desea ir mejorando, es por eso que se esfuerza para poder crecer e ir capacitándose para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Maria solicita de este préstamo para la compra de esmaltes, quita-esmaltes algodón, y otros insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women).  It is a new communal bank made up of a group of women who want to improve their paths toward getting out of poverty.  They are taking part in Fundación Paraguaya's "Poverty Stoplight" program.
One of the members is Sra. Maria, who is a manicurist.  In her last poverty survey, she was a "level one," which means that she lives in extreme poverty.  She wants to keep improving her situation, which is why she works hard to grow her business and prepare herself to help her family. 
Sra. Maria is requesting this loan to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover and other supplies so she can keep working.  This will enable her to set up her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy threads.

loans.name: Dúo Misericordia Group

texts.es:
Dúo Misericordia
Este dúo está formado por Ángela ella es originaria de san Martin Jilotepeque. es propietaria de una tienda de consumo diario lo tiene en una área donde hay mucha gente. Ella desea invertir más en sus negocias para aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias y así apoyar a su esposo a darle estudio a sus hijos en este nuevo ciclo escolar. Solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de consumo diario como lo son azúcar, jabón, arroz, frijol y muchos artículos más.
texts.en:
"Dúo Misericordia" (Compassionate Pair)
Ángela is a part of this duo.  She is a native of San Martin Jilotepeque and the owner of a store that sells basic necessities.  Her store is set up in a populated area.  Ángela wants to invest more in her business so she can increase her sales and her earnings.  That would allow her to help her husband and to send her children to school this semester.  She is requesting the loan to purchase basic necessities such as sugar, soap, rice, beans and many other items.

loans.use: to purchase daily necessities to sell in her store.

loans.name: Yovana Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo faros, parabrisas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank MAQUIMANTA PURISUN, this bank is in the District of Cusco, Province of Cusco and Department of Cusco.
She continues to make a living selling auto parts; she is grateful for the loan given to her and is committed to complying with her established payments.

The partner continues to sell headlights and windshields among other parts. She wishes to continue working this way, so that she may carry on supporting her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase windshields among other items.

loans.use: to purchase windshields, among other spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru: Атыркуль успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Атыркуль есть 3 дойные коровы, лошадь и 20 овец. На 1,2 Га она выращивает фасоль и картофель для реализации. Ее доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и денежные переводы от сына - около 6,000 сом (KGS). С Атыркуль живет ее средний сын, он и помогает по хозяйству. Совокупных доходов катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому  Атыркуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Она является лидером группы "Келечек-Н", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита позволят Атыркуль улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Atyrkul successfully paid off her previous loan.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her get this financing.  She currently owns three dairy cows, one horse and 20 sheep.  She also grows beans and potatoes for resale on 1.2 hectare of land.  She makes an income of 4,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and also gets about 6,000 som (KGS) in remittances from her son.  Atyrkul lives with her second son, who helps her to run the farming business.  The family's total income is vastly insufficient for a decent living.  For this reason, Atyrkul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) which she will use to buy two young bulls.  Atyrkul is the leader of the "Kelechek-N" group, which comprises an additional two members.  The earnings from her loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls in order to increase her profits.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Ana gracias a la ayuda financiera que le  proporciono la cooperativa COMIXMUL y los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA está muy agradecida porque ella manifiesta que ya puede tener la confianza y la tranquilidad de poder tocar puertas para avanzar y seguir creciendo con su negocio cubriendo las necesidades básicas del mismo como la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, foliares y en ocasiones el pago de mano de obra para dar una mejor y mayor asistencia a sus cultivos de café de forma eficiente y eficaz. Gracias al oficial de crédito que visita la comunidad ella tuvo la oportunidad de saber de los muchos beneficios y servicios que la misma presta pues ella desconocía de la misma y nada más había escuchado pero no se había atrevido hasta este momento por el cual está muy agradecida. En esta nueva ocasión aprovechando dicho apoyo ella quiere re sembrar plantilla de café nueva que esta como vivero para su venta pero decidió que ahora con esta clase de apoyo no es necesario venderla si no hacer crecer su negocio por lo que espera nueva mente ser apoyada ya que también comprara insumos agrícolas y también están en sus planes el pago de mano de obra para dar una mejor y mayor asistencia a su propiedad por lo cual espera ser apoyada en esta nueva ocasión.
texts.en:
Thanks to the financial aid provided to her by the cooperative COMIXMUL and the various investors from Kiva, Ana is very grateful because she has shown that she can have the confidence and tranquility to be able to knock on doors in order to advance and continue growing with her business, covering the basic necessities of it such as the purchase of manure, fertilizers, fertilizers absorbed through the leaves, and on occasion the payment for labor in order to give a greater and better assistance to her coffee crops in an efficient and effective way.  Thanks to the credit official who visited the community, she had the opportunity to know about the many benefits and services that he lends.  She disavowed this and hadn't heard any more up until this moment for which she is very grateful.  
On this new occasion of taking advantage of this support, she wishes to replant beds of new coffee which is like a nursery for sale, but she decided that with this kind of support it is not necessary to sell them if it doesn't make her business grow.  For this reason she hopes to be assisted  since she will also buy agricultural supplies and also she has plans to pay the labor costs in order to give better and greater assistance to her property.  So for this, she is hoping to be helped on this new occasion.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and payment for labor in order to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Dúo Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Dúo Tejedoras
Dúo conformado por María Esteban es originaria de san Martin Jilotepeque, es una persona que se dedica al arte de realizar tejidos y bordados típicos. María Esteban realiza güipiles de muchos colores, tiene sus propias clientas y llegan a su casa para hacerle los pedidos.en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos(guipiles)
texts.en:
This weaving duo was formed by Maria Esteban. The women are originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. Maria makes a living in art, specifically in creating traditional fabrics and embroidery. Maria makes güipiles (Guatemalan dresses) of many different colors. She has her own clients, who typically come to her home to place orders. 

Maria is taking this opportunity to ask for a loan to buy raw materials to create traditional fabrics (specifically, güipiles).

loans.use: to buy raw materials to create traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in an overlock sewing machine, fabric, thread, buttons, elastic and other items

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has essentially helped her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance. Marciana wants to expand her business so that she can continue to provide for their needs and make improvements to their house. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Chimegbold

texts.en: Mrs. Chimegbold, 55 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been raising livestock for 14 years. They sell dairy products and beef to local people for a living. Their youngest son has won the partial scholarship to study at university in Japan. Mrs. Chimegbold is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay the remaining tuition fee for her son. In the borrower's opinion, this is the greatest help she can give to her son.

loans.use: to pay the remaining tuition fee for her son

loans.name: Saret

texts.en: Saret is a 53-year-old widowed rice farmer of six children, who lives in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has cultivated rice for over 20 years. All the children are employed; two of them are factory workers and four are construction workers. Together, they can earn around USD 31.50 a day. Her present wooden house is old and she would like a proper house to live in, so she is requesting a loan to buy lumber to build a house. This loan will provide her and all the children with better living conditions. In the future, she is going to expand her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en: Socheata is an 18-year-old nursing student who is pursuing an associate’s degree at university in the city. She is from the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Her father is a high school principal and her mother is a teacher. Socheata is lacking the finances to pay her university fees from the first to the third year, so she would like to apply for a loan. She will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully with this loan. Socheata dreams of working in any clinic with a decent salary and to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan had greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional groceries and other supplies which are needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 45,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profits, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Elvira wants her children to finish their studies and have a better future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has really helped her business. She was able to buy supplies and other materials needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again, this time in the amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies, materials, and medicines needed to improve her service and her clinic. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Mary Grace wants to start up a new business soon. She only dreams of becoming successful in all her goals in life. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies, materials, and medicines

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is thankful for her previous loan. She was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her child. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sally hopes that her business will continue to flourish and she also desires to buy a new car for her family. She meets each week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/ clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 51 years old, married and has one child.  

Nida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nida has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 29 years old and has two children.  Rosemarie is married and both of her children are in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for six years.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 46 years old, married and has 14 children. 

Rosalia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalia has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Guetwende Dite Patricia

texts.fr:
Mme GUETWENDE DITE PATRICIA est célibataire et mère d’un (01) enfant. L’enfant est âgé de 01an 04mois. Il ne va pas à l’école. Elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes, chaussures et sacs à main depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les pays voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter 50sacs à main, 40chaussures et 02douzaines d’habits pour filles.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne s’acheter une cour déjà construit (un appartement).
texts.en:
Ms. Guetwende Dite Patricia is single and has one child. Her child is one year and four months old, and does not yet attend school. Guetwende Dite Patricia has three dependents.

She has been selling traditional colorful "pagnes" fabric, shoes and handbags for seven years. She stocks up in the neighboring countries. She would like to buy 50 handbags, 40 pairs of shoes and two dozens of girls' outfits. She would like to use her revenues to bolster her business. Her goal is to buy a pre-built residence (an apartment).

loans.use: to buy 50 handbags, 40 pairs of shoes and two dozens of girls' outfits.

loans.name: Tserenjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Tserenjargal, 28 years old, lives with her sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a tailoring workshop since 2013. Her sister is a curriculum developer at a university. Their parents live in the countryside, raising livestock. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy an electric sewing machine in order to increase her productivity. The current sewing machine she uses is a rental and the rental period is ending. So she needs a sewing machine in order to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine in order to increase productivtiy

loans.name: Rat

texts.en: Rat is a 38-year-old married factory worker with two young dependent children. She lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has been a worker since 2011. The two children attend school. Her husband is a 40-year-old rice farmer and he also has a plowing machine for rent. Rat and her husband can earn about USD 10 per day to support her family. Now she would like to request a loan to buy lumber to renovate her house. This loan will help her and her family to have a stronger house to live in. For her future plans, she is going to help her husband to expand his rice farm and to buy animals to fatten.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house

loans.name: Poh Gending Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Poh Gending Lestari group made their loan payment. After this loan period, most of the members had a sow and they bred piglets. Breeding piglets requires more expertise to make the piglets grow well and healthy. That’s why they need a loan to purchase high quality feed and renovate the cage.

Ni Nengah sold all of her piglets and earned a satisfactory profit. She only needed to maintain them for five months. The profit was used to purchase chili seeds and fertilizer. Ni Nengah and her husband plan to plant chili in their garden in this rainy season. Ni Nengah and all the member of Poh Gending Lestari said thank you for the loan and support they had. This program has proven to increase their standard of living.

The Poh Gending Lestari group decided to continue with their loans. Having a sow, they need the loan to purchase feed and renovate the cage. But, some of the member are also using the loan to buy a sow. They want to breed more piglets.

Ni Nengah used her loan to purchase three superior piglets and good quality feed. She plans to sell the piglets outside her village in order to earn more income. She hopes her plan goes well. All the member also expect the same. Their businesses go well, the sow can have a safe birth and the piglets grow healthy. Ni Nengah will use her profit to support her children's education and fullfill her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets and good quality feed

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
This is Rosy. She previously requested a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and business expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosy dreams of opening another food stall. She hopes to be healthy and strong in her everyday work and she looks forward to having more customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and paint for her apartment.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
This is Marceline. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again; this time in an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of their jeepney. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Marceline hopes to grow her transportation business and add more vehicles. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Janeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Janeth es una joven que lucha día a día para salir adelante, está decidida a convertirse en una profesional de éxito estudiando Administración de Empresas. Reconoce que no le ha sido fácil y que muchas veces ha tenido ganas de dejar la universidad, pero sus ansias de superarse no se lo han permitido y ya está culminando sus estudios. Lo único que la detiene de ver su gran sueño realizado es no tener el dinero para tramitar su título de culminación. 
Ella ha visto en Kiva a través de MiCrédito una oportunidad de coronar su carrera, sin ninguna otra preocupación que no sea tener excelentes notas. Por esta razón, ella ha solicitado un crédito para pagar su título y su graduación, logros que le ayudarán a ingresar al mundo laboral. Entre sus planes está seguir estudiando y conseguir un trabajo que pueda darle un equilibrio a su vida y la de sus padres que tanto la han apoyado.
texts.en:
Janeth is a young woman who fights day by day to get ahead. She has decided to become a successful professional, studying Business Administration. Know that it has not been easy for her and that many times she's wanted to leave the university, but her eagerness to improve herself haven't allowed it and she is now finishing her studies. The only thing that stops her from seeing her great dream realized is not having the money to process her degree completion.

She has seen in Kiva, via MiCrédito, an opportunity of crowning her career, with no other concern than to have excellent grades. For this reason, she has applied for a loan to pay for her degree and her graduation, achievements that will help her enter the working world. Among her plans are to continue studying and to achieve a job that can give her an equilibrium to her life and that of her parents who have supported her so much.

loans.use: to pay for her degree and graduation.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es: Doña Cornelia se siente muy satisfecha y agradecida por haber tenido la oportunidad de ser apoyada financiera mente por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva al igual por la oportunidad que la cooperativa COMIXMUL le brindo para ser apoyada de esta manera. Ella logro cumplir sus metas y planes propuestos para llevar a cabo la fertilización y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de abono, urea y formula cafetalera para asistir su propiedad la cual esta cultivada de café del tipo lempira considerando que de no haber sido apoyada no hubiera sido posible tanto logro para con su plantación de café pues para ella y su hogar es el único medio de ingreso financiero para poder cumplir con los diferentes compromisos. Ella espera ser nuevamente apoyada en esta nueva ocasión pues solicita financiamiento nuevamente para poder fertilizar su plantación de café nuevamente y necesita comprar fertilizantes, abonos, foliares, cale entre otros que evitaran que su plantación de café pueda ser afectada por alguna enfermedad u otra plaga.
texts.en:
Cornelia feels very satisfied and grateful that she has the opportunity to be financially supported by the different lenders on the platform of Kiva, and similarly to the organization of COMIXMUL (Kiva's partner) for providing the opportunity for this kind of support. She has managed to meet her goals and proposed plans of both fertilizing and maintaining her coffee crop through the purchase of fertilizers and coffee formulas to assist the property on which her coffee is grown. Without this kind of support, it would not be possible for Cornelia to have her coffee plantation. 

For her, and her household, this is the only form of financial income that they receive in order to meet various commitments. Cornelia hopes to be supported again, on this new occasion, in her request for funding. She plans to purchase fertilizer and other inputs so that her plantation will not be affected by pests.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to plant new coffee crops

loans.name: Sichan

texts.en: Sichan is a 51-year-old widowed grocer with a child who lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She also sells porridge, rice with pork and Chinese noodles. She has been in the business since 1998. Her brother is a 32-year-old construction worker. Sichan and her brother can earn approximately $66 each day. Now she would like a loan to buy more groceries to resell. With the loan, she will be able to earn more income. In the future, Sichan will renovate her house and help her only child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Mrs. Tuya, 30 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling clothes to local people since 2010. Her husband works at a construction company. Using her previous loan, she installed four electric heaters in her house. But due to a price increase in electricity, these became financially infeasible. So she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After the renovation, her family will burn less coal for heating and save money on electricity. Burning less coal will contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Dúo Salud Y Vida Group

texts.es:
Dúo Salud y Vida

Dúo conformado por María clara, ella es originaria del área de San Martin Jilotepeque. maría clara posee una tienda de consumo. Gracias al apoyo de la fundación y de Kiva está invirtiendo más en sus negocios y obteniendo más ganancias y por medio de su trabajo está sobreviviendo.es una persona responsable para pagar y solicita el crédito para comprar artículos para sus negocios.
texts.en:
This duo was formed by Maria Clara. She is originally from an area called San Martin Jilotepeque. She now owns a grocery shop. 

Thanks to the support from Kiva, she will invest more in her business in order to obtain more income, and, through her job, she is surviving. She is a very responsible women, and plans to use the loan to pay for items for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies that are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow again 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buy additional vegetables and fish needed in her business. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Cleofe desires to become rich someday. She also hopes to attract more customers. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables and varieties of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, milk, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc.

Editha has been in this business for 30 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, milk, sugar, coffee, and noodles

loans.name: Elida Elizeth

texts.es: Elida agradece a los inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA y a la cooperativa COMIXMUL por los diferentes apoyos financieros que ha recibido desde Octubre del 2013 para poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café siendo estos un apoyo para crecer y fortalecer su negocio, cosecha, ingresos familiares y poder cubrir los gastos en su hogar de una manera más pacífica y sin preocupaciones. Su primer financiamiento lo utilizo para terminar de asistir sus cultivos de café pues compro fertilizantes y demás con la cosecha obtuvo excelentes ingresos y pudo cancelar su primer financiamiento satisfactoriamente. Con su segundo financiamiento también utilizado para el mismo rubro de manera que este le ayudaría a asistir toda la plantación de café compro nuevamente: abono, urea, rienda para la plaga, herbax para la hierba, boro y foliar además pago mano de obra calificada obteniendo magníficos resultados. Con el deseo y las esperanzas de seguir creciendo actualmente Elida solicita pueda ser apoyada con financiamiento en una tercera ocasión mismo que invertirá siempre en el cultivo de café comprara urea, abono 12-24-12, boro y pagara mano de obra nuevamente para limpieza ya que con la producción que obtuvo cancelo el crédito anterior y las ganancias fueron invertidas en mejoras y pago de algunos compromisos que estaban pendientes esperando sea posible esta nueva petición.
texts.en:
Elida is thankful for the KIVA lenders and the COMIXMUL cooperative for the financial aide she has received since October 2013. 

This aide has given her the ability to maintain her coffee crops which has allowed her to grow and strengthen her business, crops, family income and cover her household costs in a more peaceful and worry free manner. 

She used her first loan to finalize her first coffee crops by buying fertilizer. With this harvest she had great income and was able to pay off her first loan. 

Her second loan was used in the same way. She was able to help the entire coffee harvest and again purchased fertilizer, urea, pesticides, herbicides, as well as day labor for magnificent results. 
 
With the hope and desire to keep growing, Elida is requesting a loan for a third time. She will invest it as always in her coffee plantation to purchase urea, fertilizer and day labor. 

She cancelled her last loan and the profits invested were used to pay off some pending commitments.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay for day labor to help with her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for crops.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Alicia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor es una persona que quiere prosperar en la vida, él tiene 26 años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá junto a sus padres y hermanos. 
Héctor es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, y comenta que solo de esa manera se puede prosperar en la vida, él trabaja como sastre en su comunidad, pues él está muy agradecido con el primer prestamo, que obtuvo  porque le vino a apoyar en generar más ingresos. 
Héctor considera que los prestamos son medios u oportunidades que se dan en la vida para alcanzar las metas, él ahora solicita un nuevo prestamo que le servirá para remodelación de un espacio en su vivienda,  pues con toda la demanda que tiene ahora, el cuarto donde trabaja ahora ya no es suficiente trabajar, Héctor tiene expectativas de conseguir el prestamo y el sueño más grande de este joven es seguir ampliando su negocio y para eso él piensa recibir cursos para ampliar sus conocimientos en nuevos estilos y diseños.
texts.en:
Hector is a person that wants to prosper in life. He is 26 years old, and lives in the community of Sololá with his parents and siblings. Hector is a young man and is very dedicated to his work. He mentions that this is the only way that one can prosper in life. He works as a tailor in his community, and he was very grateful with the first loan that he received because it helped him generate more income.

Hector considers the loans to be means and opportunities that are given in life in order to reach goals. He is now requesting a new loan that he will use to remodel a space in his home. With all of the demand that he has now, the room where he works is not sufficient for his work. Hector has hopes of receiving the loan. This young man's greatest dream is to keep expanding his business, and to do this he is thinking about courses to increase his knowledge in new styles and designs.

loans.use: to remodel his home.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 26 años viven con familia en una comunidad de San Antonio Palopo.
Irma es una persona muy amable y sobre todo es responsable, pues ella es una madre de familia que lo que busca cada día es prosperidad para su familia, pues anteriormente ella obtuvo un prestamo y manifiesta que le ayudo en mucho para lograr sus metas,  Irma nuevamente solicita un segundo, prestamo de cinco mil quetzales que le servirá para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotería y otras productos que piden las personas. 
Irma es muy trabajadora para adquirir más ingresos  ella también trabaja como tejedora, esta actividad lo realiza desde su casa, de esta manera ella contribuye con su esposo en complementar los gastos de su casa. Para Irma los  préstamos son  muy beneficiosos ya que es una manera de poder escalar en la vida. Ella tiene esperanzas de conseguir el prestamo para hacer esta inversión, porque el suelo de Irma es poder proporcionar educación a sus hijos con las ganancias que genera.
texts.en:
Irma is a 26 year old woman who lives with her family in San Antonio Palopo.

Irma is a very nice and responsible person. She is a mother who every day looks for opportunities for her family. She received a loan in the past which helped her to achieve her goals. 

Irma is requesting a second loan of 5,000 GTQ [$675] which she will use to buy grocery supplies as well as other products people have asked her for.

Irma is a hard worker. She also works as a seamstress at home. This is how she contributes and helps her husband with the household costs. 

The loans are very beneficial to Irma as this is a way for her to improve her life. 

She hopes to receive the loan so she can make this investment. 

Her hope is to pay for her children's education through her income.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Shahlokhon

texts.en: Shahlokhon is an anxious woman. She was born in 1979 and lives in a rural area. She is married with four children and her husband is a builder. She was a participant of “Women entrepreneur” in 2012, but at that time she had a little baby and could not start a business. Now her child is older and she can work. She is a sewer. Shahlokhon sews traditional wear for men. She needs financial support for buying textiles to start her business. She wants to be helpful and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To start up her sewing business

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is 52 years old, single and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs. Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of pig feed

loans.name: Lordita

texts.en: Lordita, a hardworking and diligent mother, is from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta. She has never tired of supporting her family, especially her grandchildren. Lordita is engaged in a snack vending business selling rice cakes. Her business is doing well and she doubles her time perfecting her own rice cake recipe. Lordita has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family. Lordita has taken another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes in order to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and that she will make another snack recipe to increase sales. Today, Lordita is able to help others do retail business with her rice cakes and they also earn an income for their own families.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her rice cakes in order to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet, when went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came as a rescue for Lucia, lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, she has availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Lucia perseveres and always believes she can to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 49 years old and married with seven children.  With two children in school, Belinda works very hard to provide for them.

Belinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Belinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Vic

texts.en:
Mary Vic is 33 years old and married with two children who are still in school. Mary Vic works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee and soft drinks. Mary Vic has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee and soft drinks

loans.name: Consolada Jacqueline

texts.en:
Consolada Jacqueline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Consolada Jacqueline's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
Inobat is an attentive woman. She was born in 1963, lives in a small town, and is married. For about 21 years, Inobat has had a business of buying and selling foods in the domestic market. She feeds her family with the constant trading. She also has land where she is farming and planting seeds. Her husband is a farmer and helps Inobat with planting. 

They decided to enlarge their gardening activity. She wants to make a better standard of living. Inobat is planning to buy fruit seeds for planting. She needs to plant apricot, peach, and almond trees, etc. in her yard to gain more profit from her business. It is also important for the country to increase the level of productivity in the sphere of agriculture. Inobat is requesting financial support to buy seeds.

loans.use: To buy fruit seeds for planting

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and also earning for her family. As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell, as well as to pay for the flower pots. In the future, Margarita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in her town and neighborhoods.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell, and to pay for the flower pots

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Sirene

texts.en:
Sirene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sirene is 42 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Sirene has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Sirene requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional firewood to sell.

Sirene has been in this business for 15 years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Renelie

texts.en:
Renelie is 50 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are still in school. Renelie works very hard to provide for her family.

Renelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Renelie has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Mbinga Group

texts.en:
Aisha is a businesswoman who runs her life with two small activities; she manages a charcoal store and sells fish. She has been in these businesses for 20 years now, working from 10 a.m. to 11 p.m. each working day. 

Aisha is in her mid 40s, married and a mother of four children; two are still in school, while the rest are grown. She is really a hardworking mama and known for being fun with her customers. In a good day, Aisha is able to make a good profit. 

To make her businesses more satisfactory, she has decided to find a loan to buy more and good stock of the items she sells. To do this, she has approached Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania to request her first loan. She will invest her credit to buy stock of fish and charcoal for selling. 

Aisha will share this loan with her group, Mbinga, which has seven members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish and charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Mrangirangi Group

texts.en:
Yuni is 24 years old, married and has one small kid. She  has been a businesswoman managing a beauty salon since 2012. She works at the business from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. each working day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her third credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy salon hairdressing equipment. Yuni managed to successfully repay back her previous loans. She used the profit to cover part of her household expenses. Her dream is to manage a barber shop. 

Yuni will share this loan with her loan group, Mrangirangi, which consists of two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Yuni will invest her credit to buy hairdressing products.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing products.

loans.name: Smiling Group

texts.en:
Loveness is 30 years old, married and has one baby girl. She has had a business of clothes for two years, working from 8:30 am to 9:30 pm daily and is able to make a good profit in a month.

This is her first credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Smiling Group, made up of four members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She will invest this credit to buy clothes for her business to resell. In the coming years, she would like to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business to resell.

loans.name: Norinisso

texts.en: Norinisso is a responsible woman who was born in 1958. She is living in a rural area, is married and has two children. She is a businesswoman with a business of buying and selling foods. She has a grocery store in her area, where she sells rice, oil, drinks, candies, cakes and other stuff. She is an honest, generous, merciful and confident person. She has a lot of satisfied clients, and she serves immediately and well. She is planning to widen her business. She needs to buy additional foods for her grocery store. She has requested financial support to increase her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy additional food for her grocery store

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Concesa works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Concesa is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Concesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Memerly

texts.en:
Memerly is 43 years old and married with three children who are still in school. Memerly works very hard to provide for her family.

Memerly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Memerly has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Eldevira

texts.en:
Eldevira is 60 years old and a widow with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Eldevira has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Eldevira requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Eldevira has been in this business for two years. In the future, Eldevira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Leoni

texts.en:
Leoni is 46 years old and married with four children.  With two children who are still in school, Leoni works very hard to provide for them.

Leoni runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Leoni has been in this business for six years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and married with nine children, seven of whom are currently in school. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar, oil, spices, etc.

Elsa has been in this business for five years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar, oil, spices, etc.

loans.name: Gladis Del Carmen

texts.es: Gladis de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hijo y su nuera, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 20 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Gladis está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladis, 59, lives in her own house with her husband, son and daughter-in-law.  She has been in the sewing business for 20 years and her workshop is set up in her home.  She has many customers because of the quality of her clothing.

Gladis is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastics, etc. to continue her work which generates a good profit.

loans.use: To buy thread, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables, wholesale.

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is thankful that she was able to access a 16,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and business expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lynette wants her capital from the business to increase more. She hopes to have a stable source of income and be able to provide all the needs of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Doña Ines agradece el apoyo económico brindado pues gracias al mismo ella compro fertilizantes y foliares para poder aplicar a sus cultivos de café y proteger el grano del mismo. A través del financiamiento brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con KIVA ella dio la asistencia necesaria a su cafetal lo cual permitió que mejorara las condiciones de la plantación y protegiera la planta de enfermedades y deterioros por el factor climatológico. Ella espera ser nuevamente apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva pues en esta nueva ocasión ella solicita financiamiento para nuevamente asistir su plantación de café comprando nuevamente abono, fertilizantes, foliares y demás insumos que son necesarios para asistir la plantación de café nuevamente. Sus metas en este nuevo año es la limpieza de la propiedad, podar una planta vieja y sustituirla por una plantilla de café nueva y la elaboración de viveros para la venta lo cual espera cumplir para salir adelante y mejorar los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Ines is grateful for the financial support that has allowed her to buy fertilizers and leaf treatment for her coffee plantation to protect the coffee beans.  With the loan granted by COMIXMUL and KIVA she was able to give her crop what it needed to improve the plantation and protect it from disease and climate damage.

She hopes, once again, to be able to count on Kive lenders on this occasion.  She is in need of a loan to buy fertilizers, leaf treatment and other supplies necessary to care for her coffee plantation.  Her goal for this year is to clean the land, trim the old plants and plant new ones.  She also wants to set up a nursery for sales in the hope that she can get ahead and improve the family income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to attend to her new coffee crop.

loans.name: Hanna Group

texts.en:
Ms Zamkhanniang is a married woman with a one-year-old son residing at Churachandpur situated in the northeastern part of India. She is the profile member with her hand raised in the picture. She is also the representative of the group ‘Hanna’.  Her husband is an auto driver.  Most of the villagers are involved in weaving, selling vegetables and fruits, working as masons, etc. Ms Zamkhanniang runs a petty shop in her own place in order to help her husband in meeting the family household expenses. She has been running her petty shop for the past year to support her family. But the income she gets was not meeting her family household expenses. 

Since she had a one-year-old baby boy, she couldn’t leave her baby for other work for more income so the only thing she could do along with her baby was to run the petty shop. Since her husband is an auto driver, she couldn’t depend on him as his income isn’t constant; it depends on the passengers he meets. So in order to earn more profit, she wanted to buy more stocks of items like pan, edible oil and other daily use items in order to earn more profits to support her family. 

She had a hard time trying to figure out how to get the required money to buy the items for her shop. She tried to take loans from money lenders but to her surprise, the interest rates were too high for her so she couldn’t take the loans. While she was in this dilemma, thinking what to do, she came across WSDS who provides loans at low interest rates. She was very much delighted as she could see her hope coming through with the help of a Kiva loan. She applied for the loan with the hope of buying stocks of daily use items in her shop to earn more income for her family's household maintenance. 

She expresses her heartfelt gratitude to the funders and organizations of WSDS for their outstanding work in helping the needy people. She also wishes all the very best in their work. Likewise, the rest of the members too requested loans to start their income-generating activities.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of pan, edible oil, eatables and other useful items for the shop.

loans.name: Istanoy

texts.en: Istanoy is a wise woman. She was born in 1968. She lives in a rural area. She is married with four children. Her husband works abroad. For almost 11 years, she has had a business. She is a farmer. She keeps animals and plants agricultural products. It is the business of her family. She likes her activity and is satisfied that she is doing her best. She is planning to widen the family business. Istanoy needs to buy seeds for planting. She wants to gain more income from her activity. She is asking for financial support to widen the family business.

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.en:
Muhiba is a hospitable woman. She was born and lives in rural area. She is married with two children. Her husband is a passenger driver in a foreign country. 

She is a sewer of traditional dresses and dressing gowns for women and has been in this business for more than five years. She has a great number of satisfied customers. She serves from home and works hard no matter what the season is.

The money that she earns from her business is not enough to renovate her house. She wants to renovate her kitchen and shed. Muhiba is asking for financial support to buy building materials for the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the renovation her house.

loans.name: Rubenia De Jesus

texts.es: Rubenia de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rubenia, 48, lives in her own home with her son.  For five years she has worked as a street vendor selling clothing in different communities where she has steady customers.  She uses her earnings from sales to cover some of the household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more clothing, wholesale, to continue her work and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, wholesale.

loans.name: Vilma Aracely

texts.es: Vilma de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, Vilma está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma, 36, lives in her own home with her daughter.  For several years she has been making and selling tortillas.  Her business is set up in her home and she has many customers.  With her earnings from sales she is able to get ahead.

Vilma is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime so she can continue making tortillas and earn more income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn and lime.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Geraldine wants to grow her store and maintain an increasing profit from it. She also dreams that all her children will be able to compete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. That loan also helped provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could continue to improve her business with this additional loan of 12,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards additional grocery items, toiletries, and beverages. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family with this assistance.

Gemma wants to have her own house and she wants to have additional capital to incorporate with her current revolving fund. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 28 years old and married with one child who is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, coffee, etc.

Edna has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, and coffee

loans.name: Soken

texts.en: Soken is a 43-year-old married factory worker with two children. She is from the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory in the city since 2002. One of her children attends school. Her husband is a 43-year-old motorcycle taxi driver. Soken and her husband can make approximately USD 10 each day. She would like to improve her family finances, so she has decided to take out a loan for her husband to buy farmland to cultivate rice. Soken hopes to buy a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle with an open trailer) for her husband to run a taxi service and to save money to build a new house. She also wants to help her child earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 50 años de edad vive sola en casa propia, ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan,ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 50 years old and lives in a privately-owned house. For three years she has made a living selling clothes as a street vendor.
