With profits from her work, she is able to cover household costs. Rosa is applying for a loan in order to buy more clothes in bulk and thus continue with her sales, her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es: Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y hamacas de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y asi continuar con sus ventas y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: María is 55 years old and lives in a privately-owned house with her daughter. María makes a living selling perfumes and hammocks as a street vendor in the local area. With profits from sales, she is able to move forward in life. María is applying for another loan in order to buy more products in bulk. Her sales are going very well and she wants to continue this way and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and hammocks in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh cheese, pork rinds, corn, tomatoes, beans and more in bulk.

loans.name: Sandra Edith

texts.es: Sandra de 45 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee un  salón de belleza desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a viernes, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 45-year-old single mother who lives in her own house with her daughter. 

She has been running a beauty salon from her home for many years.

She works from Monday to Friday and has built up a good client base thanks to her hard work.

She uses her earnings to pay for household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan so she can buy products for her beauty salon like: creams, shampoo, hair bands, scissors and other things that she needs. This will help her make a better profit and bring her more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair bands, scissors and other things.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina previously accessed an 23,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan to her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. She will also use part of the loan to buy ingredients and supplies needed for her food stall business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial support with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Avelina wishes to have her own stall for her food business and that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana tiene 58 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su nuera, ella posee desde hace 2 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 58 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her daughter-in-law. For two years, Ana has had a small shop in her home. She has many customers because of the good prices and friendly service. With profits from sales, Ana is able to move forward in life. She is applying for a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread and other items and earn a higher income and enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy miscellany.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Gracias a su primer financiamiento doña Lucia compro los insumos necesarios que ayudaron a dar una excelente protección y asistencia a sus cultivos de café, urea, fertilizantes 12-24-12, pago de mano de obra calificada para realizar la limpieza de maleza aplicación de abono y recolección del grano, entre otras actividades que dieron un excelente resultado al final de la cosecha. Ella se encuentra muy contenta y sobre todo agradecida con DIOS por haber cumplido con la meta propuesta que era la de poder mediante la compra de insumos agrícolas asistir sus cultivos de café ya que de esa manera evito que fueran contaminados por la roya u otra plaga que echara a perder su cosecha. Nuevamente Doña Lucia solicita su segundo financiamiento con el cual asistirá la plantación de café ya que después de la corta la planta quedo expuesta y necesita fortalecer de nuevo para mejorar con cada cosecha su negocio
texts.en:
Thanks to her first loan, Lucia was able to buy the necessary supplies that helped her to protect and look after her coffee crops. She bought urea and 12-24-12 fertilisers. She also used it to pay qualified labourers to help with cleaning and weeding work, as well as laying manure and collecting the harvest; all of this and more resulted in an excellent product at the end of the harvest. 

Lucia is very happy and, above all, grateful to God for having been able to achieve this goal. She was only able to do it because she could buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops. These supplies allowed her to prevent the crops being affected by diseases, which would have otherwise resulted in her losing the harvest. 

Lucia is now applying for a second loan in order to look after her coffee crops. Following the harvest, the plant has remained exposed and Lucia needs to look after the crops in order to improve her business with every harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Millie Group

texts.en:
Ms Ngaineikim is a widow with three children (two daughters and a son) who are studying in a private school. She is 30 years old and she is the profile member with her hand raised in the picture. She is also the representative of the group ‘Millie’. Soon after her husband passed away, she became the head of the house. She had to take care of all the household activities and expenses, to earn for the family's household management and for paying her children's educational fees. 

So she started selling readymade clothes at her residence and sometimes door to door. She had to be both a father and a mother to her children. She has been selling the readymade clothes for the past two years but the income she got was used for the family expenses and it wasn’t enough to meet the family's requirements, and for a single mother to support three children with her meager income was very difficult. She was tense thinking what to do so that she would get enough income for her family. She felt very sad for not being able to meet the requirements of her children. She sometimes felt helpless as she was alone and trying to meet the family expenses. 

She aspires to purchase more stocks of clothes to sell so that she can gain more income for her family. As clothes are one of basic necessities of human beings, they used to be in great demand. But her hope of buying more was not fulfilled as she didn't have the required income to do so.  She wanted to take loans thinking she would gain more, which would meet her family's requirements but she ended up not taking the loans as the interest rates were too high. With her Kiva loan, she aspires to buy more stocks of clothes to sell so that she can earn more income to meet her family's household expenses and pay her children's educational fees on time and at the same time, satisfy the customers. She thanks WSDS for their work of helping the needy by providing loans. Likewise, the rest of the members need and requested loans to start their respective income-generating activities.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothes (pajamas, shirts, sweaters, pants etc) to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a single woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 28 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Mary Jane has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy threads, cloth, needles, etc.

Mary Jane has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy threads, cloth, needles, etc.

loans.name: Julio Enrique

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 58 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, junto a su familia él tiene 4 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad. 
Este abnegado señor, para el sustento de su familia, hace 30 años eligió trabajar como albañil, él es un antiguo albañil por los años que lleva desempeñando este trabajo, además de trabajar en su comunidad también sale a los lugares aledaños, él no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos económicos, pues con el trabajo de albañilería ha podido generar su economía, y ha  podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. 
Como comenta Julio las necesidades de una familia son infinitos, pues  para él una de las necesidades que es prioritario es la remodelación de su casa, pero  para poder hacer realidad este proyecto, necesita primero comprar materiales de construcción, y el obstáculo es que no cuenta con dinero para comprar sus materiales, pues él y su familia se han puesto de acuerdo en buscar un prestamo y que con el apoyo de sus hijos estarían pagando este prestamo. Ya que sus hijos con los pequeños ingresos que tienen pueden apoyar a su padre. El sueño de Julio es lograr este proyecto para tener una casa más cómoda para vivir.
texts.en:
Julio, who is 58 years old, lives with his family in a community in Sololá. He has 4 children who are all adults now. This self-sacrificing man decided 30 years ago to work as a bricklayer in order to support his family. He is a veteran bricklayer on account of the many years he has been doing this work. As well as working in his own community he also goes out to neighbouring places. He has no other source of income and by working as a bricklayer he has been able to make an income and bring up his children. 

As Julio says, a family's needs are never-ending, and for him one of the most urgent needs is to carry out improvements to his home. However, in order to carry out this project he first needs to buy building materials, and the main obstacle is that he does not have enough money to buy these materials. So he and his family have agreed to ask for a loan and he will pay this off with support from his children, since the children are able to help their father from their own small incomes. Julio's dream is to successfully complete this project so he can have a more comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “APOSTOL SANTIAGO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña de sus padres a quienes apoyaba porque era el negocio familiar, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The  “APOSTOL SANTIAGO” communal bank is starting the first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación centre. The group consists of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Teodora is the Secretary. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and include selling vegetables and providing a transport service. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesswomen of which Teodora is a member. She says this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer  after being invited by a promoter from the institution who visited her at home. Currently she has a business selling vegetables. She says she learnt this trade as a girl from from her parents when she helped them in the family business. Over time she decided to set up an independent business.

The loan she is taking out is to increase capital to buy vegetables wholesale, which she will buy from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell on her stall. This type of work enables her to make an income to support her family financially, as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Primavera Del Oeste Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA DEL OESTE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos y gorras, servicio de decoración de salones, venta de calzados,  venta de pasteles y masitas, venta de dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de gorros y busos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar los constantes cambios climatológicos y el requerimiento de la clientela.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de gorros por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PRIMAVERA DEL OESTE”  communal bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes centre. The group is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Lucia is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and include: selling hats and trousers, interior decorating, selling footwear, selling pastries and small cakes, selling sweets.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesswomen of which Lucia is a member. She says this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution.


Currently she has a business selling hats and trousers. She says she started this business on her own initiative after seeing the constant changes in the weather and the needs of the clientele.

The loan she is taking out now is to have capital for buying hats wholesale. She will buy these from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and will then sell them through her sales outlet. This kind of work enables her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she lives with a partner and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy hats wholesale.

loans.name: Amatista Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMATISTA” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leydi es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa por temporada, venta de plásticos, venta de joyas por catálogo, tienda de barrio, servicio de elaboración de pinturas, venta de mandiles. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leydi es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior en el cual trabaja como empleada, posteriormente con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer decide implementar su negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de una toldo y abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta y ampliará su producción. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “AMATISTA” communal bank is about to start its fourteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación centre. The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Leydi is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and include: selling food, selling seasonal clothing, selling plastics, selling jewellery from catalogues, corner shop, paint making service, selling aprons.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesswomen of which Leydi is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer six years ago after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution.

Currently she has a business selling food. She says she learnt this trade in a previous job where she worked as an employee and later on she decided to set up her own independent business with the first loan from Pro Mujer.

The loan she is taking out now is to have capital for buying an awning and groceries wholesale. She will buy these from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and will then use them on her stall and increase her production. This kind of work enables her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she is single and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy an awning and wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a home.

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es: Maria de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su madre y su hija, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 39 years old and is a single mother who lives in her own house with her mother and daughter. For several years she has earned a living making and selling tortillas. Her business is located within her home and she has many customers. She is asking for this loan to buy maize by the quintal and also lime powder (used in making tortillas) to be able to continue to make tortillas and therefore earn a better income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy maize by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS TRABAJADORAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, venta de pan, venta de comida, servicio de transporte, venta de CD’s, venta de deportivos, tienda de barrio, taller de bicicletas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de bicicletas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su pareja hace varios años, ya que el trabajaba con este negocio mucho tiempo, es por ello que decidieron ampliar el negocio invirtiendo en equipos y su mano de obra. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de repuestos de bicicleta por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo utilizará para utilizarlo en el negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “HORMIGUITAS TRABAJADORAS” ['hardworking ants'] communal bank is about to start its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación centre. The group is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Nancy is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal bank run are varied and include: selling fruit, selling bread, selling food, transport services, selling CDs, selling sportswear, corner shop, bicycle workshop.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesswomen of which Nancy is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution.

Currently she runs a bicycle repair shop. She says she learnt this business several years ago from her partner, as he had spent a lot of time working in this business, and so they decided to expand the business, investing in equipment and labour.

The loan she is taking out now is to have capital for buying bicycle spares wholesale. She will buy these from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and will then use them in her business. This kind of work enables her to generate an income to support her family financially, as she lives with her partner and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spares wholesale.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Remedios hopes to have a better workplace to continue the operation of her shop. She also wants to give her family a better future someday. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine, fabric and cloth for her sewing business.

loans.name: Cruz Alvarado

texts.es: Ruben de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de ataúdes, comercializa sus productos en las diferentes funeraria ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir a delante con los gastos que se le presentan, Ruben está solicitando un crédito para la compra de madera, clavos, tela, pegamento, pintura, barniz, etc. para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruben, who is 46 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. For 10 years he has made a living making and selling coffins. He sells his products to various undertaker's and has established customers. With what he makes from his sales he is able to keep on top of any expenditure which he has.

Ruben is asking for a loan to buy wood, nails, fabric, glue, paint, varnish etc. so he can continue with his sales and so be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, fabric, glue, paint, varnish etc.

loans.name: Ramiro Nelson

texts.es: Ramiro de 49 años de edad viven casa propia con sus padres, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su microbús desde hace 10 años a las diferentes colonias que hay en el pueblo donde el reside, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para terminar de arreglar su vehículo y darle mantenimiento ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramiro is 49 years old. He lives in his own home with his parents. He has worked driving his minibus for 10 years to the different suburbs of the town where he lives. He has many customers who like him because of the responsible way he drives.

With the income from his work, he manages to meet his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to finish repairing his vehicle and do maintenance as this is his own source of income and he will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: finish fixing his vehicle and do maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, vegetables, cooked meat etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Eloisa Esther

texts.es: Eloisa,  inspirada en su deseo de ser una trabajadora independiente y tener su propio negocio, decidió vender electrodomésticos para el hogar y comercializar ropa y calzado para toda la familia, ella inicio en el año 2000, su instructora en ventas fue una tía que se dedicaba a esta misma actividad y que gracias a su experiencia y conocimiento logró contactarla con buenos proveedores.  Sus clientes son amigos y referidos a quienes ofrece facilidad de pago, su éxito ha sido su buen servicio y productos de excelente calidad, razones que han logrado mantener sus clientes fidelizados.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de camisetas, camisas, jeans, calzado y electrodomésticos para entregar a sus clientes, esta inversión está enfocada hacia la captación de nuevos mercados para lograr aumentar su cobertura y con ello aumentar su flujo de caja encaminado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Eloisa es habitante de un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, tiene 45 años de edad y es madre una hija de 22 años y un hijo de 15 años. Su meta familiar es continuar apoyando a sus hijos, en el negocio es crecer comercialmente y con este crédito empezar su escala ascendente.
texts.en:
Eloisa, inspired by the desire to work independently and have her own business, decided to sell household appliances and clothing and footwear for all the family. She started in 2000. Her sales instructor was an aunt who was in the same line of work, and thanks to her experience and knowledge, she managed to contract good suppliers. Her customers are friends and referrals who she offers easy payments to, her success has been through her good services and products of excellent quality. For these reasons, she has managed to keep her customers loyal. 

Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy T-shirts, shirts, jeans, footwear and appliances to deliver to her customers. This loan is aimed at capturing new markets to achieve increased coverage and thereby increase her cash flow and improve her quality of life. 

Eloisa lives in a neighbourhood in the Barranquilla municipality, she is 45 years old and is the mother of a daughter of 22 and a son of 15 years old. Her family goal is to continue supporting her children, in the business it is to grow commercially and with this loan to start an upwards scale.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, jeans, footwear and appliances.

loans.name: Sreylorng

texts.en:
Sreylorng is an 18-year-old single freshman and a waitress who lives with her widowed mother and siblings in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She has worked as a waitress since 2012, earning around $2.5 a day. Sreylorng is also studying accounting at a university on Saturday and Sunday and she works as a waitress from Monday to Friday. Her mother sells vegetables at a market. 

Due to a shortage of money to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, she has decided to secure a loan. With the loan, Sreylorng will graduate successfully with skills for her future job. After graduation, she wants a good job with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to help her mother. She also wants to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit and bread to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza 2 está en su ciclo 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son de la ciudad de Itá, se unieron para poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eneida, quien se dedica a la venta de joyas que lo hace sobre pedido y de manera ambulante, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se está esforzando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida para poder ayudar a su familia. Sueña con poder tener un gran local donde hacer sus ventas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas variadas, lo que le permitirá poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The group called La Esperanza 2 is in its third cycle of the women's committee programme. They are from the city of Itá and formed a group so that they could work together and through this work help each other out. 

One of the members is Eneida, who makes a living selling jewellery, both to order and as a street vendor. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person who is making an effort so she can improve her living conditions so she can help her family. She dreams of having a large place where she can sell her products. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in buying assorted jewellery, which will enable her to continue with her sales, striving for a better income.

loans.use: to buy assorted jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy edible products to make snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicines in general.

loans.name: Vecinal 3 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VECINAL 3” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamerica, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de cerveza, venta de joyas por catalogo, tienda de barrio, servicio de elaboración de pinturas, venta de mandiles. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cerveza; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al observar la ganancia que tenían las comerciantes que trabajaban con este producto, es por ello que decide implementarlo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la confraternidad con su compañeras de Banca Comunal que la realiza en la institución.
texts.en:
The “VECINAL 3” communal bank will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Panamerica center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Maria is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are: selling food, selling clothes, selling beer, selling jewelry via catalog, a neighborhood store, a paint making service and selling aprons.   

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro business women, including Maria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a  consultant of the institution who went to visit her at her home. Right now, she has a beer selling business. She says that she started this business when she saw the profits that merchants who work with that product have. That is why she decided to start it.  

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying beer wholesale that she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto, and later she will sell it in her sales space. This work will allow her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, She says that she likes the sisterhood with the other members of the communal bank in the institution.

loans.use: to buy beer wholesale.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. Salvacion works very hard to provide for them and has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years. She has requested a 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items for her store, like shampoo, coffee, sugar and eggs.

Salvacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efrain es un gran emprendedor, se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva y la vende a intermediarios.  Efrain es soltero, tiene 26 años y vive con su madre y su hermana, ellas le ayudan ocasionalmente con su trabajo. Efrain necesita un credito para la compra de una maquina de costura y materiales para elaborar ropa deportival Efrain quiere a futuro tener su propia casa y su propia tienda donde pueda vender sus productos
texts.en:
Efrain is a successful businessman, who runs a business making sportswear and sells it to wholesalers. He is 26, single, and lives with his mother and sister, who sometimes help him with his work. 

Efrain needs a loan for the purchase of a sewing machine and materials for making sportswear. He would like one day to have his own home and a shop where he can sell his clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Las Bienaventuradas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Bienaventuradas; está en su ciclo número   2  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo muy numeroso, donde  cada una de las integrantes está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Sandra es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, y también a la venta de leche,  es una persona muy trabajadora que por medio de su trabajo y gracias a la ayuda del programa de comité de mujeres esta pudiendo crecer e ir mejorando poco a poco.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, como así también de una buena cantidad de leche, para que por medio de ello pueda seguir con su emprendimiento. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The Las Bienaventuradas Group is very large, but each member is making the greatest effort possible to succeed and get ahead. The group is in the second cycle of the Women's Committee Program. 

Sandra is one member of Las Bienaventuradas, and sells two kinds of products: a variety of clothing and milk. Sandra is a very industrious person who is achieving success and improving her life steadily because she works hard and has the support of the Women's Committee. 

Sandra is applying for a loan to purchase a variety of clothing items as well as a large quantity of milk, investments that will help sustain her business. She is grateful for the opportunity to keep making progress and moving ahead that this loan represents.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing items and a large quantity of milk to sell.

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.en:
Haitgul is a hardworking woman. She was born and lives in a rural area. She is married. She has three children. She is generous, conscious, responsible and a kind person. She is a farmer. She plants corn. Her husband helps with the business. She has good practice and knows well her duty. In addition, she has cattle at home and gains additional income from them. 

She sells corn seeds; the stalks are used for feeding cattle and the ears are used as firewood. 

She is planning to buy fertilizers and to pay for workers. She needs the financial support to enlarge her activity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en: Tohir is an active, single man who was born in 1981 and lives in a remote district of Tajikistan. He has been working for seven years in the production of wooden doors and windows. During this time, he has also taught his brother how to do this work. Tohir is a handsome, responsible and strong person. His customers are always requesting that he makes heaters for their apartments. This provides him with additional income. Tohir has permanent clients at a local market which sells his ready-made doors and windows. While trying to be helpful for his family, he has become sick and now he needs to be treated in hospital. Tohir is asking for financial support for his hospital treatment.

loans.use: To pay for treatment in hospital

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Norma is 57 years old.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP21,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like thread, cloth and needles. 

Norma has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, cloth, needles, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Violeta works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Violeta is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a young hard-working man aged 28 years coming from the village of Kisenyi in Mbarara district but doing agriculture in Rukungiri Rwenkureijo. He grew up with a grandmother after his parents died when he was three years old. He was brought up by his grandmother who also died when he was 10 years old. 

He worked on people’s plantations to get money for his survival. Because of his trustworthiness and hard-working nature, his boss gave him education up to senior six. Then he went to university and got a diploma. From there he got a job. He saw there is money in coffee farming which is giving him money now.  

He is requesting a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to add more coffee seedlings and add manure to increase his yield, sales and profit.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and organic manure.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a bicycle taxi. Loida is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marites works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marites is borrowing 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Portunata

texts.en:
Portunata is a 58-year-old married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Portunata has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like blouses, pants, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Portunata has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Josamay

texts.en:
Josamay is a 24-year-old, single woman who works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles and soap.

Josamay has been in this business for three years and she would like to save money to expand it.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Dúo Alejandra De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Alejandra de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Miriam quien se dedica a la venta de ropa típica variada como cortes típicos, fajas pequeñas y grandes,  güipiles de varios colores y blusas de tela típica y tela normal desde hace 3 años,  es vendedora ambulante de su sector.  Su sueño es tener un hermoso local en el cantón donde vive y ofrecerle de todo a las personas sin tener que cargar tanto las grandes bolsas de ropa y tampoco arriesgarse mucho en que la miren como vendedora de ropa típica.  Se ve en la necesidad de pedir otro préstamo porque tiene varios pedidos de trajes completos típicos corte, güipil, faja  que entregar para una boda y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por eso acude nuevamente a la empresa para contar con su ayuda y no quedarle mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Miriam is the senior member in the Dúo Alejandra de Vista Hermosa partnership. She has for the past three years run a business selling various traditional clothing items, such as skirts, large and small belts, and  güipiles [traditional Central American blouses] that come in many colors and are made from both regional and more common fabrics. 

Señora Miriam sells these items on the streets in her neighborhood, but her ambition is to have her own shop in the canton where she lives. She wants to offer a lovely, friendly ambiance, with a wide range of clothing in one place. Then she wouldn't have to haul large bags of clothing around and expose herself to the risks that street clothing vendors face. 

Señora Miriam finds herself in need of another loan because she has a number of orders for weddings that include dresses, belts, and güipiles. She doesn't have the funds to purchase these items, so she's approaching the lender for help in order not to disappoint her customes.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and has three children. She is married, and has two children who are still in school. Josephine is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been doing this for one year now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jasmina Mercedes

texts.es:
Jasmina es una de las tantas personas que migran a Costa Rica en búsqueda de una mejor vida. Por más de ocho años, ella caminó ambulante por las calles del país vecino vendiendo ropa que compraba en Guatemala. El excelente producto que vendía y su buen servicio hicieron que los pedidos crecieran cada vez más, prometiendo un futuro próspero. Sin embargo, años después su edad ya no le permitía viajar constantemente, así que decidió regresar a Nicaragua para colocar una tienda estable, junto con su hija mayor.
Esta comerciante de 51 años de edad siempre trabajó por sus dos hijos, ya que es madre soltera. Ahora que ya son independientes, estos le ayudan cuando ella necesita. En el poco tiempo que lleva ha invertido lo necesario para ir creciendo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa nueva, para aprovechar la temporada de verano. En sus planes está establecer otras tiendas en el mercado y aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jasmina is one of so many who emigrate to Costa Rica in the search of a better life. For more than eight years, she walked the streets of the neighbouring country selling clothing that she bought in Guatemala. The excellent products that she sold and her good service made the orders grow more and more, promising a prosperous future. However, years later age no longer allowed her to travel constantly, so she decided to return to Nicaragua to set up a permanent store with her eldest daughter.

This businesswoman of 51 years of age has always worked for her two children, as she is a single mother. Now they are grown up, they help her when she needs it. In this short length of time since she set up, she has invested what it takes to grow, so she is requesting a loan to buy new clothing, to take advantage of the summer season. In her plans are to set up more stores in the market and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy new clothing.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cherry requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cherry has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing.

In the future, Cherry would like to save money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 30 years old, married, and has one child in school.

Joan is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Joan has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joan would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Five years ago, Rosemary started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Roret, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She also does some side business (motorbike business) to supplement the meager income she earns from farming.

She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and she is proud to wake up every day to milk her cow. 

Although she makes profits by selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build one. 

A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax, and also prevents them from coming down with diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather such as rain. Rosemary believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. 

Rosemary thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 58 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalinda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

Rosalinda requested a PHP 35,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school.

Amelia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Amelia has been farming vegetable for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amelia would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 30 years old and a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Bernadeth has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Bernadeth requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Bernadeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, Bernadeth would like to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Al llegar al negocio de venta de conservación de frutas y verduras de Ana Lucia, una gran sonrisa se dibuja en su cara. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que con orgullo cuenta como su negocio ha crecido desde que tuvo su primer préstamo, con el que compró envases y chile para aumentar sus ventas. Logró que consiguió con gran éxito y del cual cuenta lo agradecida que está con las personas que le extendieron las manos con ese primer préstamo que levantó sus ventas y se fue industrializando más.
Ahora Ana tiene 36 años de edad y siente que su negocio va por un excelente camino, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar una olla de acero inoxidable de ochenta litros y etiquetas para sus productos. Esto le permitirá mejorar su producción, cumplir con las normas de salud y aumentará sus productos. Afortunadamente cuenta con una familia unida que la apoya en lo que necesita. Al cancelar este préstamo planea comprar un molino para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en: When talking about the business of selling preserved fruits and vegetables, a big smile appears on Ana Lucia's face. She is a very enterprising woman, who proudly tells how her business has grown since she got her first loan. With it she bought containers and chile in order to increase her sales. She was very successful, and she mentions how grateful she is to those people who helped her with the first loan, which helped her raise her sales and become more industrialized. Now, Ana is 36 years old and feels that her business is on the right path. Therefore, she is requesting a new loan to buy an 80 liter stainless steel pot and labels for her products. This will allow her to improve her production, meet health required norms and increase her products. Fortunately, she has a tight family who supports her in what is needed. When she finishes paying off the loan, she plans to buy a mill so that her business keeps growing.

loans.use: to buy an 80 liter stainless steel pot and labels for her products.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 62 years old, married, and has nine children.  

Adelaida is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetables.

Adelaida has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Kristaq

texts.en:
Kristaq wants to repair his animals’ stable and this is why he is seeking your financial help. 

Kristaq is 50 years old, and a father of a 15-year-old son. For years, he has been practicing agriculture/livestock as a means for living. Kristaq owns about 15 dynym of agricultural land; on 8 dynym he plants fodder, on 3 dynym wheat, on 2 dynym corn and the other 2 he plants beans. 

Kristaq has two dairy cows of a good breed, and from them he sells about 30 kg of raw milk/day to clients and that adds up to $18/day. In case villagers sell the milk to dairy farms, the price is cheaper then, about $0.4/liter compared to $1/liter when sold directly to clients. 

Kindly note, that the cows produce milk up until 2 months before they give birth to the babies.

loans.use: to repair his animals' stable

loans.name: Alida Romelia

texts.es:
Alida es una mujer empapada por el espíritu trabajador. Desde siempre ella ha sido caracterizada por ser una persona que construye un trabajo nuevo, inmediatamente después que termina el viejo. Desde hace diez años ella posee esta pequeña pulpería que con el sudor de su frente, luego de vender ropa, fritanga y platos de plásticos, pudo obtener. Esta mujer de 39 años de edad está casada y es madre de tres hijos, familia que la apoya incondicionalmente. 
Si bien es cierto que Alida tuvo que rebuscarse con distintos trabajos para salir adelante con su familia, ahora ha optado por seguir con algo más estable. Razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de papel higiénico, salsa de tomate, refrescos en polco, arroz, entre otros productos que más vende en su día a día. Esta comerciante expresa que este crédito le permitirá ofrecer variedad y cantidad de productos en venta a sus clientes. En sus planes está evolucionar hacia una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Alida is a woman steeped in working spirit. She has always been known as a person who creates a new job, as soon as the previous one ends. For more than ten years she has had this small grocery store which with the sweat of her brow - selling clothing, fried food and plastic plates - she could get. This woman of 39 years old is married and is the mother of three children, a family which supports her unconditionally.

While it is true that Alida had to search for different jobs to get by with her family, she has now opted to continue with something more stable. 

The reason she is requesting a loan is to purchase toilet paper, tomato salsa, powdered drinks, rice, amongst other products which she sells from day to day. This businesswoman says that this loan will enable her to offer a variety and quantity of products to sell to her customers. 

Her plans are to evolve into a corner shop.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, tomato salsa, powdered drinks, rice, etc.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. En este distrito las actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, tiene una pequeña tienda que se encuentra ubicada en su propio domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro del comercio de abarrotes y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio así como para realizar reparaciones en su tienda que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Leoncio espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo de esta manera sus gustos y preferencias lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 42 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his wife and his 3 children in the district of Pomahuaca which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. In this district the principal activities are agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Leoncio works selling products like rice, sugar, oil and pasta amongst others. He has a small store located in his house. He has more than 10 years experience in the grocery business and has regular customers who give him good personal and work references.

The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of products to increase the the stock of his business. As well he will make some repairs on his store that is currently in poor condition. Doing this Leoncio hopes to offer a greater variety of products to his clients and in this manner satisfying their tastes and preferences. This will have a big impact on his level of income and allow him to improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products to increase the stock of his business and to make repairs to his store.

loans.name: Rudy Group

texts.en:
The Rudy group consists of three hardworking ladies represented by Samaher, a 19-year-old single lady who has been working as a tutor from her house for two years to make sure that she can cover her education expenses.

Samaher and the other group members decided to join together and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua  to make sure that they can develop their businesses and cover their own and family's living expenses at the same time. Thus, Samaher's acquired loan will be invested in paying for her university tuition fees. She is working hard to succeed and graduate to work in her specialized education sector.

Samaher is the lady at the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Marwa (33-Single) on the left, has been an employee in a clothes selling shop for the past four years. Her acquired loan will be invested in buying special wood logs to warm up her family members during the cold winter season. Tagahreed, on the right, (31-Married), works as a tailor from her house. Her acquired loan will be invested in her house's building needs expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan es un experimentado carpintero el cual a sus 15 años aprendió su oficio gracias a sus tíos y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual gracias a dios y a pesar de las adversidades ha logrado salir junto con su familia. 

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido su propia casa de madera donde vive actualmente con su esposa y tres hijos, construyo los muebles y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por ellos, su principal sueño es enfocado en sus hijos puesto que vive en una zona donde la educación es casi que un mito donde las personas que progresan es por que adquirieron conocimientos empíricamente y salen adelante por trabajar largas jornadas laborales y muchas veces solo por el pan diario, Juan quiere que sus hijos vayan a una universidad y en un futuro no muy lejano vuelvan a su hogar como todos unos profesionales con altos cargos ejecutivos
texts.en:
Juan is an experienced carpenter who at 15 years old learned his trade thanks to his uncles. And with the passing of time became more independent and opened his own shop, which thanks to God and in spite of difficulties has managed to get ahead with his family.

His biggest pride is having built his own house of wood where he lives now with his wife and 3 children. He made the furniture and almost everything you find in his humble house he made.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood which will allow him to make more furniture and manage to obtain good profits from them. His big dream is focused on his children as they live in an area where education is almost a myth, where people who get ahead is because they learned themselves. And they get ahead by working long days, at times only for their daily bread. Juan wants his children to attend university and in the no so distant future return home as professionals with good executive jobs.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Hellen from Litein, Kenya. She is a woman from a community not known for farming but she is earning a living through agriculture (Nandi community). She is happily married and together with her husband is blessed with a beautiful family. 

For the past 8 years, she has been practicing mixed farming. Because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Income from milk and eggs have allowed her to earn a decent income. To make extra money, Hellen engages in a small personal business. 

Hellen passionately loves dairy farming and the animals on her farm have been given names. Milking and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers, then she can SMS her customers when the milk is ready for collection. Because of using information technology, she has had a comparative edge in her dairy business. Demand has been overwhelming and she needs another cow to fully satisfy the demand. She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Hellen does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow but she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income and Hellen will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 53 years old mother who has four adult-age children. She owns and manages a small retail store within their village to help her husband in gaining income. Due to hardship of living, she aspires to improve more of her store in order to earn a higher income. She would like to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers demand but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she would like to access a loan of PHP7,000.00 to buy more stocks of grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell.She hopes that someday, she will make her business more profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business by buying school supplies to take advantage of the start of the school year to make sales.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is sure that his third loan with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon will be again profitable and bring good results to his agricultural activities. Manvel lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. He is a skilled builder and already has 22 years of work experience in this sphere. He has always managed to sustain his family’s needs and paid for his daughters’ education. He really likes his work as a builder, but he also enjoys the work on his plot of land. On his land, he cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, greens, beans and garlic. His fruit garden is not very rich but each season it gives the sweetest harvest of apples, plums and cherries. Half of the vegetable and fruit harvest Manvel manages to sell through the re-sellers.
 
This time Mnavel asks for a loan in an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy potato seedlings for the coming spring sowing activities. He will also buy plastic pipes for irrigation of his land.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings for the coming spring sowing activities and also plastic pipes for irrigation of his land.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a 52-year-old married woman from Montebello, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than five years now. She also earns an additional income through her sari-sari or variety store business. Corazon is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, animal feed and additional groceries like rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries among others. A loan will help Corazon improve her business as well as her profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, animal feed and additional groceries like rice, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries among others.

loans.name: Javohir

texts.en: Javohir is a handsome man. He was born in a rural area. He is single. He is a student. He studies with excellence. He is studying telecommunications. He lives with his parents. His father has worked at factory that produces rice as technical assistant for about twenty six years. His mother is a family doctor. She works at a hospital in their village. After graduation, Javohir is planning to work at a trading company. His family also keeps cattle. The tuition of the university was paid from the income of the livestock. Now the tuition of the university has increased and the income from the livestock is not enough for him to pay tuition. He requests financial support to pay the tuition of the university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Annah, a 65-year-old youthful, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Litein, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. 

Annah passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past ten years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her large family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

Annah has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and the price of milk in the recent past has been going up, so Annah, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Annah said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from the training, she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Annah hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es: Doña Maria es una mujer de 48 años de edad muy luchadora quien agradece los diferentes apoyos financieros que ha recibido desde Octubre del 2013 para poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. Estos han ayudado a crecer y fortalecer su tierra, cosecha, ingresos familiares y demás de una manera positiva y sin preocupaciones. Su primer financiamiento lo utilizo para compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaron a dar protección y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que para ese momento la roya se propagaba muy rápido entre los diferentes cultivos y dañando los de muchos productores a la vez. Su segundo financiamiento fue solicitado el 8 de Julio del 2014 para invertirlo en el mismo rubro en la asistencia de su propiedad, protección del grano de café y recolección del grano. En esta ocasión solicita su tercer crédito a través de los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar los insumos necesarios y asistir su propiedad la cual esta cultivada con café del tipo lempira esperando cumplir con las nuevas expectativas para este nuevo año ya que sus metas, esperanzas y sueños están concentrados en los resultados que su trabajo realiza con la agricultura.
texts.en:
Maria, 48, is a very hard-working woman who is grateful for the various occasions she has had financial help since October 2013 so she can maintain and look after her coffee crops. This has helped her to grow and strengthen her land, harvest, family income and more in a positive way and with no worries. 

She used her first loan to buy agricultural supplies which helped to protect and maintain her coffee crops as at that time rust was spreading very quickly between different crops and a lot of producers' crops were damaged at the same time. She asked for her second loan on the 8th July 2014 to invest in the same way, in looking after the land, protecting the coffee beans and harvesting the beans. 

On this occasion she is asking for her third loan through the various lenders on the Kiva platform, in partnership with the COMIXMUL cooperative, so she can buy the necessary supplies and look after her land which is planted with the lempira variety of coffee. She hopes to meet this year's new expectations since her goals, hopes and dreams are based on the results of her agricultural efforts.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, foliar feeds and other items to look after her coffee crop.

loans.name: Dúo La Eminencia Group

texts.es: Dúo la Eminencia La señora Brenda Beatriz se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace mas de 2 años en su comunidad San Juan Alotenango ella desea su crédito para compra de frutas por mayor ya que ella logra tener un ahorro al comprarlo todo por mayor, otra parte del crédito ella  invertirá en compra de una carreta para vender papas y chicharrines ya que solo vende chicharrines y ya posee una gran demanda y ella desea aprovechar la oportunidad para vender y contribuir con los gastos de su casa ya que su esposo trabaja y su mayor sueño es comprar una moto para que el pueda trasportarse a La Antigua donde el trabaja y poder ahorrar sus pasajes y contribuir con la educación y gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Dúo la Eminencia

Brenda Beatriz has made a living from selling fruit for more than 2 years in her community, San Juan Alotenango. 

She wishes for a loan to purchase fruit wholesale since she is able to save money by purchasing everything wholesale. She will invest the other part of the loan in the purchase of a cart to sell potatoes and chicharrines (pork rinds) since she only sells chicharrines. She already has a great demand and she wishes to take advantage of the opportunity to sell and contribute to the home expenses since her husband works. 

Her greatest dream is to purchase a motorcycle for which she will be able to transport herself to Antigua where she works and so be able to save the ticket prices and contribute to the education and expenses of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Los Claveles 2 Group

texts.es:
Los Claveles 2 se formo en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, donde las integrantes forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para que por medio de esto cada una pueda conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando.
La Sra. Del Rosario comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas de todo tipo, en especial de verano, ya que se acerca el tiempo para ello y quiere poder surtirse para satisfacer a sus clientes. Ella es la presidenta de este grupo, quien siempre trata de poder motivar a sus compañeras para poder trabajar e ir saliendo adelante para salir de su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The Los Claveles 2 group was established in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members are all taking part in the poverty elimination programme, through which each of them can understand their life situation and start making improvements accordingly. 

Del Rosario says that she is asking for this loan so she can buy all sorts of items of clothing, especially summer clothing, since this season is now approaching and she wants to stock up so she can satisfy her customers. She is the president of the group and always tries to motivate her companions so they can work and start making progress in order to get out of their situation of poverty.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is a responsible woman. She was born in a village. She lives in a remote district. She is married. She has three children. 

She is a doctor. She has been working in a medical center for about 15 years. She is a helpful and hardworking woman. She serves a lot of clients. 

Unfortunately, she got sick. She needs to get treatment in a hospital. The money that she earns is not enough for getting treatment in a hospital. She wants to be treated. She requested financial support to get treatment in the hospital.

loans.use: to get treatment in the hospital

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 59 years old and lives in Enrile with her family. She manages a talipapa (vegetable, fish and meat selling business) for income. From her income, she is able to buy daily meals and pay bills at home. 

She wants to increase her income and capacity of sales; that is why she is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP. She will utilize her loan in buying additional fish, meat and vegetables to sell. Someday, she hopes to continue improving her income and obtain good profits to save.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, meat and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 52-year-old married woman living in Montebello, Leyte. She runs a small eatery (or carenderia) in her place, selling home-cooked foods to her customers. Emma has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Emma is asking to take a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, rice and soft drinks, among others. This loan will enable her to improve the ingredients, thus allowing her to cook more and sell more food to her customers. Emma has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments, rice and soft drinks, among others

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia has been a vegetable vendor at Enrile for almost two years now. She is 51 years old. Leticia wants to sell more vegetables but has insufficient funds to buy them. 

Leticia is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy squash, eggplant and tomatoes to sell. This will help increase her sales and profits for her family’s emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Montebello, Iloilo. She is a rice farmer and has been in the farming business for several years now. She also earns an additional income through her hog-raising business. 

Diosdada is asking to take a loan to buy piglets and animal feed, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. A loan will help Diosdada improve her business’s productivity, thus augmenting her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build stairs in his house.

loans.name: Cira Del Rosario

texts.es:
Cira es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.
Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como ensaladas de fruta y salpicón.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y su hijo de 12 años quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.
