Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Cira solicita un préstamo para realizar la realización de algunas mejoras locativas a su puesto de trabajo.

Con tu ayuda Cira Podrá pagar la educación de su hijo que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Cira's a very enterprising and tenacious woman with big aspirations she has been cultivating and trying to achieve.  She has a small business preparing and selling dishes such as fruit salad and "salpicón" [shellfish cocktail].  She tries to get ahead with this job every day and improve her living conditions for her family, made up of her husband and her son, 12, who are her driving force in live and her motivation to strive every day.

Her biggest difficulty is competition in the sector.  With her great capacity for work, however, she's able to support herself and make progress.

Cira's requesting a loan to make some improvements to her work space.

With your help, Cira will be able to pay for her son's education, which is one of her biggest dreams!

loans.use: to make some improvements to her work space

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes de este comité se unieron con las esperanzas de poder crecer y salir adelante. Ellas son de Caacupé, y quieren ir mejorando sus condiciones de vidas y las de sus familias.
Maxima pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de los mismos.
Maxima dice que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
The 15 women who are members of this committee got together in the hope of being able to grow and make progress in life. They are from Caacupé and want to continually improve their own and their families' living conditions. 

Maxima is asking for this loan so she can buy natural remedies, since she makes a living selling these. Maxima says her work is very demanding, but she does it so she can help her family through her work, so she can give them everything that she wasn't able to have.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies to sell.

loans.name: Nely Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Nely se encuentra muy agradecida y contenta porque su experiencia con la cooperativa COMIXMUL ha sido un gran alivio y dio oportunidad y seguridad a que sus cultivos de café no fueran afectados por plagas pues los inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA ayudaron a que su propósito para la temporada anterior fuera posible. Ella relata: '' Estoy muy contenta porque me han apoyado cuando más he necesitado es de esta manera que uno se encariña y agradece lo que hacen por el pequeño productor para que este pueda salir adelante y mejorar su negocio cada día ya que en la aldea donde vivimos todas las familias nos dedicamos al cultivo de café y granos básicos''. Doña Nely solicita en esta nueva ocasión ser apoyada nuevamente por los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA para nueva mente comprar abono, foliares, fertilizantes entre otros que serán de gran ayuda y de mucha utilidad para salir adelante y evitar que su plantación de café y granos básicos se contamine pues está elaborando un vivero el cual quiere asistir muy bien.
texts.en:
Nely feels very grateful and happy because her experience with COMIXMUL has been a great relief and gave her an opportunity and the security that her coffee crops would not be affected by disease. The lenders on the Kiva platform made it possible for her to achieve her aims in the previous season. She says: "I am very happy because they helped me when I needed it most and because of this I feel great affection. I am grateful for everything they do for small producers so they can make progress and keep improving their business, because in the village where I live all of our families make a living from basic grains and coffee".

Once again Nely is now asking to be helped once more by the various Kiva lenders so she can again buy manure, foliar feeds, fertilizers and other items which will be a great help to her. These will help her to make progress and avoid her coffee plants and basic grain crops being affected by blight, as she is developing a nursery which she wants to look after really well.

loans.use: to buy manure, foliar feeds, fertilizers and other items to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon, a youthful 24-year-old farmer from Kipkaner, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his siblings and family as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Kapsowar area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Philemon has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. 

Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Philemon started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 5 years. Philemon’s sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Kapsowar area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Philemon is kindly seeking a loan to buy another motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Philemon is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his siblings. Philemon's dream is to provide a secure future for his siblings through paying tuition fees for them. Through your loan you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Taghreed Group

texts.en:
Salwa is the featured borrower of Taghreed group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to develop their businesses and families' living.

Salwa is a 28-year-old hardworking married mother of one child, who will invest her acquired loan from Al Majmoua in starting her own business from her house to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing needs and make sure that they can provide their child with the best education. Salwa will start selling beauty cosmetics and women's accessories from her house so that she can work on developing it properly until she can open her own shop in the future.

Salwa is the first lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Taghreed is a married mother of three, who works in preparing Mouneh and her acquired loan will be invested in supporting her daughter through her wedding expenses. Nisrine is the second from the right, who is going to invest her loan to pay for a necessary surgery she has to undergo, and unfortunately, Dania, the lady at the far right side of the picture who works as a tutor, will also invest her acquired loan to pay for a necessary surgery she has to do.

loans.use: To start up her own cosmetics and accessories selling business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 31-year-old married mother of two children, who has been working in selling children's clothes, lingerie and children's medical shoes for eleven years. 
She established her current business in 2010 to improve her family's living, and support her husband in covering their living expenses.  

Mariam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her shoe capital with a special, newly released winter collection. This is Mariam's sixth loan acquired from Al Majmoua, her previous loans helped her a lot in developing her business and social living. Part of her last acquired loan was invested in paying for expected baby needs, and in fact it was very supportive and helpful. Today she has one child in school and has to develop her business properly to increase her income to stay capable of covering her children's necessary future needs.

Today, her business is developing properly, and Mariam is working hard to respond to customers' needs and requests. She hopes to keep on developing her business, especially the medical shoes sector, which is the main focus for her current loan.

loans.use: To increase her medical shoe sector with a newly released winter collection

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Evelyn lives in the province of Leyte, Philippines. Evelyn runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. Evelyn also raises pigs to improve her income. 

As of now, Evelyn is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Evelyn hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en: Mehri is an honest woman. She is from the northern part of the country. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has one child. She has done a business for the past two years. She is a sewer. She sews traditional dresses for women. She decorates dresses by herself. She has a great number of satisfied customers. She likes to work hard. Mehri often gets tired. She is sick now. She earns enough money for needs of her family, but it is not enough for getting a treatment in hospital. She needs financial support for getting treatment in hospital.

loans.use: To get a treatment in hospital

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer casada, ella tiene 7  hijos, 5 son mujeres  ya son grandes y apoyan a su madre en los oficios de la casa y en otras actividades, esta familia viven en la comunidad de Concepción, Lucia tiene ahora 43 años. 
Lucia aparte de ser ama de casa, ella con el apoyo de sus cinco hijas se dedica a la agricultura para generar su economía, ella se siente muy identificada con la actividad porque desde pequeña trabajaba la agricultura con sus padres, todo lo que cosecha Lucia los comercializa en su comunidad y en otros lugares, lo que genera ella y sus hijas, les sirve para sufragar otros gastos  para la prosperidad de su familia. 
Lucía en los tiempos libres  también sale a trabajar como jornalero, aparte de genera más ingreso, le sirve también para retroalimentar sus conocimientos y todo proceso nuevo  lo llega a replicar en sus cultivos.
 Lucia tiene su casita pero  necesita aun acabado para que sea más atractivo, ella piensa  ayudar a su esposo para que se realice este trabajo, a raíz de este trabajo, Lucia está buscando un prestamo para comprar los insumos, y ella con sus ingresos pagara el prestamo.  Los seños de Lucia es sembrar cada en gran cantidad para generar más ingresos y todo por el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucía is a married woman with 7 children. Five of them are girls who are now adults and they help their mother with the household jobs and other activities. The family lives in the community of Concepción. Lucía is now 43 years old. Apart from being a housewife, she works in agriculture, with the help of her five daughters, to generate her income. She feels a strong connection with her work because she worked in agriculture with her parents from a young age. 

She sells everything she harvests in her community and in other places. The money which she and her daughters make enables them to offset other costs for the family's financial wellbeing. In her free time Lucía also goes out to work as a day labourer and apart from generating more income this also helps her by updating her knowledge, and she goes on to use any new techniques on her own crops. 

Lucía has a small house but it still needs finishing off to make it look better. She plans to help her husband so he can do this work, and on this basis she is asking for a loan to buy the supplies. She will pay off the loan using her income. Lucía's dream is to plant all of her crops in large quantities so she can make more income, all for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction finishing materials.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes de este comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé, formaron este grupo llamado San Cayetano, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La señora Irma es la presidenta del comité, una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida para poder ayudar a su familia. Irma tiene una olería en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, donde hace ladrillos para poder venderlos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leñas y arcilla para la producción de ladrillos, lo cual le permitirá seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The 15 members of this committee are from the city of Caacupé. They formed this group, called San Cayetano, in which everyone is trying their hardest to be able to grow and get ahead. 

Señora Irma is the president of the committee. She is a very hardworking person, who fights to be able to improve her living conditions to be able to help her family. Irma has a workshop in which everyone works from very early hours, where they make bricks to be able to sell them. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of firewood and clay to make bricks, which will allow her to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy firewood and clay for the production of bricks.

loans.name: Renovacion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renovación  está en su ciclo número 3, son de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona rural, aun en crecimiento, y rural, con poca seguridad y acceso difícil.
La Sra. Lourdes es una de las integrantes, ella sale a vender ropas, entre lencerías y otros accesorios.  Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda que van recibiendo de la fundación paraguaya por medio de sus capacitaciones vayan mejorando y creciendo en sus emprendimientos.
Solicita este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias y accesorios,  de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y con ello poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called Renovación is in its third cycle. The members are from the city of Concepción, a rural area that is still growing, that lacks security and is difficult to access. 

Señora Lourdes is one of the members. She goes out to sell clothing, from lingerie to other accessories. She hopes that as time passes, and through the help that she has been receiving from the Fundación Paraguaya, her business will continue to grow and improve. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various clothing items and accessories, in order to continue with her sales, and be able to continue fulfilling her customers orders.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items and accesories to be sold.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 41 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, and she primarily grows and sells rice to the local dealer and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for 25 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2 a day.

As a supplementary income, she came up with a new business idea. She wants to raise pigs for sale. However, her insufficient capital invested doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy pigs. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her standard of living. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Gary

texts.en:
Gary is a 38-year-old married man and a father of a seven-year-old child from Montebello, Leyte. Gary is engaged in a food vending business, selling home cooked foods, barbecue, and other items. He has been in the business for more than four years now. 

Gary is requesting to take out a loan to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, rice, cooking oil and condiments, soft drinks and others.  This loan will enable to him to cook and sell more to his customers. In the future, Gary has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, rice, cooking oil and condiments, soft drinks and others

loans.name: Saraphina

texts.en:
Saraphina is a single woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 18 years to 45 years. She describes herself to be determined and humble.

She operates a rental business where she rents out her building. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a secure area of operation, and her primary customers are working people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be capital to add more rentals.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to renovate the houses.

Her business goal is to build other rental houses in another area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a new home in the urban area. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is from the province of Leyte, Philippines.

Emma has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Emma is asking to take a loan to buy piglets and animal feed. A loan will help Emma improve her hog-raising business; thus generating more revenue and income.

Emma dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive in the future. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 55, lives in Kapsowar, which is a small agricultural center in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is a husband and a father to a lovely family. Paul started a mixed farm in 2011 and continues to farm for a living. His primary income sources are eggs, milk and crops. 

Paul enjoys poultry farming and dairy farming above all other activities. The main challenges he faces with this type of farming are disease outbreaks and expensive dairy feed. Paul is asking for a loan to buy a quality breed of sheep. To him, raising sheep is an enjoyable and lucrative farming experience. He understands the challenges that come with sheep farming and the market uncertainties. This knowledge has influenced his strategic plans to incorporate a few measures beforehand. 

Sheep farming is very profitable and Paul will benefit from sheep wool which fetches high prices in the local and international markets. He plans to use the income from this investment to repay the loan and to pay for his children's and siblings' education. When he was asked how the loan would benefit his family, he said, “I will be able to educate my children and also feed my family.”

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Saroeurn, 49, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. On average, she is able to make an income of 2 USD a day. She is a lovely mother of two single children. One of her children is going to be married soon. However, she doesn't have enough money to prepare a proper wedding party. Thus, she is applying for a KIVA loan to pay for her child’s wedding party. Through this loan, she hopes that it can bring real happiness for this new couple. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s wedding party.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru: Эркин, 53 года, женат, отец 3 детей, старшая дочь- студентка, младшие - школьники. У Эркина- среднее образование, уже 24 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав с покупки одной коровы, благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Эркина в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, он продает экологически-чистое молоко. На участке мерою 1,30 ГА выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). Он в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита он хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку нового автомобиля для его семьи.
texts.en:
Erkin is 53 and married with three children. His oldest daughter is in university and the other two children are in school. He has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry for 24 years, a business he began with the purchase of one cow. Thanks to his hard work, he currently has three cows on his farm and sells organic milk. In addition, he grows clover for his own use on 1.3 hectares of land. His total monthly income is about 18,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing his business, Erkin has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase steers for fattening and resale. He wants to put profits from the loan into further increasing his number of livestock, and plans to save toward purchasing a new family car.

loans.use: to purchase steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 53-year-old married woman living in the province of Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items in her community. Irene has been in the business for more than 10 years. Irene is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Irene hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shaarbubu

texts.ru: Шаарбубу успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Шаарбубу есть 3 коровы, 25 овец. Ежемесячная пенсия Шаарбубу - 3,722 сом (KGS). Увеличение скота позволит увеличить доходы и улучшить благосостояние ее семьи, поэтому Шаарбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) 2 телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шаарбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Shaarbubu successfully paid of her previous loan, having used it as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who offered her financial support. She currently has three cows and 25 sheep on her farm and a monthly pension of 3,722 KGS. Increasing her head count of livestock will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Therefore, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase two calves to increase her number of cattle. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy two calves in order to increase her head count of livestock

loans.name: Caleb's Group

texts.en:
Caleb is 45 years old and has six children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Caleb is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Caleb started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Caleb’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 55 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Everlyne has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough money to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Everlyne also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, since it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Everlyne's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient, hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Merk's Group

texts.en:
Merk’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Merk makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chandy's Group

texts.en:
Chandy’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chandy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en: Somaly’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Somaly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jenelyn1 Group

texts.en:
Gloria is the featured borrower of Jenelyn 1 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They came to work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Gloria is a 51-year-old married mother of three children. She is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines.

The same case is applied to the other group members. Karen is a 31-year-old married mother of one child, Grace is a 41-year-old married mother of three children, and Yolanda is a 43-year-old married mother of four children. They all want to support their families in the Philippines.

Gloria is the first lady on the left, Karen is the second lady on the left, Grace is the second lady on the right, and Yolanda is the first lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines.

loans.name: Rula9 Group

texts.en:
Nawal is the featured borrower for Rula9 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Nawal is a 39-year-old married mother of three children who started almost two years ago working in a shoe shop with limited income. She started working as a Tupperware saleswoman as a second source of income to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Nawal is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying hard to develop her business in order to satisfy her children's needs, so today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business with new Tupperware products to satisfy her customers' special requests and needs. Nawal is the second lady on the left of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Roula is a 30-year-old married mother of two children who works as a make-up and tattoo artist in addition to selling special cosmetics; she wants to develop her business. Soultana is a 49-year-old single lady who wants to renovate her house, and Nadine is a 33-year-old single lady who wants to renovate her house too.

Roula is the first lady on the right, Soultana is the first lady on the left, and Nadine is the second lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business with new Tupperware products to satisfy her customers' special requests and needs

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a 59-year-old married woman from Montebello, Leyte. She earns a living through her food vending business. Jessie cooks rice cakes and sells them to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for the past 10 years now. 

Jessie is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients such as rice, flour, sugar, yeast and flavorings. This loan will enable her to cook and sell more to her customers thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as rice, flour, sugar, yeast and flavorings.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 42 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has six children. One is married and lives independently, while the other five are single and live under her support. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland that is located near her house. She has been in this business for nearly 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of 2 USD a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use. There is no latrine in her house now; therefore, Sophat is taking out a loan with the help of KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to reduce environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL (Kiva's partner) with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en: Samet’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samet makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married female. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 24 years to 40 years. She describes herself as disciplined. 

She operates a boutique  where she sells clothes to her customers. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a well-populated place and her primary customers are working people and walk-ins. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to purchase other bundles of stock. Her business goal is to open a new branch in a different area within 5 years. It is her third loan with the institution.

loans.use: to purchase other bundles of stock.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
