In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado De los Angeles está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de / Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo.
La Sra. Ramona es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras por la ciudad y alrededores, es una mujer muy trabajadora y está luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante. Ramona todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano, ella está luchando para poder darle a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y de esa forma evitar que pasen por necesidades.
Ramona pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras variadas, para que de esa forma siga con sus ventas, y tener una mejor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, called Los Angeles, is in its 3rd cycle in the committee for women program.  It’s located in the town of Concepcion, which is a distance for the city center and growing.  It’s a difficult to reach area and the residents want to continue growing. 

Ramona is one of the members who sells fruits and vegetables in the city and the surrounding area.  She is a hardworking woman who is striving to grow and get ahead.  Ramona begins working very early in the morning and strives to provide her family with everything she didn’t have so that they won’t have any unmet needs.

Ramona is asking for this loan to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue making sales and have a greater variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Achocalla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ACHOCALLA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Candelaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de refrescos, venta de regalos, venta de verduras, venta de jugos, librería, venta de tarjetas telefónicas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Candelaria es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frescos y jugos; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento por iniciativa propia, ya que tenía la necesidad de contar con un medio de generación económica y la elaboración de jugos era práctico y sencillo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licuadora industrial) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta presente la hija de una de las clientes que quería participar en el grupo, ella esta vestida con una chompa azul.
texts.en:
Las Emprendedoras de Achocalla Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Candelaria is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including soft drink sales, gift sales, vegetable sales, juice sales, a bookstore, and phone card sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Candelaria.  She said it's her first time with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer who visited her at her home.  Currently she has a business selling soft drinks and juices.  She made it known that she started this business on her own initiative because she needed a way to earn money, and making juice was practical and easy.

The loan she's getting is to increase her capital with the purchase of an industrial blender, which she'll get from vendors in the city of El Alto and later use in her retail space.  This job allows her to earn income to support her family, because she's in a common-law relationship and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the institution's health offerings and training.

The daughter of one of the clients is in the photo, wearing a blue sweater; she wanted to participate in the group.

loans.use: to buy an industrial blender

loans.name: Amigas De Puerto Perez I Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE PUERTO PEREZ I” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vanesa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), tienda de abarrotes, venta de salchipapas (comida rápida tradicional).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vanesa es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace cinco años con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer, ya que observó en su comunidad la escasez de este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank “AMIGAS DE PUERTO PEREZ I” will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Vanesa is the president. The types of businesses that the members engage in are varied and include: sales of cheese, chuño (dehydrated potatoes), salchipapas (traditional fast food), and a grocery store. 

The loan they are seeking will benefit micro entrepreneurs such as member, Vanesa. She states that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of a massive promotion that the institution carried out in her area. Today she has a neighborhood store and states that she started the business five years ago with the first loan she got from Pro Mujer, when she noted the scarcity of such businesses in her community. 

The loan she is asking for now is to increase capital (to buy groceries at wholesale). She will buy the groceries from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then sell them from her store. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is 73 years old. He is married to Doreen; together they have been blessed with five children.

Wambua is a cattle farmer, a business he has done for the last 15 years. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Wambua has requested his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya of 70,000 KES, which he will use to pay school fees for his children. He successfully repaid his previous loans. With the anticipated profits, Wambua will be able to see to it that his children are educated for life.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen and his family live in the village of Kaghnut in Syunik region. In the village where he was born, he established a nice farm when he was a young man. Until now, he has been taking care of that farm with the help of his lovely wife and children. (He has a son and a daughter.)

Armen has cows, calves, bulls, heifers, piglets and a horse on his farm. He used to work as a taxi driver, but since he made his farm bigger, he left his taxi driving and concentrated on developing the farm.

His farm products include milk, macun (national dairy product), butter and cheese, and also meat that he sells to his customers from the city and to city butchers.

Armen says that like any farmer, he is also impatient for the coming spring, when his farm cattle will have enough fresh grass for being perfectly fed. Now his stored animal fodder for the winter months is over. He will use this loan for the purchase of some more animal fodder for his farm cattle until the fields will be filled with green and fresh grass.

loans.use: to buy some more animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim, 36 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children in total. To support the family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland, and grows and sells rice to the local dealers and customers in the market. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

As a supplementary income, she came up with a new business idea. She wants to raise cows for sale. However, her insufficient capital investment doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy cows.

She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her living standard. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Patoune Zambo Group

texts.fr:
Madame TINGA MAIMOUNA est la représentante du groupe PATOUNE ZAMBO. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé à 27 ans et le moins âgé à 07ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 10 personnes en charge. 
Madame vend des fruits et légumes depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
 Elle veut s’acheter 05 paniers de bananes.
Madame compte utiliser ces bénéfices pour s'occuper de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne accroitre son activité et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ms. TINGA MAIMOUNA is the official of the group PATOUNE ZAMBO. A married woman, she is the mother of five children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 7. Two go to school. Ms. TINGA MAIMOUNA has ten persons to support. She has been selling fruit & vegetables for twelve years. She gets her supplies at the market in her district. She wants to purchase 5 baskets of bananas. She wants to use these profits to take care of her children. Her ambition is to grow her business and to cover her children’s schooling cost.

loans.use: to purchase 5 baskets of bananas

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a hardware shop along side welding to supplement his income. He has been in business for three years and has managed to support his family using the proceeds. His family dream is to construct a residential house for his people despite being challenged by inadequate capital. Robert will use the loan facility to buy building materials like cement and nails to sell.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and nails to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Creativas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Creativas, son de la ciudad de Concepción, son mujeres de familias, que luchan para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida poco a poco. Son de una zona aun en crecimiento, alejada de la capital del país.
La Sra. Emilse es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, comenta que le va muy bien ya que las prendas de segunda mano son muy aceptadas. Emilse esta luchando para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida, no solo para ella sino también para su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas usadas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando cada vez mas por una vida mejor.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women). They are from the city of Concepción and are family-oriented women who strive to be able to improve their living conditions little by little. They are from an area that is still growing, far from the country's capital.

Emilse is one of the members; she makes a living by selling second-hand clothing. She says that her business is going very well, as second-hand clothing is very accepted. Emilse is striving to be able to have a better quality of life, not only for herself but also for her family. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy used clothing in order to continue with her sales, constantly striving more and more for a better life.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Sociology. Here is her story:

“I haven’t ever seen my father. When I was 7 years old, my mother got married again. She and my stepfather have 3 more children. Unfortunately, they couldn’t find a common language that they divorced. This case so weakened our financial situation, as my mother hasn’t worked after giving birth to my last sibling. Of course, my step-father pays alimony for his children, but it’s so difficult to my mother physically and morally to raise 4 children by herself. I am the eldest one, my 10-year-old brother studies at school and 5-year-old sister goes to the kindergarten. The youngest sibling is at home with mother, who is a house-wife. Everything gets expensive day by day and we get more financially dependent from our grandparents. They are pensioners, who love us very much and do their best to assist my mother.

I was an active student at school and used to take part in every extra-curricular activity. AUCA also gives me a chance to show my abilities in singing, dancing, debates and games. There are a lot of advantages of AUCA:  one of them is an opportunity to continue studying abroad. Most of AUCA graduates get their Masters at American and Western universities, Diploma of which guarantees good perspectives in career and encourages them to grow personally and in society.

For some students a Kiva loan is a way to help their parents to pay their university tuition and I am not an exception. I don’t know how to help my mother in other way, but I am sure that receiving education at AUCA I will be useful for my siblings, my mother and totally for my Motherland. I greatly appreciate lenders’ trust and their help to me.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is 34 years old, married with three children and hails from Apac district in Northern Uganda. Having finished his Junior High equivalent, he dropped out of school due to a lack of school fees and moved to the city, where he was employed as a supervisor at a steel factory. He later moved back to the village to engage in farming before returning to the city selling eggs and working as a used car salesman.

It was at this stage that he met his cousin Denish, a Micro Entrepreneur with UpEnergy Uganda Ltd who introduced him to the business of selling improved cook stoves. Nickson has been selling cook stoves for the last two years in partnership with UpEnergy.

By working with UpEnergy, Nickson has been able to earn extra income and pay for his children’s tuition fees. It has also enabled him to start the construction of his own house in his native village. Nickson's favourite part about working with UpEnergy is that they provide unique life changing products for the community, which significantly improves their livelihoods.

He knows that through using energy efficient cook stoves, end-users reduce deforestation and save money by consuming less fuel. Nickson's aspiration in life is to build a small house for his family in the city, enable his children to get a good education and to live a better life.  

The Kiva loan will enable Nickson to increase his stock levels thus reducing the time and costs spent moving back and forth to replenish his stock. A portion of the loan will also go towards leasing a storage facility for his products. Furthermore, Nickson will use the loan to purchase marketing materials that will help him to increase sales. These basic steps will enable Nickson to grow his business substantially.

loans.use: to increase his stock, lease a storage facility, and purchase marketing materials

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 50 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Agnes has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Agnes also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the dark hours which will enable her children to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Agnes's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a communicative woman. She was born in the southern part of the country. She is living in a village. She is married. She has two children. 

Gulchehra is a participant of the course, 'To Get Ahead.' After training, she decided to open her own business. She is new in the sphere of doing a business. 

Gulchehra is an honest, responsive, and punctual person. Her husband is sick and cannot feed his family now. 

Gulchehra needs to open a business in order to help her husband to feed the family. She will buy fabrics and sell them in a local market. She wants to buy fabrics to start a business. She is requesting financial support to open a new business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to start a business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a rural farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya, an area known for having bad land terrain and lack of proper infrastructure. She is blessed with a lovely family, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. On her farm, she grows maize, and she raises a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. However, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction, despite meager earnings. Gladys says, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" 

Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. For a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Gladys formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance organization that supports small rural farmers. 

She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for "beautiful"). The cow produces milk daily, which Gladys sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Gladys. The money Gladys got from selling the milk was adequate to repay the loan. 

Today, Gladys is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow because she is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Gladys is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health and livelihood. Gladys patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Kalamo Group

texts.fr: Daniko est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Kalamo», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un cultivateur, âgée de 36 ans, mère de six enfants qui tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des produits manufacturés dans un marché de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en savons en poudre, savons de toilettes et sucre. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Daniko is a businesswoman, a member of the "banc villageois" Kalamo, and a client of MFI Hekima. She is married to a farmer, aged 36, and the mother of six children, all enrolled in school. She began her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling manufactured goods in a market in the town for six years.  

Daniko is going to stock up on powdered detergent, toilet soap, and sugar. She would like to buy a plot of land, send her children to school, and feed them. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who don't have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: to stock up on powdered detergent, toilet soap, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Wilfrida's Group

texts.en:
Wilfrida is 55 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Wilfrida has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Wilfrida also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Wilfrida's Group will be able to receive a total of two solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of five acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat’s group live in a rural village near Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbayar, 26 years old, lives with his mother in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a machinist at a mining company since 2014. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

Enkhbayar is requesting a loan of MNT 5,800,000 to buy an electric car for a taxi service. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. He will render taxi services during his day off. 

One of Enkhbayar's dreams is to make his mother happy.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for a taxi service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leurs vingt septième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente NAH première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon de bois. Elle compte acheter des sacs de charbon de bois sur place. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Bamako à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DJANTOYERELA is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in the village of Warassala, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They have business involving charcoal and general goods. The women of the group DJANTOYERELA are on their 27th solidarity loan.

With the goal of satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, the women turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, NAH, the first person sitting from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of charcoal. She intends to purchase sacks of charcoal locally. Her sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Bamako. She plans on making a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Margarita Floresmila

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Pablo se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudadela Costa Azul  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro son mayores de edad y uno de 17 años que estudia en el colegio y el  aún vive con ellos. Su esposo trabaja en un barco y tienen casa propia.
Doña Margarita es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los sábados y domingos cinco horas al día, le ayuda una hija a recorrer vendiendo y cobrando;  ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene veinte años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Tiene 20 años haciendo los créditos, lo que le gusta de la fundación es la puntualidad en los pagos y la agilidad de los créditos. Espera tener un local grande para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Pablo loan group meets twice a month in the Costa Azul community of the town of Manta. The town is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited throughout the year, for its unparalleled beauty, and for its tourist attractions.  

Sra. Margarita lives there. She is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Four of them are adults and one is 17 years old and is a college student. He still lives at home. Her husband works on a boat. They own a house.

Sra. Margarita is a housewife, but to earn money of her own and to help her husband with household expenses, she also sells clothing from a catalog as well as Yanbal products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). She works for five hours a day on Saturdays and Sundays. One of her daughters helps her with sales and accounting; Margarita sells on credit and then collects the money weekly. She’s been doing this work for twenty years and all is going well. The most popular products are perfumes and cosmetics.

The loan money will be used to buy more perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and underwear. Margarita has been accessing loans for twenty years. What she most likes about the Foundation is the quick payment of loans and the ease of getting them. She hopes one day to have large premises to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz is a responsible woman. She was born in 1989. She is living in a rural area and is divorced. She has two children. She is goal-oriented, honest and a peaceful person. She has a business of selling salads. 

Dilafruz passionately relates to her work. She prepares very tasty salads. She has a lot of satisfied customers. The money which she earns from her activity is not enough for the treatment of her sick child. Her child needs to be treated. She is planning to treat her child in hospital. 

Dilafruz is requesting financial support to get treatment in hospital for her child.

loans.use: To get treatment in hospital for her sick child

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Twenty years ago, Juliana started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Bureti, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart; every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Juliana believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Juliana waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is 36 years old. He is married with four children aged between 3 and 9 years; all of them go to school. He has a mini-market and has been in business for the past two years. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more baking powder for making more bread and snacks for sale. The profits will be used to expand the business and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more baking powder for making more bread and snacks to sell

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 40 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by thirteen farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Rosemary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rosemary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Rosemary's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Narmandakh

texts.en: Mr. Narmandakh, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2004. His wife operates a grocery store. Their two children go to secondary school. Using his previous loan, he repaired his automobile, which is his family's main income source. This time, he is requesting a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to buy building materials such as fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his home in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en: Parvina is a resident of the Vakhsh district and lives with her mother. She is 29 years old .She is engaged in the purchase and sale clothing. In this kind of activity she has a lot of experience. Parvina often comes to town to purchase clothing. Afterwards, she carries the goods to distant villages and sells them. She always has superior goods and the customers are always satisfied with her. Now Parvina would like to expand her business and purchase more clothing because in the distant villages, many people are unable to come to the city and do shopping, so they order Parvina to buy things they need. But unfortunately, she has not enough money to do this. For this reason, she is asking for a loan. With your support, she will be able to improve her income and satisfy the needs of the people in remote areas.

loans.use: To buy clothing and expand her business

loans.name: Gulzira

texts.en: This is Gulzira. It is her second time to apply to Kiva lenders. With the first loan, thanks to your help and support, she paid the contract for her education in University and continued her studies. During her studies, she showed herself to be competent, conscientious, neat, and responsible for her assigned tasks. She is obtaining knowledge she successfully applies in her work. Gulzira also provides for her family so she does not have enough money to pay the annual contract for her education. She is grateful for you and hopes you will support her.

loans.use: to pay for her studies at the university

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en: Mahina is a generous woman. She was born in 1988. She is living in a rural area. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a builder. Mahina is a teacher. She teaches pupils in their domestic school. She is a kind, honest and educated person. She works and studies at the same time. The money which she earns from school is not enough to pay tuition. Her university is asking for payment. She needs financial support to pay tuition.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Neema operates a grocery vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Manuel Horacio

texts.es:
Manta es una de las ciudades más importantes del Ecuador, localizada en la provincia de Manabí.  Aquí se reúnen cada 15 días los socios del Grupo De Crédito Jorge Zambrano.
En este lugar vive al señor Manuel, tiene 25  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 1 hijo de 19 meses. La esposa le ayuda en el negocio, viven con los padres de la esposa.
Don Manuel se dedica a la venta de pollos tiene un pequeño local en el mercado, la esposa es quien le ayuda a la comercialización, esta actividad la realizan todos los días de Lunes a Domingos de 6h00 a 16h00 y  en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los tienen  listos para la venta, los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras por su casa y en el mercado.  Lleva 2 años dedicado a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar el pan diario. El negocio lo puso con el primer crédito que obtuvo con la fundación.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, para la temporada de Navidad ya que tiene mucha demanda del producto. Tiene 2 años haciendo los créditos en la fundación, le gustan por la organización y la responsabilidad del grupo. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Manta is one of the most important towns of Ecuador; it is located in Manabí province. The members of the Jorge Zambrano credit group meet there every two weeks.

25-year old Sr. Manuel lives there. He and his common-law partner have a 19-month old son. His wife helps with his business. They live with her parents.

Manuel sells chickens from a small stall in the market. His wife helps with sales. They work every day from 6 am to 4 pm. During the right season Manuel buys a large quantity of chickens which he prepares for sale. He delivers them to nearby stores and also sells them by weight from his house and in the market. He’s had this job for two years and it has served him well as a means of earning a living. Manuel started his business with the first loan he received from the Foundation.

This new loan will be used to buy chickens for the Christmas season when there is a big demand. Manuel has had loans for two years; he likes working with the Foundation as it is well organized and his group is responsible. His dream is to have a house of his own.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: María Olaya

texts.es:
Manta es una de las ciudades más importantes del Ecuador, localizada en la provincia de Manabí. Aquí se reúnen cada 15 días los socios del Grupo De Crédito Jorge Zambrano.
En este lugar vive la señora Olaya, tiene 56 años de edad,  tiene unión libre y de esta relación tienen once hijos mayores de edad que viven independiente. Su esposo es discapacitado por lo que no trabaja, ellos tienen casa propia.
Doña Olaya  hace varios años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño local de batidos, jugos y chicha (bebida típica de maíz molido y cocido) en el mercado, todos los días prepara deliciosos batidos y es reconocida por su chica que es la mejor, trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde. Trabaja sola de lunes a Viernes y los sábados y domingos le ayuda un nieto y una hija.  Nos cuenta que tiene su local por  años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar  frutas, azúcar, leche y otros ingredientes.  Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años y le gusta porque el grupo es responsable. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darle buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Manta is one of the most important cities of Ecuador. It is located in the Manabi province. Here, the members of the Credit Group Jorge Zambrano meet every 15 days. Mrs. Olaya lives at this location, she is 56 years old and has a common law relationship. She has 11 adult children from this relationship, who live independently. Her husband is handicapped thus he does not work. They have their own home. Mrs. Olaya started her own business several years ago. She has a small market stand of shakes, juices, and chicha (typical beverage made of cooked ground corn.)  Every day, she prepares her delicious shakes and she is well known for her chicha, which is the best.  She works Mondays to Sundays from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.  She works by herself from Monday to Friday, and on Saturdays and Sundays she is helped by her grandson and a daughter. She told us that she has had this store for years, and that it has always done very well. She will use this loan to purchase fruits, sugar, milk and other ingredients. She has been part of the Credit Group for the past three years, and she likes it because the group is responsible. Her goals are to move ahead with her business and to give a good quality of life to her family.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to roast and resell in his grilled foods shop

loans.name: Betty Noemi

texts.es:
Manta es una de las ciudades más importantes del Ecuador, localizada en la provincia de Manabí. Aquí se reúnen cada 15 días los socios del Grupo De Crédito Jorge Zambrano.
En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 44  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 14, 16 y 24  años de edad, estudian en colegio y Universidad. Su esposo es maestro albañil.
Doña Betty es una mujer muy luchadora y que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar puso un pequeña cevicheria en su casa y hace entrega a domicilio, los sábados y domingos además de comida también vende ropa de temporada playera (short, trajes de baño, etc.). Trabaja todos los días en las tardes desde las 14h00 hasta las 16h00 en la venta de ropa. Trabaja sola. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar trajes de baño, short, camisetas, gorras, etc. y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los ceviches. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta porque la atención que recibe en cada reunión con el asesor  y las facilidades para recibir los créditos.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manta is one of the most important towns of Ecuador; it is located in Manabí province. The members of the Jorge Zambrano credit group meet there every two weeks.

44-year old Sra. Betty lives there. She is married and has three children aged 14, 16, and 24. They are high school or university students. Her husband is a master builder.

Sra. Betty is a hardworking woman. To help with household expenses she has a small seafood restaurant in her house which is open on Saturdays and Sundays. She also sells beachwear such as shorts, swimsuits etc. Betty works every afternoon from 2 pm to 4 pm selling these items. She works alone and has been doing this job for two years. It is going well.

She plans to use the loan to buy beachwear, shorts, t-shirts, caps etc. as well as supplies to make seafood dishes. She’s been a member of this credit group for three years. She likes the helpful treatment she gets from the counselor at the meetings and the easy repayments. Her dreams are to carry on with her business and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: buy beachwear, shorts, t-shirts, caps etc. as well as supplies to make seafood dishes

loans.name: Julita's Group

texts.en:
Julita is 45 years old, has 6 children, and lives in Kwoyo C village in Ndhiwa sub county, Kenya. Julita works as a subsistence farmer for a living. Her community of Kwoyo C village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Julita is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Julita represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Julita and three other promoters in her community need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Julita wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser system will help prevent water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Julita’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is 50 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Christine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Christine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Christine's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With her portion of this loan, Martha will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Martha plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Martha’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of seven acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is 32 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Bondo village in Ndhiwa sub county Kenya. Everlyne works as a business owner for a living. Her community of Bondo village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Everlyne is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Everlyne represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Everlyne and 4 other promoters in her community need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Everlyne wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser system prevents water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Everlyne’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce lives in a home with mud walls, dirt floor, and a iron roof in Kokelo village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya with her family which includes 4 children. The community of Kokelo village collects their drinking water from Kajosi well because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Kokelo’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Kokelo, 30 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Joyce has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water in order to keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 3 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Jackline, Zakayo and Samwel.

Kokelo village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Joyce believes that chlorine-treated water will reduce water-borne diseases. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joyce’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Risper’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

George is 33 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Abaranono A village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that George and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

George and another promoter in his community, known as Pamela, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret lives in a home with concrete walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof in Andingo Lower village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya with her family which includes 5 children. The community of Andingo Lower village collects their drinking water from a community spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Andingo Lower's inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Andingo Lower 15 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Margaret has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are 3 other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: namely Julius, Lucy and Margaret.

Andingo Lower village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Margaret believes that the dispenser will treat the water, thus preventing water-borne diseases. 

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Margaret’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its patients.

loans.name: Daarul-Hudah School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Mohammad. He is the Head teacher of Daaral-Hudah Islamic Education School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Mukono with 50 students. Daaral-Hudah Islamic Education School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The schools do not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Daaral-Hudah Islamic Education School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Mohammand ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Chichek

texts.en:
Chichek is 45 years old. She is divorced; her husband left Chichek with two children, and since then she has been raising her children alone. Now she is living with her lovely family in the Absheron region, but the family members are IDPs (internally displaced persons) from Agdam city for 22 years.

Chichek has a little store where she sells housewares such as mops, buckets, tablecloths, etc. Today Chichek is planning to support her business, and for that she needs 2,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more housewares to sell.

She says thanks to the Kiva organization and its lenders for the loan and help. In the future she wants to increase her monthly income and to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more housewares to sell, so that she can increase her business and, in future, give a good education to her children.

loans.name: Nyamragchaa

texts.en: Nyamragchaa, 26 years old, lives with his mother and two brothers in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Using his previous loan two years ago, he renovated his house, enabling his family to live in a comfortable and warm place. But due to heavy snowfall and rain, his house has taken considerable damage. So again he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live again in a comfortable and warm place. The borrower is a policeman who is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a 42-year-old single lady who has sold clothes for eight years to cover her needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers.

Najla is working hard to develop her business; thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers in this winter season. This loan will increase Najla's income and improve her living conditions. She hopes to expand her business more in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new fashionable clothes to satisfy her customers in this winter season

loans.name: Faridun

texts.en: Faridun is 26 years old, married and has one child. He lives with his family in the Qubodiyon district. Faridun is a well-mannered person. Faridun is a professional photographer who has his own photo salon where he works and offers photographic services. Sometimes he is invited to weddings to shoot video and take photos. His work is always rated as excellent. Faridun wants to expand his photography business. He is planning to buy equipment for the photo studio and increase his opportunities. He will be able to offer modern photo services and improve the financial condition of his family. That is why he is asking for a loan. He needs your support and help.

loans.use: То expand his photography business.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 22-year-old single man who has been working in a motorcycle repair business for six years to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his family, which consists of three members. He is a hard worker with a very good reputation in his domain and region.

Today Husein is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary repairing tools, which will facilitate his business and allow him to provide his customers with better and quick service.

Husein hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary repairing tools that will facilitate his business

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 49-year-old single lady who has worked as a tailor for 31 years. In 1990, she started her own business to make sure that she would have a good income source..
Nawal is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers for her professional skills. She is trying hard to develop her business. So, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will help her transport raw materials from the market.
Nawal hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy a car which will help her transport raw materials from the market

loans.name: Maysam Group

texts.en:
Wissam is the featured borrower of Maysam group. She joined with the other group members to acquire the current Al Majmoua Kiva loan. They have been neighbors and best friends for a long time and they are working hard to develop their businesses.
Wissam is an 18-year-old married lady who's expecting her first baby very soon. She has been working from her house in the beauty business specializing in nails and eyebrows for the last two years.
Her business income combined with her husband's is barely enough to cover increasing living expenses. That's why she is putting all her trust in the Al Majmoua Kiva loan that will be invested in covering her baby's needs.
She is at the far left in the picture. As for the other members, Maysam is the lady in the center and her loan will be invested in paying for her driver license expenses. Jean D'Arc is in the right side of the picture and she will invest her loan to make necessary sanitary improvements to her house.

loans.use: To pay for necessary preparations to her expected baby

loans.name: Rosario Narcisa

texts.es:
Manta es una de las ciudades más importantes del Ecuador, localizada en la provincia de Manabí.  Aquí se reúnen cada 15 días los socios del Grupo De Crédito Jorge Zambrano.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 55  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos está soltero vive en la misma casa y estudia Universidad. El marido es maestro pintor y albañil, tienen casa propia.
Doña Rosario es una mujer muy luchadora y que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar vende comida rápida en su casa, (papas fritas, hamburguesas, etc.) y otros productos elaborados. Trabaja todos los días en las noches desde las 18h00 hasta las 23H00 o hasta que se termine lo que se preparó. Trabaja sola. Tiene algunos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va utilizar en materiales para el local de comida rápida, (carne, papas, pan y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos). Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 años  y le gusta porque le ayudan con los créditos.
texts.en: Manta is one of the most important cities of Ecuador. It is located in the province of Manabi. Here, the members of the Credit Group Jorge Zambrano meet every 15 days. Mrs. Rosario lives in this location.  She is 55 years old and she has a common law marriage. She has 4 adult children from this relationship.  One of them is single and lives in the same house and studies at the university. Her husband is a painter and mason. They have their own home. Mrs. Rosario is a hard working woman, who sells fast food ( french fries, hamburgers, etc.) and other processed foods from her house to help with the household expenses. She works every night from 18:00 p.m. to 23:00 p.m., or until the prepared food is finished. She works by herself. She has worked in this activity for several years and it has gone very well. She will use this loan to purchase ingredients for the fast food stand (meat, potatoes, bread, and other ingredients for food preparation.) She has been part of the Credit Group for the past 4 years, and she likes it because it helps her with the loans.

loans.use: To purchase meat, potatoes, bread and other ingreients for food preparation.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Thomas lives with his beautiful wife in Kapsowar, a small rural town in Kenya. The Kapsowar area is also referred to as the mango region of Kenya because half the mangoes consumed are from that region. He has been farming for the past five years and has never looked back. To earn a decent and honest living, he sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops.

Thomas is satisfied with the returns he gets through farming. However, he wants to diversify and start horticulture farming. The main challenge he faces is accessing funds. He is kindly requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. To access funds, Thomas joined Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports smallholder farmers with both financial and technical solutions. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo, he answered, “They assist small-scale farmers.” Through horticulture, he will be able to improve his living standards and secure the future of his school-going children. In the long run, the ultimate goal for Thomas is to permanently improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Fanny Magaly

texts.es:
Manta es una de las ciudades más importantes del Ecuador, localizada en la provincia de Manabí.  Aquí se reúnen cada 15 días los socios del Grupo De Crédito Jorge Zambrano.
En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 18, 16 y 13  años de edad, estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es taxista y la casa donde viven es alquilada.
Doña Fanny con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres  días a la semana en las tardes y esto lo realiza sola o de vez en cuando su esposo la acompaña, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 años  y le gusta todo de la fundación, las charlas educativas, la facilidad del crédito y las formas de pago. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Manta is one of the main cities in Ecuador. It is located in the province of Manabí. Every 15 days the members of the Loan Group Jorge Zambrano meet there. Fanny lives in this place. She is 38 years old. She is married and they have 3 children of 18,16, and 13 years of age. They attend college and school. 
Her husband is a taxi driver, and they live in a rental house.


Fanny wanted to make some money in her own, and she also wanted to thrive. She sells all kind of clothes. She goes door to door, and she also sells from her home, where she has a small shop.

She works three days a week, in the afternoon. She does this by herself, but sometimes her husband is with her. She gives credit to her customers, and she gets paid every fifteen days. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil, every two weeks or once a month, depending on her needs.

She is being doing this for four years, and it is going very well. She'll use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children clothes. 

She has been a member of the loan group for 5 years, and she likes everything about the foundation: the educational talks, the easiness to get a loan, and the installments. 

Her dream is to see her kids finishing school and becoming good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and kids clothes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a young farmer from Koibatek, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. Agnes has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. She is a lovely mother and has been doing farming for the last 10 years so that she can supplement her income from the small business she does. Agnes does crop farming and cattle raising and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances to improve her farming and animal diseases. This has made her seek a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase sheep. Her projections are that by the end of the year, these sheep will have given birth to at least four lambs. Through sheep-raising, she will be able to get sheep wool, which is very expensive and fetches good profits. This translates into more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell sheep meat and sheepskin, which will increase her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline lives in Migina cell, Rwemikoma, Kiruhura district. He is married and has five children who are all in school. Despite his disability, Frankline is a hard-working agriculture farmer.

He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income. He has applied for a loan of UGX.5,000,000 to buy more grazing land for his animals, to buy more cattle and to buy the basic needs for his children. His major challenge is limited grazing land for the animals. He is, however, grateful that UGAFODE is willing to give the support that the rural poor need in terms of finances and in improving their business.

loans.use: To buy grazing land and cattle

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine is 43 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Justine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Justine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Justine's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nyange

texts.en:
Nyange is a married man and has five school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. He faces major challenges of seasonality and high cost of transportation in his place of operation. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that he is requesting, he wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a 45-year-old married man, from the village Gogolesubani. He lives with his wife and both are involved in agribusiness. They generate a small monthly income from cultivating and selling nuts and maize and also from trading milk-products, which they gain from their own cow. To improve the living conditions for his family and to tackle financial difficulties, Roman decided to start his own business and requested a loan. He lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business because they require a stable income and business experience.  The start up program created by Kiva and Credo enables Roman to get a loan of 2,500 GEL to start his business. He will purchase a metal machine and open a metal shop near her house. 
Roman thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the metal shop is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With support of the start up program, Roman will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and overcome his financial difficulties. He awaits your support and will be really grateful for getting the chance to live better.

loans.use: To purchase a metal machine and start his own business

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas es un hombre casado de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su madre  en una comunidad de Sololá, Lucas no tiene hijos. 
Lucas es una persona que lucha para trabajar, con el fin de generar sus ingresos económicos, pues Lucas a la edad de 15 años se le murió su papá,  él tuvo la iniciativa de buscar trabajo y con la ayuda de sus amigos y familiares logro el oficio de Albañilería,  para Lucas   al principio fue un trabajo muy duro, pero con  el pasar de los años ahora se fue acomodando. Lucas no tiene hijos pero él es el responsable de cuidar a su madre, pues para darle una buena comodidad, él logro construir su casa, pero se agotó de capital, pues para culminar su casa, Lucas busca un prestamo ya que solo de esa manera  terminara lo deseado. 
Lucas es un hombre muy responsable y es reconocido por la sociedad, y él tiene bien claro lo que quiere hacer en esta vida, él confía en Dios para conseguir el prestamo, y la otra meta de Lucas es que más adelante pueda construir su cocina. Esto es con el fin de que su esposa y su mama tengan un espacio más  cómodo para cocinar.
texts.en: Lucas is married and 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and his mother in an area of Sololá.  Lucas does not have any children.  He is a person that strives hard to work, with the goal of earning a living.  At 15 years old, Lucas' father passed away and he had to take the initiative to find work.  With the help of his friends and relatives. he was able to find work in masonry.  Initially, it was very difficult work for Lucas, but as time passed, he got more accustomed to it.  Although Lucas doesn't have children, he is responsible for caring for his mother.  To give her better comfort, he was able to build their house but he ran out of capital.  In order to finish his house, Lucas is looking for a loan as it will be the only way he can finish it as he wished.  Lucas is a very responsible person and known in his neighborhood.  He has a clear idea of what he wants to do in his life and has faith in God to be able to get this loan.  His other goal is to build his own kitchen in the future.  The goal of this is so that his wife and mother can have a more comfortable space to cook.

loans.use: to finish construction

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 37-year-old single lady who has been running her father's convenience store for five years. She is a hard worker who is trying her best to satisfy her customers' needs. 
Besides her business, Raghda is trying hard to satisfy her parents' needs for they are her priority. So, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay the expenses of her mother's medical treatments.
Raghda hopes her mother gets well soon. She also hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her parents with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of her mother's medical treatments

loans.name: Gulbibi

texts.en:
Gulbibi is a hardworking woman who was born in 1964 and lives in a village. She is married and has four children. Her husband helps her with her business, which she has had for 30 years. She sells different varieties of oil and vegetables. 

Gulbibi is a goal-oriented, wise and kind person. She has a dream of opening her own store and needs to accomplish her goal. She is asking for financial support to buy different varieties of oil to sell. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of oil to sell

loans.name: Okmirzo

texts.en:
Okmirzo is a hardworking man. He was born and lives in a rural area. He is single. He is a student. He is a brave, generous and bright man.

He studies excellently at university. His course mates and teachers are satisfied to have such a bright student and friend. He tries not to miss the classes.

He is not working now, and his parents cannot pay the tuition for his studies. Okmirzo decided to request financial support for paying tuition. He is willing to graduate well and to find a job place.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is thankful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise for her direct selling of personal products. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy additional items such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and beauty products to sell. She needs to meet the advance orders from her regular and new customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help support her child's education and meet their daily needs. 

Gleceria dreams of having her own store to increase her business and wants her child to finish college to have better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and products to offer for sale, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 62 years of age and very passionate and diligent about farming. He is considered a pacesetter when it comes to farming in his village of Bosamaro in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Having done mixed farming for the past five years, he has gained much experience and he offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers. Richard is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. Richard enjoys generating income from selling milk, his harvest, and produce from his farm. He finds dairy farming very fulfilling but the main challenge he faces is not being able to properly feed his dairy cows. He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. Through the loan, he will be able to cut hay into small pieces before mixing it with other forage to feed his cattle. The chaff cutter will aid his cattle in digestion and will prevent his dairy cattle from rejecting any part of their food. Proper feeding of cattle is one of the most important factors in maintaining a high yield in the production of milk. Through proper feeding, his cow will produce more milk and this will translate to more profits and improved living standards. When he was asked how this loan will benefit his family, Richard said “more income.” Profits from the loan will be used in fully repaying the loan and improving the living standard for his parents and family.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Chizi.

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Chizi operated a fish selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Musaidi
