texts.en: Musaidi is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Musaidi operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Musaidi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.With the loan of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman staying together with her husband and five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to be a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a farmer from Lusashogh village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and has two daughters and two sons. Her daughter-in-law and grandchild live with her. Her elder son lives and works as a migrant worker in a neighboring country, and her second son serves in the army. To take care of her family, Marieta is engaged in cattle breeding, agiculture and cultivation of wheat.
With the help of her family members, Marieta sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustained way, Marieta needs a loan of (USD) $1,500 to purchase forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF.The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have prior access to credit products because they have no credit history. Marieta and her large family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 47 years old. He runs his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business in one of the busiest compounds in Lusaka, Zambia. He is married with three children ages 21, 19 and 10. All his children are in school. With his first Kiva loan of $425, Victor was able to increase his mobile money float, thereby serving even more customers. He saw his profits grow, and he is happy with the growth in his business. Victor is making very good repayment on his first loan.

Victor is now requesting a subsequent Kiva loan to expand his business by adding to his float. Float is the money that Victor uses to serve customers. Combined with his first loan, Victor now has a float of $1,000, which he uses to serve his customers. He is requesting an additional loan so that he can serve more people who need to access financial services. 

Victor thanks his Kiva lenders for the financial assistance that has changed his life for the better. He looks forward to expanding his business to improve the quality of life for his family and community.

loans.use: to grow his Zoona money transfer business

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 46 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Beatrice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Azam Thahban Group

texts.en:
Azam Thahban is a support group which is made up of four women who are successful in their work lives. It is coordinated by Arwa, who is 36 years old and a mother of 9 children.

Arwa lives with her family in a very small house. Her husband works as a soldier with a small salary. In the beginning, Arwa was taking a part of her husband's salary to make the necessary expansions to the house. Now that she has more children, all the salary is not enough to cover their necessary expenses, and also the house is no longer big enough for them. 

Arwa decided to take a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to make the necessary expansions to the house.

Arwa hopes to complete all the expansions to the house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to make the necessary expansions to the house.

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business, where her customers are neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil.

loans.name: Samia Al- Wadi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Samia Al- Wadi and it consists of  four women who live in Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.
Samia is the leader of the group and a mother of eight children, living with her family in their own small house. Her husband works as a soldier and she works as a housewife. Her large family lives in a small house which is inadequate for them. Samia and her husband want to build a room to expand the house but they don't have enough money to do. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB  to purchase cement and bricks to build a room inside the house. Samia hopes someday to build a second floor.

loans.use: To purchase cement and bricks to build a room inside the house.

loans.name: Elinest

texts.en:
Elinest is a new client to UGAFODE MICROFINANCE LTD.  He is married and has  2 children younger than 18 years old.

He is often described by his community as a very resourceful person and decided to come to UGAFODE to learn about the services and get money to improve his farming business. Like many of his fellow farmers, Elinest decided to borrow money to earn enough income to send his children to school.  He hopes to use the profits from this year’s harvest to buy a piece of land.

This loan will  help Elinest to buy maize seed and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. He is happy with the services so far.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Mwamikazi is a member of the Wezesha Project Mwangaza, which means light in Kiswahili. She lives and works in the city of Uvira, Eastern Democratic Repulic Of Congo. She is 50 years old and a widow caring for one child. 

Mwamikazi has successfully repaid four loans from Wezesha Project and is requesting the loan of $200 to buy additional fresh fish for sales. She has been involved in this business for more than 4 years, and it is her dream is to have continued health and success working without any barriers and give her child the opportunity to go to university and become a professional.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a married woman with two children. She is a repeat client who has so far acquired three loans from UGAFODE Microfinance. She is grateful to Kiva lenders through UGAFODE because her previous loans enabled her to add more stock into her cleaning products business and improve her family's income-thanks to the cheap loans and the long repayment period. 

Allen is taking this loan to boost her business. With the loan boost, she is hopeful of increasing sales and profit. She is hard-working and thanks Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for being there for her in times of financial need.

loans.use: to add more stock into her business.

loans.name: Asante Group

texts.en:
Asante is a group from Wezesha Project situated in the Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo in the City of Uvira. Zabibu is one of 5 members of this group. She is a married and mother of six children, her husband is unemployed. 

She works hard to support her family, and she is now requesting a loan of $100 through Wezesha Project to buy additional beers to sell, which includes the purchase of new bottles, which become a permanent asset of her business. She has been running her business for 4 years now and she would like to save money to expand her business. 

With her profit, Zabibu hopes for her business to do well to be able to continue to pay school fees for her children and maintain a happy, healthy family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of beer for sale

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.en:
Mukende is a 35 year old mother of two children, her husband abandoned her and she is now the sole provider for her family. She is the leader of the Bora Group, a group of five women based in the city of Uvira, Eastern Democratic Republic Of Congo. 

Mukende is applying for a loan of $100 to buy more shoes to resell. This will be her 2nd loan from Wezesha Project and she is grateful for this new opportunity. Since joining Wezesha, she is paying the school fees for her children and able to feed them without any difficulty. She dreams of providing a better life for her family and is using all of her profits to achieve this.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for sale

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en:
Elgun is 27 years old, married, and his wife is pregnant. Now he lives with his family in Absheron region. His wife is a housewife. Elgun is a master, and he started a new business. He builds and repairs homes and walls for yards. 

Today, Elgun needs a loan amount of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). This is Elgun's second loan, and he closed his first loan on time. With this loan he plans to buy equipment, stone, etc. For the loan he has applied to Komak Company. Elgun hopes that this loan will be better for his business. He is very thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for help. In the future, he wants to hire an assistant to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy equipment, stone, etc.

loans.name: Em Rami Group

texts.en:
Maha is the featured borrower of Em Rami's group. She came along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They decided to join hands and acquire the requested Al Majmoua Kiva loan to improve their family's social living.

Maha is a 52-year-old widowed mother of five children; she has been working hard for two years at a restaurant to provide them with their necessary living needs. Her monthly income is barely enough to cover her children's increasing living needs, and that's why she decided, in addition to her current job, to start her own home-based business. That will be achieved through the financial support she requested from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, so that she may now start her own accessories and cosmetics selling business from her house, which will increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

Maha is the lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Rawaa is the lady at the center (married, one child); she has been working in accessories for two years, and her requested loan will be used to pay for necessary legal issues. 

As for Asma, at the far right (married, 4 children), who has been working in the beauty business from her house for 23 years, her acquired loan will be invested in developing her business through special winter beauty products.

loans.use: To start her own accessories and cosmetics selling business from her house to increase her family's income and develop their living

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco- Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  a su clientes que le solicitan como también la venta de cerveza, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cerveza  entre otros.
texts.en:
Marleni belongs to the "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.

She continues to make a living at her grocery store. She is grateful that Kiva has allowed her to give her family a better quality of life and for helping her maintain and develop her business. Marleni continues to sell products to her customers, who are requesting that she also sell beer. 

She wants to continue working so she can keep supporting her family. She is asking for a loan to buy beer and other items.

loans.use: to buy beer and other items.

loans.name: Maritza Leonor

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Pablo se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudadela Costa Azul  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Aquí vive la señora Leonor, tiene 32 años, es casada y de este matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 5 y 3 años estudian en la escuela y colegio, el esposo trabaja en un bar y viven en casa de familiares.
Doña Leonor con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa, trabaja todos los días 4 horas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene unos 12 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.  Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 13 años y le gusta por las charlas. Sus seños tener su casa propia.
texts.en: The Credit Group San Pablo meets every 15 years in the citadel of Costa Azul in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches visited all year round and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many attractive tourist sites.  Here is where 32 year old Leonor lives.  She is married and from her marriage, she has four children of 16, 14, 5 and 3 years old.  They are studying in elementary school and high school.  Her husband works in a bar and they live in a house with their relatives.   Doña Leonor, in hopes of earning something on her own, and as such, be able to move forward at home, dedicates herself to selling clothing of all kinds.  Her sales are door to door and she also sells at home.  She works four hours each day.  She loans to her customers and charges every 15 days.  Her merchandise is bought in Guayaquil every 15 days or monthly, depending on what she needs.  She has been doing this for 12 years and it has been going well for her.  This loan will help her buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts and clothing for children.  She has been in the Credit Group for 13 years and enjoys it the discussions with the group.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Edilson Francisco

texts.es:
Edilson Francisco tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población se dedica al cultivo de algodón y arroz, así como al comercio de animales pequeños.

Tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio en la cual vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros. El ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frutas y verduras para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Edilson espera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y satisfacer sus gustos y preferencias lo que le va a permitir generar ingresos adicionales y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edilson Francisco is 52 years old and lives with his family in a rural zone of the Oyotún district, which is located in the Chiclayo province, the Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. The population cultivates cotton and rice and also raises and sells small farm animals.

He runs a small general store from his home in which he sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, among other things. He has requested a loan to purchase a greater quantity of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and fruits and vegetables in order to increase the stock of his business. With this purchase, Edilson hopes to offer his customers a greater variety of products and to satisfy their tastes and preferences. This will allow him to generate additional income and therefore improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of products such as rice, sugar, oil, fruits and vegetables in order to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Tunda La Roho Group

texts.en:
Tunda la Roho is a group of five members from Wezesha Project Uvira in Eastern Democratic Republic Of Congo. Among this group there are members selling rice, fish, sugar and others items. 

Matisho is one of the members of Tunda la Roho. She is a 35 years old married mother of six children. Currently she has a business selling eggs, which she started many years ago. 

This is her second loan from Wezesha Project. The loan she will now take will expand her inventory so that she has the capacity to make more money in a day.

Matisho aspires to save money to expand her business and generate more profit in order to support her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and a drip irrigation kit

loans.name: Wamama Tupatane Group

texts.en:
Wamama Tupatane is a group of five members who are participating in Wezesha Project. The members have a good understanding between themselves and have been very successful in the past: they plan to continue this success for the current loan they are requesting. The group comes from Uvira in Eastern Democratic Republic Of Congo. Their base activity is small retail commerce.

Machozi is the group featured borrower, she is the married mother of seven children. Her business is selling cooking oil. This is her third loan from Wezesha Project. She intends to use this loan to buy more cooking oil in large quantities for a better price. She said her profits will enable her to actively participate in managing the family nutritional needs and children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She has operated a fish selling business for over five years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish to sell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.en:
Furaha is a member of the Rafiki Group, a group of five women who are participants of Wezesha Project. She is a 33 year old married woman and mother of two children from Eastern Democratic Republic Of Congo. 

She runs a small retail store where she sells various goods to people in her community. She has been in this business for more than five years.

She is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise to sell in her shop like sugar, rice and other goods. She has borrowed and repaid four loans from Wezesha Project, and she aspires to save money to expand her business further. This work allows her to earn resources to support her family economically.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and other goods for sale.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is an individual client aged 42 years. She is single but takes care of three children aged 6, 9, and 16 years respectively. She was advanced a loan amounting to UGX 500,000 to buy cosmetics and hair relaxers for the salon. She owns a salon, which business she started in 2008 in a rural area to raise school fees for her children. Her customers are rural people but with a low income base. She is hardworking and plans to build a school once she widens her income base. 

In the photograph is Harriet and the UGAFODE credit officer in her salon (right to left).

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair oils

loans.name: Tenda Sasa Group

texts.en:
Mazambi is a member of the lending group Tenda Sasa. She has been on her own for 3 years now, since her husband left and she was left as the only provider for their four children. She is 35 years old, from Uvira in Eastern Democratic Republic Of Congo. 

Mazambi sells clothing and has 6 years of experience in this business. She came to Wezesha Project in order to buy goods, specifically packages of cloth/fabric to sell. Her business is profitable and she hasn't had problem with her business.

She plans to use the profits from selling fabric and clothes to pay her children's school fees, medical fees and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Shukurani Group

texts.en:
Shukurani is the solidarity group of five members from Wezesha Project in the Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. Kituza is a member, she is 43 years old, a widow and mother of six children.

She works hard to provide for them through the small shop she has in her home. Kituza is applying for a loan in order to buy more eggs, soft drink, sugar, sweets and more, allowing her to earn a higher income and enjoy a higher quality of life with her children. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Kituza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as soft drink, sugar, eggs and other goods.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
This is Lucy, a dairy farmer from Kenya. She is a mother of three. She keeps the local breed cow and she wants now to keep dairy cows in order to receive more milk. With her output for milk she is able to support her family and take her children to school. 

With a Kiva Loan she will be able to buy a new cow and increase her milk production, and thus improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for a new dairy cow

loans.name: Matumaini Group

texts.en:
Saleh is a 43 years old married mother of three children. She is a member of Matumaini Group from Wezesha Project situated in the city of Uvira in the Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking oil, rice, sugar, washing soap and others items. Her business is located in a convenient place and she has a group of regular customers that provide steady business. 

Saleh will use the $250 loan to buy more stock of washing soap, sugar, cooking oil and others items. She is working diligently to grow her business and has the goal of being a wholesaler within 3 years. With her profit Saleh will pay for her children's school fees without any problem and can provide for their needs.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, washing soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is a livestock farmer who is trained in industrial processing and uses industrial principles in agriculture to improve his business. He grew up in a suburban environment where land was utilized to the maximum. He farms his cattle in a small piece of land and from this he is able to support his wife and two children. He is also a guardian to his niece and nephew in secondary school. 

With the many needs of his family he is looking into expanding his agriculture business to raise more income through keeping poultry and pigs. With a Kiva loan he will be able to buy 500 birds and 15 pigs.

loans.use: to expand her farming business into chicken and pig rearing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her farm

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
This is Tom, a family man who upon loosing his job decided to do dairy farming to support his family. He hopes to expand his structure, herd and farm land in order to produce enough food for his dairy heard. His dream is to be one of the leading dairy products producer besides using modern equipment so as to do better farming. Through dairy farming he has been able to sustain the education of his 3 children. 

With a Kiva loan he will be able to expand his dairy farming and enlightening his community on the benefits of dairy farming.

loans.use: to expand his dairy farm

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
This is Terry, a 6th born girl in a family of 8. She has struggled to raise her school fees as the needs are many due to her large family. Some of her siblings did not manage to finish school, as a sacrifice to the younger siblings. She had a will to continue with her schooling and hence looked for alternative ways of raising her schooling through the Kiva program. 

She dreams of becoming an advocate of the High Court as a start and ultimately work in the International Criminal Court. With a Kiva  loan she will be able to pay for her tuition costs.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana has already used financial assistance from Kiva. She used the funds received from Kiva lenders to make a nice remodeling of her bathroom. Not much has changed since Oksana received that financial help. However, she got promoted at her job and got a salary increase, which is a solid addition to her budget.  This time, Oksana is seeking 10,000 UAH to make major repairs of her bedroom.

loans.use: to repair her bedroom and improve living conditions.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 51 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leurs vingt septième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente YAH première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de riz. Elle compte acheter des sacs de riz chez les grossistes à Niono. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group is composed of married women averaging 51 years of age, with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warasala, Diola Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell cereals and miscellaneous items.

The group members are on their 27th solidarity loan. In order to meet large customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso. Our client Yah, the first one standing from left to right in the photo, is illiterate. She currently works selling rice. She plans to buy bags of rice from wholesalers in Niono. She sells retail, for cash, out of her home to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 80,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 de diciembre se formo en la ciudad de Concepción, una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo, son de una zona rural, de muy difícil acceso.
La Sra. Escolástica es una de las integrantes, ella sale a vender sus comidas rápidas como lomitos, hamburguesas y panchos que ella misma prepara ya que tiene un carrito ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su emprendimiento, ya que con ello ayuda a su familia.
texts.en: The group called "December 8" formed in the city of Concepcion, an area difficult to access - for this reason, the members of this group want to work to keep it growing.  They are from a rural area that is very difficult to access. Escolástica is one of the members.  She goes out selling her fast food such as beef, hamburgers, and hot dogs - which she prepares herself in her street food cart.  She is a hard-working person and is fighting to grow and progress forward.  Escolástica is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, condiments, vegetables, bread, and more, so that she can continue with her sales.  She appreciates the opportunity that she has to continue with her business, and with this, she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, vegetables, bread and more to make meals for sale.

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en: Shamigul is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1972. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She has three children. Her husband is a master of repairing mirrors. She has done business for about fourteen years. Her son helps to do business. She is a seller. She buys and sells clothes and shoes. She has a great number of satisfied customers. She is famous around the sellers. She is planning to widen her activity. Shamigul is asking for financial support to buy a new collection of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase items such as bed linens and RTW (ready-to-wear) for her buy-and-sell business. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to support herself, being a widow.

She would now like to apply for an 11,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more bed sheets, pillowcases, curtains and some RTW to sell. She already has regular customers, since Filipinos love to decorate their homes and constantly change curtains and bed linens. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her, for it will surely help in her daily sustenance.

Rosario dreams to grow her business and have a more prosperous life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise items such as bedsheets, blankets and pillowcases to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.en:
Sitora is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1973. She is living in a rural area. She is divorced and has three children. She is a businesswoman and has been doing business for almost five years. She is a strong, brave and honest person.

Her activity is buying and selling textiles in a rural market. She has a good experience in trading. Sitora works hard and is active. She is famous around sellers. She has a great number of customers, and all her clients are satisfied with her job.

She wants to widen her activity. She is planning to buy a new collection of textiles for increasing working capital. She needs financial support for buying the textiles.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of textiles for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
Hrachik was born and till today he lives in his native village of Norashenik in the Syunik region. For many years he worked as a driver, but he never gave up farming and agriculture. Now his farm is big and rich with farm animals such as cows, calves, heifers, goats, horse and chickens. From his farm he mainly sells milk, meat and eggs. On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes mainly, which resellers buy from him. Hrachik also has a truck with which he makes paid cargo transfers around his region, and on this truck he also brings his farm products to the city’s wholesale market. Hrachik and his wife manage farming alone since their two daughters are married and they live with their families and their son is in abroad now. As Hrachik says his young years are far already but with the help of his beloved wife little by little they manage all the work around the farm.

Hrachik needs this loan in order to buy diesel fuel, to do some repairing of his truck and also to buy some potato seedlings for spring sowing.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel, to do some repairing of his truck and also to buy some potato seedlings for spring sowing.

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
Edith's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Edith, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 46 years old, is married and has three children. Edith has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Edith isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Edith will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Edith's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nut business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
"The ability to fulfill your dreams lies in your hands," says Sajida, a 28-year-old married woman. Sajda has been running a school for the last three years.

Sajida's dream is to eradicate poverty-driven illiteracy from the community. The school has 148 students. In order to repair a classroom and purchase chairs and desks for her students, Sajida has requested a loan of PKR 100,000. Sajida's husband supports her dream and helps with management of the school. Sajida wants to have a better life for herself and her family as well as for the children who are studying in her school. Sajida believes that hard work is the key to success but it is achieved through struggle. She is struggling to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to repair a classroom and purchase chairs and desks for her students

loans.name: Belanabinra - Bimbilla-Old Mkt Group

texts.en:
Zumah is a 42-year-old hard-working woman from Nakpayili in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has 5 children. Zumah is the individual pictured with her hands on the shea nuts among the members squatting.

Zumah is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 7 years. The name of the group is ‘Belanabinra - Bimbilla-Old Mkt’. Zumah earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets around Bimbilla and for export.

Zumah and ‘Belanabinra - Bimbilla-Old Mkt’ have asked for a loan of GHS 15,900. Zumah’s share of the loan is GHS 600, which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing. Zumah aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food and educational materials.

Zumah thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of vegetables for her son's shop for resale

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a married woman and the mother of three children. 

Her husband started a taxi driving business 15 years ago. He earns a good amount of income to bear their household expenditures and needs some financial help to pay for repair and maintenance costs of his taxi. 

Therefore, Saira has availed Murabaha of 20,000 PKR loan for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is 40 years old. Her son (also shown in the photo) is a barber by profession. He earns a good amount of income to meet the family's expenses. Over time he has attained a list of regular customers, and he makes enough to contribute to the family income.

He needs to deal with more customers, time after time. For this he requires hair and skincare products along with combs, brushes, mirrors and scissors. Nagina has applied for a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR, for her son. She is confident that his business will move toward a positive direction.

loans.use: to purchase hair and skincare products along with combs, brushes, mirrors and scissors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the loan will be for the purchase of textiles, thread and other sewing materials. It will also be used for maintenance of her sewing machines.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. Mwanasha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Mwanasha operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators and transportation in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for reselling.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 27-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing business selling shoes for many years. He always has a great collection to offer to his customers and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family's income. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Nazia contacted Kashf Foundation and availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. In this way, her husband will purchase a greater variety of shoes in various sizes and designs for boosting his net income.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of shoes in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 43-year-old married mother of 5 children. She has been working for 5 years from her house selling clothes, underwear, and special blankets and bed shields to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Hanadi is a mother who sacrifices her own needs in order to try to satisfy those of her children. She is also developing her business. So, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to not only pay her children's school tuition fees but also increase her merchandise with new fashionable products.

Hanadi hopes to expand her business in the future so she can increase her income and keep improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to both pay her children's school tuition fees as well as increase her business merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Rosa Poty,  se encuentra en el primer ciclo con diecisiete integrantes, todas ellas tienen la esperanza de poder mejorar sus vidas, a través del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Vicenta quien con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, es una señora muy emprendedora y trabajadora se desempeña como empleada domestica, y comenta que quiere poder invertir en la producción y venta de todo tipo de comidas, de manera a poder emprender un nuevo trabajo para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos como: verduras, condimentos, carne, hortalizas y otros, para poder invertir en un nuevo emprendimiento para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: This committee is called Rosa Poty and it is in its first cycle, with 17 members.  They all have the hope of improving their lives through the women's committee program.  One of the members, Sra. Vicenta - who, with much effort, is moving forward-  is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman.  She works as a maid and says that she would like to be able to invest in the production and sale of all types of food, allowing her to undertake a new line of work helping her family.  She is asking for a loan to be abel to buy inputs such as: greens, condiments, meat, vegetables, and more, in order to invest in new business to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase inputs to make food (such as greens, condiments, meat, vegetables, and more).

loans.name: Al Jamal Baysour Group

texts.en:
Al Jamal Baysour is a group which consists of three hardworking ladies, who put so much effort to develop their living in a well-managed way.

Amal is the featured borrower. She is a 55-year-old married mother of two children, who has been running her business selling clothes, perfumes, and underwear from her house for four years. Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business with special merchandise needed for winter like socks, gloves, bed shields and blankets, to increase her income and develop her family's living.

She is the lady at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Elissar a 46-year-old single lady at the center of the picture, who works as a teacher, and her acquired loan will be invested in her wedding expenses. Hanadi is the married lady at the left, who will invest her loan in paying for her expected baby expenses.

loans.use: to increase her business with special merchandise needed for winter. (Socks, gloves, bed shields and blankets)

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar Augusto tiene 26 años, de estado civil conviviente. Su familia es unida, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada principalmente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, gallinas y cerdos, cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Cesar Augusto espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 26 years old. He lives with his partner. He has a close family. He lives in his family home with his partner and his minor child. 
They live in the district of Cayalti, located in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the north coast of Peru.

He lives in a community mainly dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and livestock.

He raises and sells small animals such as ducks, hens, and pigs. He has over 3 years of experience in this business, and he has great personal and professional references in his district.

He'll use the loan to buy more animals and the animal feeding needed to fatten them up. Cesar Augusto hopes to offer his clients a bigger selection of animals, which will make an impact in his income and it will improve his life and his family's life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to buy animal feed to fatten them up.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 46 años de edad, es casada, viven felizmente junta a su hijos en una comunidad se Sololá. 
María es una persona que se siente comprometida con sus hijos y  vela por el mejoramiento de su hogar, para alcanzar sus proyectos,  ella trabaja con préstamos, ya que solo de esa manera  se logran las metas, ella ya tuvo la oportunidad de Conseguir un prestamo en ADICLA, ella con ese prestamo logro realizar parte de su proyecto que era la remodelación de su vivienda, pero con ese primer prestamo no logra terminar los trabajos. 
María solicita nuevamente un prestamo  de dos mil quetzales para culminar los trabajos que quedan pendiente, esta vez lo utilizara para remodelar el techado de su casa para que cuando el invierno llegue no los perjudique.
 María con sus pequeños ingresos de bisutería  (prendas elaboradas con mostacilla) pagara el prestamo, el sueño de esta madre es que sus hijos tengan una casa cómoda donde vivir y evitar riesgos de que sus hijos se  enfermedad, ella tiene las expectativas de conseguir la cantidad que necesita.
texts.en:
María is a 46 year-old woman and is married living happily with her children in a community of Sololá. María is a person who feels committed to her children, and she watches over the improvement of her home. In order to accomplish her projects, she works with loans since this is the only way to achieve her goals. She already had the opportunity of obtaining a loan with ADICLA, and with that loan, she managed to complete part of her project which was remodeling her home. But with that first loan, she is not able to finish the work.

María requests once again a loan of 2,000 quetzales (GTQ) in order to finish the remaining work. This time, she will use it to remodel the roof of her house so that when winter arrives, they will not be harmed. María with her small income from costume jewelry (items made with beads) will pay the loan. The dream of this mother is that her children have a comfortable house where they can live and avoid the risks of becoming sick. She has expectations of obtaining the amount she needs.

loans.use: to remodel the roof

loans.name: Martha Evelia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Pablo se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudadela Costa Azul  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
La señora Martha tiene 34 años, es casada y de este matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de 18, 14, 11 y 9 años de edad, los tres menores estudian en colegio y escuela, su esposo se dedica a la pesca y también tiene una taxi moto que trabaja cuando no está pescando.
Doña Martha para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados. Tiene veinte años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad, también va a  comprar materiales para la pesca como combustibles, redes, piolas y alimentos para el viaje para su marido. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 17 años y le gustan los créditos porque recibe el seguro médico y las charlas de salud.
texts.en:
The Credit Group San Pablo meets every 15 years in the citadel of Costa Azul in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches visited all year round and for being a city of unsurpassed beauty with many attractive tourist sites. 

Martha is 34 years old and married, and from her marriage, she has four children - 18, 14, 11 and 9 years old.  The three youngest study in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman and also has a taxi service that he works in when he is not fishing. In order to keep her family moving forward, Doña Martha has a food supply store in her house.  There, she sells all types of food such as rice, oils, detergent, vegetables, and fruits.  She works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm, and sometimes, until later.  Her daughter and husband help her in her work whenever they are able to and available.  She has been doing this for 20 years and her business is going well.  This credit will help her to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other staples.  She will also buy supplies for fishing such as fuel, nets, lanyards and food for the trip, for her husband.  She is part of the Credit Group for 17 years and likes its because she receives health insurance and group health discussions.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other staples; also fuel, nets, lanyards and food for fishing.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Kuña Guapa están en el 2do. ciclo con 17 integrantes, ellas quieren invertir en una actividad que les genere un ingreso adicional, ya que la mayoría son mujeres del campo que se dedican a la producción y a la cría de animales.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Dionisia que junto con su esposo y sus hijos trabajan en una gran huerta familiar, plantando todo tipo de hortalizas que una vez listas llevan al mercado para su comercialización. Dionisia y su familia son muy trabajadores y se están esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas, abonos y otros insumos para poder seguir con la agricultura que ella y su familia están llevando.
texts.en:
This committee is called "Kuña Guapa," and it is in its second loan cycle, with 17 members. They want to invest in activities that generate additional income for them, since the majority are rural women who work in agricultural production and animal raising.

One of the members is Dionisia, who works together with her husband and children on a large family farm. They grow all kinds of vegetables, which they take to market to sell when they are ready. Dionisia and her family are very hard-working, and they are making an effort to grow and get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, compost and other supplies in order to continue with the agricultural work that she and her family have been doing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and other supplies to continue growing vegetables.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Catalina, se formo en la ciudad de Concepción, son 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se unieron por para poder dar lo mejor a sus familias. Son de una zona aun en crecimiento, eminentemente rural.
La Sra. Liliana es una de las integrantes, tiene su pequeño negocio de peluquería, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre va a su salón, para poder ser atendidas. Liliana es una mujer muy luchadora que día a día se esfuerza para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina group was formed in the city of Concepción. It consists of 17 very hardworking and enterprising women who got together in order to give their families the best. They are from an area that is still growing and eminently rural.

Liliana is one of the members; she has a small hair salon business. She says that she has very good customers who always go to her salon to be attended to. Liliana is a woman who really strives and makes an effort day after day to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying supplies for her hair salon such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other supplies to be able to continue with her work. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other supplies

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo está casado, tiene 56 años tiene una hermosa familia de 4 hijos, ellos viven en una comunidad llamada San Jorge la Laguna, los hijos de Gonzales ya son personas mayores de 18 años. 
Gonzalo para generar su economía trabaja como promotor de salud, este trabajo lo viene desempeñando desde hace 15 años, le gusta  hacer este trabajo ya que se siente útil a su comunidad, pues para incrementar su economía también cuenta con una farmacia,  instalo su farmacia, en primer lugar porque no existe competencia de este negocio y en segundo lugar, es que en base a las consultas que realiza, receta medicamentos y para que la gente no tenga que viajar a comprar a otra comunidad, lo puede realizar ahí mismo De esta forma Gonzalo satisface sus necesidades. Los 2  hijos de Gonzales trabajan como albañiles y las dos hijas de oficios domésticos. Con el ingreso de sus hijos ha podido alcanzar algunas metas, pero Gonzales todavía ve algunos proyectos más para el mejoramiento de vida de su familia, ahora Gonzalo necesita darle acabado a una construcción que realizo, a raíz de este trabajo, él está buscando un prestamo para culminar parte de las mejoras de su vivienda. 
Con los ingresos que genera  Gonzalo y sus hijos se apoyaran en pagar en prestamo, para logra pagar el prestamo en corto tiempo se limitaran de algunos cosas  el sueño de esta familia es lograr este proyecto.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 56 years old and married. He has a beautiful family with 4 children. They live in a community called San Jorge la Laguna. Gonzalo's children are already adults over the age of 18. 
 
To generate his income, Gonzalo works as a health promoter. He has been doing this work for the past 15 years. He likes doing this work, because he feels useful to his community. To add to his income, he also has a pharmacy. He started his pharmacy first because there was no competition in this area of business, and second because due to the consultations he carries out, he recommends medications, and people don't have to travel to buy them in another community but can access them right there. In this way, Gonzalo is satisfying his needs. Gonzalo's two sons work as masons, and his two daughters carry out domestic work. With his children's income he has been able to achieve some goals, but Gonzalo still has some additional plans to improve his family's quality of life. Currently, Gonzalo needs to do finishing work on a construction project he has carried out. Because of this work, he is seeking a loan in order to finish part of the improvements to his home. 
 
His children will contribute along with the income Gonzalo generates in order to make the loan payments. In order to be able to pay off the loan over a short period, they will limit themselves in a few areas. The family's dream is to successfully complete this project.

loans.use: do the finishing work on a construction project to improve his home.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Linah, a 41-year-old, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in the lush hills of Kapsowar, in the rift valley region of Kenya. 

Linah passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past eight years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding the large family she has requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

Linah has identified a free space in her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Linah, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learns that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. 

Linah said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural-based loans and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. 

Linah hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem, aged 55 years, is a married woman with 5 children. She has a business with her husband, who is also shown in the photo above, selling religious books in her area. The business has helped them earn a good amount of income to support the needs of their family members. 

In order to purchase a large quantity of holy books to cater to more customers, Tasleem has taken a Murabaha-type loan of 35,000 PKR. 

Tasleem expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of holy books to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 69 years old and she has a grocery store at her own house. Rina has two sons, but they are adults already. 

Rina needs another loan to buy products (canned foods, soft drinks, sugar, noodles, rice) for her grocery store. Rina would like to have a bigger grocery store in the future. 

Rina doesn't have a husband so she is practically alone, and that is the main reason she needs your help again.

loans.use: to buy products (canned foods, soft drinks, sugar, noodles, rice) for her grocery store

loans.name: El Pueblito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “El Pueblito”  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, donde todas las integrantes están muy entusiasmadas por formar parte de este desafío que les ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Juana, es miembro de este grupo, es la presidenta, quien pide este préstamo para poder comprar una vaca para que más adelante produzca leche y de la misma hacer quesos, venderlas, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de leche y de queso.
Juana es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora, que se esfuerza por poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group called “El Pueblito” is in its first loan cycle within the women's committee program. It is a new group, and all of its members are very enthusiastic about taking part in this challenge which will help them to improve their situation in life. 

Juana is a member of this group, and she is also its president. She is requesting this loan to buy a cow, so that she can produce milk in the future and make cheese out of it to sell. She already works selling milk and cheese. 

Juana is a very self-sacrificing and determined person who is making an effort to grow and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to produce milk and cheese.

loans.name: Virgen Serrana Group

texts.es:
Virgen Serrana se formo en la ciudad de Caaguazú, donde las 17 mujeres están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una persona que integra este grupo es Aide, quien comenta que entre el trabajo que hace realiza ventas de perfume, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, que le hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
Aide pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes varios para poder seguir con la venta de perfumes que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Virgen Serrana was formed in Caaguazú city, where 17 women are being surveyed for poverty elimination. This way they can know the situation of everyone. They can improve their conditions of life. Aide is one of the members of this group. She says that between her work of selling perfume, she also works for Fundación Paraguaya, which is a constant process of analyses and verifications. 

Aide is requesting this loan to invest in buying various perfumes so that she can continue to sell them. 

She is grateful for this opportunity because it helps her get better everyday.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela, age 38, is a married woman with 4 children. She is shown in the photo above with her husband. 

Nabeela has been running her beauty parlor business for the past 6 years. She is known in her town for offering many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Now, Nabeela needs to attract more regular customers. For this reason, she has obtained a Murabaha-type loan of 35,000 PKR. It will enable her to purchase large quantities of hair and skin care products and bleaching and whitening creams.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of hair and skin care products and bleaching and whitening creams.

loans.name: Mujeres Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un mecanismo para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada integrante, y de esa forma poder ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir, en un nivel medio de ingresos.  Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas que se encarga de hacer personalmente y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas. Agradece por la oportunidad  que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group is part of the poverty elimination program which is a mechanism to get to know the situation of each member and therefore be able to overcome their situation of poverty.
One of the members is Maria who in her last survey demonstrated that she was living in level two poverty, which is a medium income level. She earns a living selling food that she makes herself and she then goes out selling it as a street vendor.
She is asking for this loan to invest in buying vegetables, meat, condiments, green vegetables and other supplies so as to be able to continue making her food. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, green vegetables and other things to make food products.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old Palestinian refugee who runs his grocery store inside the refugee camp where he was born. 

Mohamad started his own business 10 years ago when he decided to stop working for others and instead improve his family's living.

Today, being a married father of 2 children, his responsibilities have increased, and Mohamad has to ensure that his business' income is enough to cover his family's increasing needs.

For this reason, even though he suffers from limited sales and income inside the camp, Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise with special-offer products that will boost both his sales and income.

Mohamad hopes to keep developing his business to ensure he has a financially secured future.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with special-offer products that will raise both his sales and income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy garments, shoes and other products.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Unidas al Progreso lleva este nombre, ya que todas se unieron para poder progresar y salir adelante. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de todas y poder ir mejorándola por medio de las capacitaciones que reciben y del trabajo unido.
La señora Zunilda pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas y así vender entre sus conocidas para que su negocio siga creciendo. Es una señora muy activa  capaz de valerse por sí misma. Manifiesta constantemente los valores de honestidad, responsabilidad y solidaridad.
Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Unidas al Progreso  (Women United for Progress). It is called this as they are all united in order to progress and get ahead. They are in the poverty elimination program in order to get to know each of their situations and to improve their lives through the training they receive and the work they do together.
Zunilda is asking for this loan in order to invest in buying clothes to sell among people that she knows so that her business continues to grow. She is a very active women who is capable of making the most of herself. She constantly shows values of honesty, responsibility and solidarity.
She is very grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue expanding her work.

loans.use: to buy various garments to sell.

loans.name: Mwachidole

texts.en:
Mwachidole is a married mother with 3 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwachidole has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces the major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the 50,000 KES loan she is requesting, Mwachidole wants to purchase supplies of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
His name is Jeremias, 57, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Miriam, they have children who already have families of their own. 

Jeremias operates a video/karaoke shop. He provides a place in his house to be used by customers who want to rent the video/karaoke machine. Filipinos love music and enjoy singing with friends in their spare time and they rent the machine during special events. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,050 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, Jeremias is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy a new videoke unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he adds a new video machine. He is thanking God and you in advance for good return on his investment and the financial help that will be given him.

Jeremias dreams of having more units to serve more clients. He prays for good health and a happy life. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a new video machine.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos novillos para el engorde y que tengan un tamaño adecuado y buenas características en el rápido desarrollo y ganancia de peso. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y aprovechar esta época de verano que es mejor para el desarrollo de los animales y tambien  las buenas condiciones de terreno, agua potable y clima para poder tener estos animales y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 44 years old, married and lives with his son and wife who are his main priorities With this loan he wants to buy a few steers to fatten until they attain an adequate size and good characteristics with rapid development and weight gain.

His idea is to take advantage of the pasture space he has and the summer season which is the best time for the development of animals. It also has the best land conditions, potable water and climate to have these animals and develop the steers to sell them for meat in the future. With this purchase he can start another activity and at the same time create savings which will allow him to have more animals to invest more in his property.

This is the first loan he has had from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans from the State banks but FUDECOSUR is offering the loan with better conditions and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Om Kahtan Group

texts.en:
Om Kahtan Group is a group which consists of four women who live in Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of YER 170,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

One of the group members is Saeda and she is the leader of the group. She is married and living with her family in a very simple house. 

The  floor of the kitchen is without flagstones and needs to renovation. She works as a housewife and her husband works with a very limited  income, which is not enough to make necessary renovations of the house. Therefore, she applied for a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to purchase flagstones to renovate the floor of the kitchen.
 
Saeda looks forward to completing the renovation of the house.

loans.use: to purchase flagstones to renovate the floor of the kitchen.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is from Vedi town. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and two children aged 3 and 5 years old. Her husband is a constructor.  Both of them put their efforts together to be able to earn a living. Apart from his main job, Armine and her husband, with the help of her family members, is engaged in keeping livestock and in cultivation of tomatoes. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. 

To make her agribusiness sustainable and more productive, Armine needs to make some financial investments. She needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase wires for a grape orchard and forage for feeding the livestock (grass 300 packages). As this is Armine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they had no credit history. Armine and her family rely highly on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for wires for a grape orchard and forage for feeding the livestock. (grass 300 packages)

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 40-year-old, married woman and the mother of four children. In order to support her family she began the business of selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She is happily supporting her family with the income she generates. 

For the growth of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She is hopeful that an increase in milk production will help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to generate more income.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with one child, who is too young to attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

For the past three years, Salma has operated a cosmetics shop, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a food stall business, selling from home, which earns her another source of livelihood. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Salma dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase cosmetics and food for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and food for resale.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is an experienced agronomist from Akner village in Armenia, where she lives with her husband and 3 school-age children. 

With help from her family, Siranush is engaged in raising livestock (piglets, calves, cows, and bees) and in cultivating potatoes and cabbage. Her eldest son sells the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is the only source of her family's income. 

In order to continue running her business in a sustainable way, Siranush requires a 2,000 USD loan to purchase a cow and the forage for feeding her livestock. She previously took a loan from a local financial institution which she unfortunately wasn't able to repay. However, thanks to her more recent hard work, Siranush has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover her monthly loan repayments. 

So, Siranush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and, thus, no access to credit products. 

Siranush and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and the forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Mwakuona

texts.en:
Mwakuona is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwakuona operates a grocery vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a grocery vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kes 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (wrap cloth for women) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan of KES 40,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (wrap cloths for women) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment to start her food sales

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Samkoro  est un cultivateur Malien âge de 60 ans, marié, père  de 5 enfants tous scolarisés, agés de 6 à 17 ans. Sa femme est une ménagère.
Samkoro exerce comme activité économique l’embouche de bœufs et fait un peu de stockage de céréales en plus , il a 10 ans d’expérience dans ces activités  ;
