il a pris le prêt au RMCR pour pouvoir acheter plus bœufs maigres pour engraisser en vue de les revendre, puis acheter aussi du mil pour le stockage.
Il s’approvisionne sur le marché local et revend ses bœufs et ses céréales dans le même marché après avoir respectivement observé le temps d’engraissement des bœufs et stockage. Le bénéfice qu’il  en tirera lui permettra de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
Il rencontre souvent des petits problèmes tels qu’augmentation du prix d’achat des produits.  Il  souhaite devenir un grand éleveur dans le future, il se sent  à l’aise en l’exerçant cette  activité car il participer au développement économique  de sa communauté.
Samkoro est celui qui tient en main la corde du bœuf a gauche sur la photo.
texts.en:
Samkoro is a Malian farmer who is 60 yers old, married and the father of 5 children who have all been to school, aged between 6 and 17 years old. His wife is a shepherdess. 

Samkoro raises cows for his business, and also does a bit of grain storage. He has 10 years of experience in these businesses. He took the loan from RMCR in order to purchase more skinny cows in order to fatten them for resale, then also purchase some millet for stockage. He purchases his stock at the local market and resells his cows and grain at the same market after taking the time to faten the cows and stock the grains. 

The profit he makes will allow him to cover his family's expenses. He often faces small problems such as price increases for certain products he requires. He would like to become a large-scale cattle raiser in the future, and feels at ease with this business since it adds to the overall economic development of his community.

loans.use: to purchase skinny cows for fattening and sale

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Drissa est un cultivateur Malien âgé de 50 ans, marié, père de 9 enfants le plus âgé est de 22 ans et le plus jeune  a 2 ans, huit enfants n’ont pas fréquenté l’ école ; son épouse est une ménagère en même temps fait le maraichage  après hivernage.
Depuis 27 ans Drissa  exerce l’élevage de moutons , il rêve aujourd’hui pour le bonheur de ses enfants leurs études, santé et autre. Drissa n’a j’aimais été à école, il compte avoir beaucoup de moutons pour faire l’élevage en vue de les revendre. Avec le bénéfice il pourra bien survenir  au besoin des enfants y compris les  frais scolaire. 
Il fait recourt au RMCR Pour acheter beaucoup de moutons pour bien réalisé son projet d’élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux ; la vente se passe à Bamako où dans les marchés locaux. Après la vente des moutons le bénéfice qu' il gagne lui permettra de prendre de prendre les charges de son foyer.
Drissa est celui qui tient la corde du mouton en main et a le turban autour de sa tête sur la photo.
texts.en:
Drissa is a Malian farmer who is 50 years old, married and the father of 9 children, the oldest of whom is 22 and the youngest 2 years old. 8 of his children didn't attend much school. His wife is a shepherdess who also grows vegetables after the rainy season.

For the past 27 years, Drissa has been raising sheep. He dreams of providing for his children's well-being in their studies, help and other areas. Drissa never attended school, and looks toward having many sheep in order to raise them and sell them. With the profit he will be able to cover his children's needs and school fees. 

He comes to RMCR in order to purchase many sheep in order to make the most of his sheep-raising business. He purchases his sheep in the local markets, and sells them in Bamako or in the local markets. After selling his sheep, the profit he makes will allow him to cover his household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman is a 23-year-old, single man and he lives with his family in Imishli Region. His father is a teacher and his mother is a housewife. They are a happy family. Salman loves his parents and always helps them. 

Salman has a little garden and he has been growing fruit trees and flowers trees in his garden for four years. He has an interest in growing. He did not study in the university because they are so poor.
 
Salman sells nature flowers and fruits in the local bazaar. His monthly income is AZN 160 (manat). In this region, people like nature flowers, so Salman has a lot of clients. But, a water problem does not allow him to grow more crops in this business. He needs to construct water irrigation to his garden. That is why he applied for a loan of AZN 1,200. 

It is Salman's first loan with Aqroinvest Credit Union.

loans.use: to construct water irrigation to his garden.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de condiments.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leurs dix septième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FANTA première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’arachide non décortique. Elle compte acheter des sacs d’arachide chez les grossistes à Falako.   
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is composed of married women averaging 47 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, Doila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They work as vendors selling cereals and condiments.

The group members are on their 17th solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting high customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso. Our client Fanta, the first one seated from left to right, is illiterate. She currently works selling unshelled peanuts. She plans to buy some bags of peanuts from wholesalers in Falako. She sells retail, for cash, at the market to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 40,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.
.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Ludia, 53 years of age, and a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. 

Ludia has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kapsowar area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Ludia finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming business, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging for Ludia, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. With the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry supply to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Her name is Jennifer, 36, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Lino, a security guard, and they have one child who is in high school. She manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to augment their income and support and meet their daily personal, household needs.

Jennifer operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are either essential household items or food. She earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and then reselling by the piece. In addition, she also has a tricycle which helps earns extra income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 1,000 PHP each day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, Jennifer is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, canned goods, and soda. She is positive that the loan will help boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

The income from her store helps a lot in their daily sustenance. Jennifer hopes to maintain and grow her business for a prosperous life. She prays for a victorious and happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has two school-going children. They live in their own house, which doesn't have electricity or piped water. Fatuma's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Fatuma has operated a business selling khangas (wrap cloths for women). She sells these to passersby from her home and door-to-door to her neighbors. 

A major challenge she faces is the lack of capital to expand her business.  Therefore, she decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
Currently, she is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase bales of khangas to resell.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Twizerane Group

texts.en: Twizerane is a group led by Immaculee, who is 42 years old. The group name means “Trust” in English. Immaculee has been a group leader for four years. She has a butcher shop and has been in business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows for meat. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more cows for meat.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is an agronomist from Verin Dvin village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and two school-age daughters. 

To take care of her family's needs, Sonya has been engaged in agribusiness for more than ten years. With the help of her family members, she cultivates tomatoes and keeps three cows. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

As the family's needs are increasing day by day, Sonya  wants to expand her agribusiness, in order to be able to more effectively meet the family's expenses. A loan of 2,500 USD will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase three oxen, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer, and to cover land cultivation costs. 

As this is Sonya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. She and her family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their good will and support in obtaining the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer, and to cover land cultivation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he can work as a driver.

loans.name: Zhannat

texts.ru: Жаннат 38 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей школьного возраста. Жаннат в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Жаннат, ее деятельность приносит прибыль около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В хозяйстве есть 0,25 Га земли, где растет малина. Недавно Жаннат продала 2 бычков и 6 овец, приобретя на эти средства автомобиль для семьи. Она решила возобновить поголовье скота и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Жаннат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы в перспективе перестроить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Zhannat is 38 years old, married, and the mother of five school-age children.  She is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities that provide an additional source of income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she has come to a point where she now makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS), which is used to cover the family's food expenses and other daily needs.  Zhannat's farming business also includes 0.25 hectare of land on which she grows raspberries.  Recently, Zhannat sold two steers and six sheep and used the money from the sale of these animals to buy a car for her family.  She has decided to once again increase her livestock headcount and has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy a couple of steers as well as feed for her livestock.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her farming business, and in the long-term, rebuild the barn where she keeps her farm animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed, as well as two steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Mavlyudahan

texts.ru: Мавлюдахан, 44 года, замужем, 5 детей. У Мавлюдахан среднее образование, с 1992 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 1 лошадь, а также 1,0 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает дыню. Мавлюдахан известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Мавлюдахан является участником группы "Замир", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 3 человека. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку удобрений, семян и клеенки для теплицы. Доходы от кредита Мавлюдахан планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена купить грузовую машину для своей семьи.
texts.en: Mavlyudahan is 44 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in farming since 1992, and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  She currently owns three cows and one horse, as well as one hectare of irrigated land on which she grows melons. Mavlyudahan is known as a woman of principle:  she is honest, decent and reliable.  Her activity currently brings her a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  She is a member of the "Zamir" group, which comprises three additional members.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and a plastic sheet for her greenhouse.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her activity.  She would also like to buy a truck for her family.

loans.use: to buy a plastic sheet for her greenhouse, as well as fertilizers and seeds in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 36 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей школьного возраста. Она ведет собственное хозяйство в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, стартовав 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 30 овец, 1 лошадь. На участке мерою 0,92 Га она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 коров и 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая и покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Gulmira is 36 years old, married, and the mother of four school-age children.  For the past 10 years, she has been running her own farming business, and this activity provides her family with its main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows, 30 sheep and one horse.  She also grows barley for resale on 0.92 hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  This loan will help her to buy two cows and ten sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.  Gulmira plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She also wants to save enough money to build a barn and to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and ten sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven muy entregado vive en una comunidad de Solola con tan solo 20 años de edad. 
Carlos es una persona que  piensa en su futuro, le encanta ese trabajo, esto lo aprendió de su padre, pero con tan solo veinte años de edad tenida timidez de buscar un préstamo, hasta que en una ocasión  se acerco a la institución ADICLA, para obtener información cuales son las ventajas y desventajas de un préstamo, Carlos regreso a su casa con esta inquietud, pero luego se decido y  adquirió el préstamo, los sueños de Carlos se hizo realidad ya con el capital el pudo comprar semillas fertilizantes, y se puso a cultivar en mas volumen, Pues con el préstamo obtuvo buenas cosechas y ganancias, con las ganancias pudo apoyar a su papá con los gastos de la casa. 
Carlos busca un tercer préstamo ahora, para seguir innovando su agricultura la meta de Carlos es conseguir el préstamo en un tiempo prudente, para ir preparando el área para el nuevo cultivo.

El anhelo de este joven es tener buenas cosechas y con  las ganancias pueda remodelar su vivienda,
texts.en:
Carlos is a very committed young man who lives in the community of Solola and is only 20 years old. 

Carlos is a person who thinks about his future. He loves this work, he learned it from his father, but being only 20 years old, he was nervous about asking for a loan until at one point he approached ADICLA to get information about the advantages and disadvantages of a loan. Carlos went back to his house with this concern, but later decided and got the loan. Carlos's dreams were made reality since with the capital he could purchase seeds, fertilizers, and began to cultivate a larger volume. With the loan, he got good harvests and earnings and with the earnings, he was able to help his father with the household expenses.

Carlos is looking for a third loan now, to continue innovating his farming techniques. Carlos's goal is to get a loan at a prudent time to start preparing the area for the new crop.

This young man's desire is to have good harvests and with the earnings, be able to remodel his house.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Jesus Misericordioso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jesús Misericordioso  está en el ciclo 13  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias a las capacitaciones y el trabajo de todas están mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alejandrina ella se desempeña como directora del grupo, ella tiene una despensa en su casa, que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha ido formando. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas,carne, panificados, hortalizas, bebidas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "Jesús Misericordioso" (Merciful Jesus) is in its 13th cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other in order to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey where thanks to their training and everyone's work, they are improving their poverty situation.

One of the members is Alejandrina. She acts as the group's director. She has a grocery store in her house that she has been building up through a lot of effort and hard work. She is a hardworking and diligent woman that wants to provide her family with everything that she was deprived of.  

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods and drinks amongst other things in order to carry on working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods and drinks amongst other things.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Virgen de Fatima  está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para ir superando su pobreza.
La Sra. Noelia, una  de las integrantes, comenta que vende perfumes varios, y por medio de este humilde trabajo lucha para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener y de esa forma evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes varios, para que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, para procurar mejores ingresos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group is called Virgen de Fatima. The group is working toward the elimination of poverty by having each member try her best to gradually lift herself out of poverty.

Noelia, one of the members, sells a variety of perfumes. Through this humble work she struggles to give her family everything she could not have to help them avoid having to go through what she went through. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of perfumes so she can continue with her sales and ensure better income. She is grateful for this opportunity to keep growing.

loans.use: buy a variety of perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is thankful that she was granted an 11,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that, through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items, like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good outcome of her business and for the financial help that will be given to her. Her income from her store helps a lot in providing daily sustenance.

Dolores dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible, for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, to sell at her store.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 39-year-old Palestinian refugee, who lives and works in a Palestinian Camp like most of the Palestinian refugees living in Lebanon, with limited access to several working sectors.

Houssam is a hardworking man, who has been working as a house painter for 20 years. His business is limited inside the camp, while he is working hard to develop it and expand his working zone outside the camp in the future.

Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary home appliances since he lost everything after his house was burned two months ago. Nothing was left behind.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his business in a well managed way to support his beloved family and reply to their increasing living needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary home appliances since he lost everything after his house was burned two months ago.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! The above picture presents Dinah, a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Roret, in the Litein area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with a beautiful family. 

For the past ten years, Dinah has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back. She really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Dinah finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture, but she constantly faces a challenge of poor productivity on her farm because of a lack of farm supplies. 

She is seeking a loan to buy farm supplies. Through the loan, Dinah will purchase quality seeds and fertilizer, which will increase her production level and this will immediately translate into increased income levels. Dinah is a very hardworking woman and she believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. 

The extra income she will earn will be used to repay the loan and increase her farming production.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en:
Roziya, a kind and peaceful woman, is one of the good inhabitants of the Dangara district. She is married and has 4 children. Roziya’s husband immigrated to Russia, where he works and helps his family. 

Roziya has been engaged in a livestock business since 2000, and has much experience in this activity. She says that this business gives her more profit and enables her to provide her family with fresh milk and dairy products. Roziya has a barn, where she cares for her animals. She wants to increase her number of livestock and improve her family members' lives, so has submitted an application for a loan. Roziya is a hardworking woman and she believes that, with your support, she can expand her activity and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling used clothes, and has been in this business for two years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more used clothes. She generates additional income from providing laundry services to her neighbors.  She works at the market seven days a week, and sells on a retail basis only. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza está en el ciclo número 2 del programa de Comité de Mujeres, están haciendo el semáforo de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de todas han ido mejorando poco a poco.
Irma integra este grupo, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando cada vez más su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que debe esforzarse en su emprendimiento, el cual es un copetín, el cual está bien surtido y donde tiene todo tipo de productos. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y emprendedora.
La Sra. Irma  solicita  este préstamo para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, jugos, golosinas y otros insumos  en general , lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called La Esperanza is in its second cycle of the Comite de Mujeres program.  They are doing the Poverty Stoplight program where, thanks to all their work, they have been improving bit by bit.

Irma is included in this group.  Through her continual efforts and work and applying the vital actions of a successful woman, she finds herself improving her situation of poverty more and more.  She is equally aware that she must do her utmost in her business, a small restaurant that has a good assortment of all types of products. She is a self-sacrificing and enterprising woman.

Irma is asking for this loan to buy food, drinks, juices, sweets, and other general supplies that will help her to realize her business plan which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, juices, sweets and other supplies

loans.name: Sevara

texts.en:
Sevara is a good wife and a caring mother who lives in Spitamen district in Tajikistan. She is 28 years old and has 2 children aged 2 and 4 years. 

Sevara is requesting a loan to start a business; she would like to open her own grocery shop. She has 5 years experience in this activity, with which her family helps her. Sevara's husband works as a foreman in the construction brigade; he always supports her as well. 

Sevara is a responsible woman. She believes with the help of Kiva's lenders her new businesses will succeed so she will be able to provide her family with the best life.

loans.use: to open her own grocery shop.

loans.name: Mirable

texts.en:
Mirable is married with  two children; one goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling used clothes, and has been in this business for five years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from farming.  She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal is to expand her farming business.She lives in rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past six years, Zena has operated a cosmetics selling business, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a food stall business, selling from home, which earns her another source of livelihood. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, Zena wants to purchase stock of cosmetics for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
“Kenya’s farmers are generally small-scale farmers who cannot afford to follow industrialized conventional production. What they have is access to land, farmyard manure, and manpower,” Philip says. What they are missing, he says, is the know-how to create a productive farm. “The biggest aspect that is missing in this sector is information.” 

Philip and his wife have worked on their current farm, situated in the outskirts of Litein town, Kenya, since 2008. Since then, their farm and family have grown in more ways than one. In 2008, the couple started working on a run-down farm. Today, they are making money off the poultry and dairy animals they raise, and also the tea and vegetables they grow. Philip has further invested in transportation services to reduce their transportation costs, and make money offering the service to other farmers. 

Philip loves to dairy farm, especially since it was always a life goal of his to be a farmer. His wife understands this, and together they joined hearts and hands to make the farm’s success to date happen. 

Philip is seeking a loan to purchase a pedigree dairy cow. There are more than 100 cattle breeds in Kenya. However, not all are good producers of milk. In fact, very few are. Cattle aside, the tastes and preferences of milk in the market is really growing diverse in Kenya. Taking milk is no longer a matter of pouring it into our cereal bowl, adding it to our coffee, or drinking it straight from the glass; we now have preferences in the type of milk we drink. 

Today, milk consumers are spoiled for choice: in the market, we have old-fashioned cow’s milk and lactose-free milk, not to mention non-dairy options such as soy, almond, rice and coconut milk. It takes dairy masters like Philip to pick these shifts in the market and adopt ingenious techniques in farming to ensure that their product qualities adapt to the changes in consumer preference. Purchasing a pedigree cow goes to show how Philip is keen on controlling lameness levels in his dairy cattle. He considers breeding to be the core of his overall strategy of ensuring that milk quantity is way above average and the milk quality is second to none in the market. 

He anticipates that feeding will be his highest cost of milk production. This, to him, is accepted because to get cows that milk well and remain healthy, they have to be fed properly. Your loan will make a significant difference to Philip's farm profitability. The couple will make use the returns from this investment to pay for the loan, pay for their children’s education, and the rest will be reinvested in the business. It has always been their ambition to share their passion about farming with their children. They hope the kids will be thrilled to join the business of running the family farm.

loans.use: To buy a pedigree cow

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat, and oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat, and oil

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old and from Baniswef. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a fees collector in a private sector company with a very low income that can't cover his family's monthly expenses. Four years ago, Mariam decided to start a small fattening project in her house as she has a 15 years experience in fattening cattle at her father's house before she got married. 

She started and developed the project with two loans from TADE. She wishes to expand her business to increase her income for her family, so she requested a 15,000 EGP loan to buy three head of cattle.

loans.use: To buy three head of cattle

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima, 30, is the married mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is Asima’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

Asima's husband has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Asima has asked for a loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. It helps him to purchase new tires along with auto spare parts for his vehicle so that he can provide better transport services to his passengers. 

Asima is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires along with auto spare parts.

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is 35 years old, married and a father of five children. He has a secondary education, but couldn't complete his a studies due to his family's miserable condition. 

His neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind and hardworking man. As the main source of income for his family, Ahmmed has started his own business through selling groceries, food items, and soft drinks in a small grocery. The beginning started with a small amount of capital. Thanks to Ahmmed's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise, but his a small grocery lacks of a lot of groceries. 

The profits from this business are a small and not allowing him to expand his sales volume. For the purpose of further developing his business, Ahmmed turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER to buy more of food items, soft drinks and canned food for future sale in his grocery.

Ahmmed plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business further in order to provide his family with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more of food items, soft drinks and canned food for future sale in his grocery.

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan, who is a 43-year-old man, lives in the village of Khutsubani. He has pensioner parents, a wife, a daughter and a son. His children are temporarily unemployed and the only source of income for this six-members family is from agricultural activity. Aslan and his wife work on family-owned land, where they cultivate nuts and mandarins. They use the harvested products for local trading. Also, the family owns one cattle and milking cow and uses its products for feeding the family and also for local trading.
 
Consequently, Aslan generates seasonal income and has a great desire to do more stable business activities on his own. That's why he requested a loan to local financial institutions for starting to work on a bus line. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program makes possible provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Aslan plans to buy a mini-bus and start serving local people. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus and start working on a bus line.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married with six children, four of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling chips, fried chicken and beef at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy irish potatoes, cooking oil, cabbages, beef and charcoal.  She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the cost of electricity. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. She would like to diversify her income by selling snacks. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy irish potatoes, cooking oil, cabbages, beef and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a modern dairy facility.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is an experienced farmer from Aragats village. She lives with her husband and son. 

To take care of her family's needs, Anahit is engaged in the cultivation of potatoes, cabbage and greens. Anahit's family members help her greatly in her daily farming activities; her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market. Anahit and her family also own a grape orchard, which needs some improvements. 

A loan of 1,500 USD will assist her greatly in purchasing potato seeds, polyethylene cover, wires and tomato seeds needed for the farm. As this is Anahit’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support in providing the needed loan.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, polyethylene cover, wires and tomato seeds needed for the farm.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school and are under her care. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanajuma operates a clothes selling business, in which she sells clothes at the market to town residents and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Umugisha Group

texts.en:
Gaudence is a group leader, aged 35. She is married, with five children aged between 11 months and 15 years, three of whom go to school. 

The group is called Umugisha Group, which means 'blessing' in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change for a better future. 

Gaudence sells foodstuffs and she has been in a business for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married, 42 years old, and has seven children who are 22, 20, 18,16,14,12 and ten years old. He lives in a rural setting with his family and he is a farmer who deals in coffee farming. He started the farming business in 1986, and he works six days in a week, eight hours each day. He started this business in order to earn money to have a higher standard of living since he did not go to school. 

He has acquired this loan in order to complete construction of his home so that his children can have decent accommodations.

His customers are traders from the surrounding areas and he hopes to be the leading supplier of coffee in his area, but he still faces the challenge of limited capital and unpredictable weather changes. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man. He appreciates UGAFODE Micro finance services.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion, 62, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a farmer. She manages her own household while operating the business. She and her husband work hard to continually provide income for their daily needs.

Consolacion owns a pineapple farm in the high fertile lands, which is suited to grow fruits and vegetables, with its cool climate. Pineapple is one of the favorite and nutritious fruits from the Philippines. She sells her product to the town market and fruit stalls that she regularly supplies, and to the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm supplies for a more productive harvest. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her hard work and investment and for the financial help that will be given to her. Her earnings are a big help in providing daily sustenance.

Consolacion dreams to expand her business by buying another lot for her farm, so that she can be able to save for old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Erkinbubu

texts.ru: Эркинбубу, 54 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. Эркинбубу в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Эркинбубу, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы, 20 овец, 2 лошади, также она выращивает на собственном участке мерою 4,34 ГА фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка и 6 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и построить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Erkinbubu is 54 years old, married, and she has four children.  She works in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this field 14 years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, she has come to the point where she currently owns four cows, 20 sheep and two horses.  She also grows beans on 4.34 hectares of her own land.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy a young bull and six sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase one calf and six sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Arpenik

texts.en:
Arpenik lives in Aragats village and is engaged in agriculture. She cultivates potatoes, haricot and greens and sells the agricultural products in the market, which is very important source of income for her. 

To sustain and develop her agribusiness, Arpenik needs a loan to purchase potato seeds, polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse. As this is Arpenik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Arpenik highly relies on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, bricks, and sand, to build a bathroom for the house.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Maragarit is from Arshaluys village, Armavir region. She lives with her husband and twin sons who are 21 years old. Her daughter is married and lives separately with her own family. 

To be able to meet her family's needs, Margarit is engaged in land cultivation. Her husband and sons help her sell the gathered wheat, potatoes, cabbage and greens. To be able to run the farming business in a sustainable way, Margarit needs a loan to purchase polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, potato seeds and flower seeds. With the help of the loan, her agribusiness will become more productive. 

As this is Margarit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Margarit and her husband will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support in providing the needed loan.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, potato seeds and flower seeds.
